HhrqUcGEPej2tp95zZWtdA.review_text: Last time I was here was about 10 years ago.  I had a great dinner meal then.  Today, I was nothing but largely disappointed!  I ordered the crab cakes, which were nothing but filler; the calamari, just crunchy batter; and it's been 40 minutes since we ordered our entrees and they still haven't been served.  10 years ago, I remembered having the best choppino in my life!  The prices haven't changed, but the food has gone done the tubes!  I won't be back.  Our server was great!  But, the bartender and hostess were another story.  Perhaps there's a romance between the two.  Don't care, not supposed to be apart of the dinning experience.  I will never come back!

nmrxTK4y3JDoJ7di6wpS1w.review_text: I took my first vacation in a long time to San Francisco, and my girlfriend and I ate here for our first night in town. After the meal, I had to actively check to make sure that my plane had not fallen out of the sky, crashed into a hillside, and killed everyone on board; after eating here, I thought I had died and gone to food heaven.  We arrived around 7:00 pm on a Saturday night, and the place was packed to the rafters. However, in spite of that, we were seated promptly (inside of 5 minutes). Our waitress was attentive and came to the table frequently, but not so often that it became creepy. Refills on drinks came quickly; we never ran dry at the table.  For our appetizers, my girlfriend ordered a Caesar salad, while I ordered the "world's-best" clam chowder. The salad was prepared and dressed perfectly, with the lemon in the dressing giving the salad that one last missing element. To me, this is one sign of a stellar restaurant - take the classics, maybe put a small spin on them, and execute them flawlessly. As for my chowder, I am always skeptical when something is advertised as the "world's best," but this particular dish did not disappoint. This chowder was as good or better than any I'd ever had on the East Coast, and was delicious from the first spoonful to the last.  Our entrees came out shortly thereafter, and they did not disappoint either. My girlfriend got the salmon, while I ordered the Yellowfin Tuna. First of all, both fish were cooked perfectly, but what blew me away were the portion sizes. Both my girlfriend and myself received huge portions of fish, to the point where we both stuffed ourselves stupid in order to eat them. Sadly, we saved no room for dessert.  The only drawback of this meal would be the price; it was rather expensive ($60 per person, including tip). However, I didn't have a problem with that price, as the food my girlfriend and I received was worth every penny.  My meal at Scoma's was one of the best meals I have ever had. The food was fantastic, the service was excellent, and while the price was high, I didn't mind paying extra for such quality. If you are a fan of seafood, this place should be on your list of must-visits when you visit Fisherman's Wharf.

h5iQ7WfXFq7IRlGDNooxPQ.review_text: So, this place was our second dinner, but it should have been a choice for a regular dinner. We were in Fisherman's wharf and we wouldn't be back before our vacation ended, so we decided to stop off here for one specific dish.   We really wanted Cioppino. It is really freaking GOOD. omg. Maybe a little pricey, but worth every penny. I don't really have a comparison though, but it was just that AMAZING.   DO IT. It is filled with all kinds of delicious seafood. Scallops, shrimp, crab, mussels... I could go on, but I won't.  The restaurant had a wait, so we decided to dine at the bar. The bartender was great! He accidentally threw away my friends invisalign, but was very apologetic.

-dZ3dAtWdo1wodvZ094LBw.review_text: Superb.  Took my mom here for her birthday, and even came here for mine.  Fixe Price Lunch is always great. Seafood is extremely fresh. The dishes themselves have always been prepared well.  Staff is friendly and professional.  The only knock I gave from the five stars it should have is the price. Otherwise, I'd come again anytime I could

AWye-gCYuGO4oqYN2IrMbQ.review_text: The food: Scoma's is where you go for non pretentious, deliciously fresh seafood. Since there are so many reviews, I'll keep this short; unless you have a particular fish or seafood that you love (salmon, shrimp, etc.) you should go with the more mixture based dishes like the Shellfish Saute or the Cioppino- both absolutely delicious and top notch quality.  The good: You can really go to Scoma's in jeans and a dress shirt and you'll blend right in with the tourists. Servers are all nicely clad in ties and crisp white shirts, and everything from the fresh sourdough to the ocean smelling seafood is absolutely worth the higher price.  The bad: It's a long wait with no reservations taken, so get there early! Also, the desserts are meh but that's ok because they're not the main attraction.  Ambiance: Comfortable Italian restaurant. The focus is the food!  What to know: this is a place tourists are aware of, so beware going for dinner on weekend nights! If you're lucky enough to grab a table by the bar, you can munch on appetizers or enjoy some drinks to survive the wait.  Good for: family, friends, and out of towners.   In short: Scoma's serves super fresh and tasty sea food for a slightly hefty but very worth it place. One of my go to's for bay area vacations!

bW2USanomtJ7WHbpdbpX9w.review_text: I'm going to start out by saying how excited my wife and I were to eat here after hearing good things. Soon as we met our waitress "CC" we felt discriminated against.  She takes our drinks order with is water since neither of us drink. After that it was just insulting.  As she walks back with a plate of food to serve the people behind us she stops and says "this is our crab sandwich and it's only 23.99". I was like ok.  She comes back to take our order and without us saying anything to provoke her she only goes over the appetizers, so that's all we order and not once does she ask if we want anything besides appetizers.  Everyone else she serves around us she goes over the entire menu and gives them more options and is very informative.  After our food she only offers us coffee and others dessert.  Our words with her were very limited and we basically let her treat us like peasants not good enough to eat at her restaurant.  Now I must add we were dressed casual the same as everyone else and have absolutely no idea why she would treat us this way.  We by far are not sensitive people and I come from a background of a food service family and am hardly ever critical but CC was very insulting and classless. Wouldn't recommend this establishment to anyone.

sjUTGmYB3XB7EHvrGX2zyA.review_text: Went to SF in August with my hubby and this place was recommended by my boss. I had the crab, my husband had the burger. We were both thrilled with our selections. The view is great, though it was kind of weird to find it all the way at the end of a row of boat slips. Service was on-par, and they even offer you any recipes of your favorite dishes to take home!

FUFIzjgUpGZP6UYJJ10MEw.review_text: So we walked around for 20 minutes looking at different reviews around the area of fisherman's wharf. After a diligent search we found this place. Very rare I give 5 stars but this deserves it.   First- ask for David to serve you. He'll take good care of you!  1- get the oyster platter.  2- Jordan 2003 is still a great wine and I've paid twice the amount at other places  3- the green salad is awesome! 4- get the lobster

uEvusDwoSymbJJ0auR3muQ.review_text: The hubby and I celebrated his birthday here many moons ago before kids, so our nostalgic visit back was nice.  This old school charming seafood restaurant is tricky to get to.  You walk down a little alley just off Fisherman's Wharf. Some seating areas are tight so if you can get a booth try to do so.  Views of the wharf are nice.  Waiter's have been here forever!  White tablecloth service but down home atmosphere.  We brought the kids and a kids menu was available.  We didn't have much time so we ordered just a few items.  If you come here at least taste the Clam chowder, oh my!  And for goodness sake, have some crab cakes!   They have a sister restaurant in Sausalito, a ferry will take you there. A must if you're in the bay area!

RTcuhbxDIWFBUN335JPhsw.review_text: Scoma's is a nice old time restaurant.  We decided to go to try their Cioppino.  The place sits right on the water.  We ordered the Clam Chowder, Cioppino, and Garlic Crab.    The chowder was very tasty and had a lot of clams.  The cioppino was very good.  They cracked all the crab shells so you could enjoy the crab meat without all the work.  The cioppino had a nice flavor but was a little too thick for me.  The garlic crab has a good flavor with the garlic and lemon.  It was very fresh.  This is a good place for a family to go and enjoy some fresh seafood!

zp-VvZl661XVEeKnFpv5FA.review_text: Delicious lobster ravioli and lobster bisque! So good we ordered it twice before leaving!! Wait wasn't too long--about 15 minutes around 5:30pm dinner time. Would definitely come back if I'm ever in the area.

_kN-YGPzrh94XT_PvQPE4A.review_text: My family and I really enjoyed scomas. They have great seafood and the cioppino was delicious! Every plate was a hefty size plate and we will definitely return again. Only downside was that its not really a kid friendly place but definitely great for a night out with friends or date night.

QfgI7R2VU_50oChVdrsJ0Q.review_text: We have been coming to San Francisco for years and never tried Scomas and am I sorry we didn't find this place sooner. I had the Seafood Diplomatica which was wonderful and my husband had the mixed grill, which he loved. The waiter we had was very good and the food was outstanding. I also had the clam chowder which was great but my husband had the lobster bisque and said it was the best he ever had. It is pricey but the food is worth it. For any special occasion I would highly recommend this restaurant.

gB2yyRhYZJN24dHOQeOQ0w.review_text: This was a recommended restaurant by a couple we met at the airport and I wish I could thank them for such a great recommendation. San Francisco was first point on our honeymoon and we wanted to have a nice, romantic dinner so we made reservations at this place. It sits on a pier and does not look like much, but the food was phenomenal. My husband does not really eat fish, but he had local cod which he enjoyed very much. I had salmon caught by Scoma's own boat, which was magnificant. We also shared a bottle of Scoma's brand wine which was pretty good and we received a complimentary dessert since we were on our honeymoon. The place is pricey, but every bit worth it. The wait staff is very curtious and professional and a poster child for how a waiter should look and behave. My husband collects pint glasses and asked the waiter how he can get a glass with their name on it. The waiter said that he will see what he can do and gave him the glass for free. This was a great start to our honeymoon!

N4z5DoPKQyU-6iCnMTvjaA.review_text: This review is based off of my experience from a few years ago, but the lasting impression and impressive food make my 5-start rating justified.   I went to Scoma's a few years back. Since then, i've recommended many friends, colleagues and family members to stop by and all have left impressed by the quality of food and overall experience. Each time I've mentioned the restaurant, i've told people about how our waiter essentially punked me and my table-mates into our order. The waiter came by, looked at our indecisive faces and told us what we were gong to eat. It wasn't a reccomendation... he told us what we were going to eat. Obviously taken back by it, my uncle who is a repeat customer indicated that this is normal (I still think that's a lie) and that we'd enjoy the meal or he would foot the bill. Damned if it wasn't the best seafood pasta i'd ever eaten. The quality of food was fresh and top notch. The restaurant is very busy, so reservations are a must and I would recommend nicer attire. I can't wait to go back and enjoy my next meal there... whatever it is that the waiter feels like ordering for me.

lDs5thze5vNWoXGUc3lcAQ.review_text: The food was soooo bad... One of the entrees we ordered after more than 2 hours of wait was crab risotto and I couldn't eat more than one spoon of it. It was too sweet and weird. Most of the ingredients were green beans rather than crab meat or rice. The appetizers weren't good either.   I've lived in the area for more than four years so I know the kinds of good fancy seafood that I like, but the food here was nowhere near the standards.   Also, I asked for the bill after making it CLEAR that we weren't getting dessert, but the waiter nevertheless brought the dessert menu INSTEAD OF the bill. Then he asks us if we were getting coffee. Thinking that what he brought us was the bill, it totally looked as if the coffee was complimentary and as if he was apologizing for the 2 hour wait we had to go through after being told that the wait would be only 45 minutes -- so we asked for coffee. Seconds later we realized to our dismay that we didn't get the bill from him yet, and the coffee was going to be charged on the bill, so I actually had to walk up to our waiter to cancel the order for coffee. How not classy...... We all felt like we were tricked into paying more.. it may have been his small mistake of the day but there's only so much you can tolerate after being ripped off in terms of time and money.  In sum, if I ask for the bill and say no to the dessert menu then I want the bill, not the dessert menu. Give me what I ask for and don't give me what I clearly and loudly refused.

fF0bQM6YHyPHcdxJkMKtFw.review_text: This restaurant is completely overrated and over priced! Besides for the mediocre food, the waitress, Lori, seemed only interested in getting us through our meal quickly to turn the table.   Certainly the location is beautiful, and the environment inviting, but the food and service were far from warranting the high stars or cost, ($120 w/out alcohol) that we reviewed on Yelp.   With so many great options to choose from on the Wharf, we'd recommended a food cart vendor for $30 rather then return to Scoma's with disappointment.

_BHTC7nyCBoZcfiiD5cOXg.review_text: In business since 1965, this family-owned-and-operated restaurant is still one of the best and most popular on Fisherman's Wharf. Not much - if anything -  has been done to the decor in the past twenty years, but you come here for the food, not the ambiance. Think seafood with an Italian flair. For starters, share an order of calamari Calabrese-style, fried in a spicy tomato and red pepper sauce with mushrooms, and Dungeness crab cakes, prepared with a minimal amount of breading and served with a zesty remoulade. Pasta orders are huge and best shared, unless you intend one as your main course. Among my favorites is smoked salmon, rock shrimp, and red onion in a dill-cream sauce on a bed of fettucine. If they're in season, order the sand dabs, lightly grilled and served with lemon butter. The cioppino is sensational. Most entrees include fresh vegetables. Sauteed dishes are served with rice, while broiled or grilled dishes are served with pasta. Prices are very high, but portions are so overwhelmingly large that you'll be toting home enough for a second meal. As much as I'd like to award it a full five stars, their aggravating no-reservation policy means a very long wait to be seated, no matter the time of day, and the place is always so crowded, service can be brusque, out of necessity more than intention. Still, this is the best reason to come to the area, and the one place I always take out-of-town guests. (Note: there's a calmer atmosphere at the Sausalito location - yelp.com/biz_details/c/P… - where reservations are accepted.)

SgqocLuiOoIP5jB46KKQIA.review_text: There are so many crappy tourist restaurants around the wharf and I am happy to say this is NOT one of them. I have been going here for years with my motorcycle buds. This was the first trip where I had my wife, her brother and his wife.   I just sat back and enjoyed them all taking in the atmosphere at Scoma's. It was cold and raining when we arrived. Like always, there is a short wait for a table.We found a bar room table and enjoyed their no nonsense drinks.  Our food server was Chinese with a great sense of humor. He was an old fashioned, professional server. I memorized all of our orders, made sure our drink were in order and then brought us a perfect meal.  I have always left Scoma's with the feeling that I got wonderful value for my money. But, more than that, we always have a wonderful restaurant experience. They know how to do it right!

5QeKxchNNRDmD50447Q_-A.review_text: Unbelievable fresh fresh salmon!  Delicious lobster bisque!  Beautiful views!  Amazing waiter (tony)!  Just the best! Even the bussers were so impressive and prompt!  Worth every penny!

A7JhhoAPMuY9sA8yRho4tg.review_text: After hearing about this place since the last time my boyfriend and I were in the bay, we have been wanting to come here for months now! We finally were able to make the trip here this weekend for my our 4 year anniversary. Hehe. :) We came here for lunch after an Alcatraz tour. I like how the restaurant is located away from all the craziness on Jefferson St. Makes the dining experience a bit more relaxing.   My boyfriend ordered the cracked whole Dungeness crab, clam chowder and a Cesar salad. I ordered the lobster ravioli. Lobster ravioli was delicious. Even though there were only about 7 pieces of ravioli, they were about twice the size of other raviolis at other restaurants. It was creamy, not too heavy and even came with a piece of the lobster tail. At first, I thought it was just for decorations, but the tail still had delicious and fresh meat attached to it. The clam chowder and Cesar salad were also very delicious and flavorful. Definitely not your usual soup and salad that tastes like it was just thrown together with not much effort in making it different. I wish I had good taste buds to be able to pick out what made it different. But just know that I think you won't be disappointed! I think the best part of this meal though, is the crab! It was a good size crab, served chilled and had so much meat in it! It seemed like my boyfriend kept pulling good size pieces of meat out of each leg. I love crab and have always had it at Chinese restaurants. Those crabs don't compare to this one! Didn't even need to add any sauces or lemons.   Service was also great. Very attentive, friendly and quick, but we did eat at a slower time. However, I definitely will come here again the next time I'm in town. Nothing like eating fresh seafood at the pier in San Francisco. :)

PTrfkLyyhjmoDq5xUtC_ow.review_text: I love food. I have no problem paying a high price for good food. This place was not good food for a ridiculous price. I will start with the positive. The clam chowder my mom ordered was really good borderline great. By far the best thing I had tonight. The other good dish was the cioppino. Tasty but I have had just as good elsewhere for less money.  This is where the good news ends for the food. I started with the lobster bisque myself and it was bland. Edible but for 10$ a cup I had higher expectations. The entree I ordered, which the waiter assured me was very good, was the prawns and scallop alla Gannon. I absolutely hated this dish. In fact I found it insulting. It came out looking like someone just threw it together. There is zero creativity in this dish and the only flavor is garlic. The vegetables looked and tasted like they were reheated frozen from a bag. The mashed potatoes, garlic of course, were like glue and there was a pile of rice under the whole mess. The "stars" of the dish should have been the scallops and the shrimp. While the scallops were cooked decently they had been overpowered with garlic and butter. The shrimp were overcooked and tough. For this I paid 38$?!?!  I expect this quality from a cheap chain restaurant and know for a fact I could cook better than this at home which is where I should have stayed. As for the place itself The location is fine but the decor is outdated and crowded the waiter was friendly enough but rather inattentive. I do not think I have had a more disappointing restaurant experience in my  whole life. My suggestion is try the chowder and hit the road or skip it altogether and spend your hard earned money on one of the other myriads of dining establishments that have not fallen asleep at the wheel.

4pycaclT4sJi3ylXV9hoqw.review_text: This review makes up for all the years in the past before Yelp was invented...  Consistently delicious! Wild King Salmon , fish & chips were delicious!  Service always welcoming & tentative. Great for lunch & dinner. Reservations recommended.

1u3fWu8mwoYngz1sevTeTg.review_text: Mediocre food . Casual atmosphere. Went there for anniversary. Not as romantic as I thought it would be. Wait staff seemed like a bunch of untrained rookies and were not very knowledgable about the way a high end restaurant should operate. Tourist trap that will be avoided in the future. Food quality and experience definitely does not match the prices.

RTCUwgU6XzAXcTrQTbZpwg.review_text: Great seafood restaurant tucked away near the fisherman's wharf.  I would recommend trying the SCOMA'S SHELLFISH SAUTÉ SEC which is the following:  Scallops, Baby Lobster, Shrimp, Dungeness Leg Meat sautéed with Mushroom, Lemon, Garlic, Tomato-Cream

4FE8md9fMr_jZFNbcOmHsQ.review_text: Cioppino. Seafood. Nice, cozy restaurant. Scenic location, near Fisherman's Wharf.

SGnqMkPh2OmOXJV59tzKZg.review_text: As a native San Franciscan, Scoma's has been a family favorite for years.  A special occasion type of place, usually come here with large parties.  The mother in law is in town and loves this place, so we came here for her birthday dinner with a party of 9.  They don't take reservations, so with a large party you need to get here early.  We got there at 5:30, was seated at 6:10 on a Thursday.  As typical, ordered a variety of dishes.  3 ordered the pasta diplomatica, a couple of crab cakes, a cippiono, and I had the lamb.  They have "Dine about town" special for $35 that includes an appetizer, entree and dessert.  Considering most entrees are $30-$35, that's a great value.  The food, especially the seafood was good.  Portions are large and the service outstanding.  Water glasses are always full.  Waitress cut and served our birthday cake for us.  Its expensive, but you expect that.  Still, a solid choice for a special occasion dinner after all the years.

LXU5DNadcKcHroqZfWL5kg.review_text: The outside isn't much to look at, but don't let it fool you....this place is fantastic! After being disappointed by multiple restaurants near the wharf, my husband and I decided to give this place a try. Both the clam chowder and lobster bisque were excellent. Not only was the food delicious, our waitress was very friendly and helpful! It is a little pricey, but not much more than other restaurants near by, and this one is far superior!

_aqB4nj2hnRmWM56tAmS2Q.review_text: Really good seafood. Nice service. Had a lot of fun.

Snn3AGqWvV08kjLnDei0fQ.review_text: Made reservations for 6:15 for 5 pax. Went in at 6:05pm and I asked the hostess how long is the wait, she confidently replied, "...at 6:15pm" And I thought to myself, wow, seriously? OK..then, I stepped aside and waited. 5, 6, 10, 15, 20, 30, 35, 47 minutes later, I got my table. Then, I asked her, "what happened to my 6:15 on the dot table ready comment? And she said, "it happens..." So much for a great impression.  Sat down at the table and waited by a server promptly and he said something about the specials which I didn't hear very well. Anyways, ordered the food, waited for about 10 minutes, food came. The only thing that's worth mentioning is their famous Lazy Man's Cioppino..not because it's so fabulous, IT WAS HORRIBLE !!! They got their name right, so damn LAZY ! They don't even bother cooking the tomato sauce properly. To me, it was just a bottle of Prego dumped into the pot, stirred a little (please note that the sauce was not even hot, it was....luke warm), then, throw in the seafood.  Unless you're up for some "..a-little-better-than-microwave-tv-dinner.." type of food with HIGH price. GO TO SCOMA'S ! The rest of the food, cod, seafood platter, clam chowder and fried oysters, go to Red Lobster or Sizzler instead...  The only reason why I give 1 star is because of the view.  Good luck

f641mHQCC_DgBcgFJPQfpQ.review_text: Four stars is generous...  A+ when it comes to food B- for the service

GY2H5zsOs8AlFidWidw3Gg.review_text: This place surprised me. A bit old fashioned but good food and 5 star service. Especially when you consider a lot of the other mediocre places around the area.

qpd7G_CzpGfHrTxvdX0TFg.review_text: -The Oyster Alla Scoma is the best dish there.  -The mix shellfish is okay.  -The sea food(shrimp,  oyster, and scallop) is fine, not super fresh but not bad.  -The service is really good.  -And the desert - - tiramisu and brownie with vanilla ice cream is good.  -There's one thing I'm really confused about - - we need to pay 4% surcharge for the employee's healthy and welfare. I've never been charged for that kind of fee before, and this is the first time and I don't know why.   Two words for this restaurant - - not special.

MiuY-2LZIdCjhZRVf34AJQ.review_text: My wife and I, along with another couple, had dinner at Scoma's at 6:00pm on a Saturday.  The food was fresh and tasty, obviously high quality ingredients.  Beyond that, the meal and overall experience was just "okay".  For what we paid, it didn't feel like we received a very good value.  No real complaints, per se, but probably wouldn't return.

m5CB1I83-r3bB2o4vqIAkg.review_text: Thanks to our friend to make us knowing this restaurant. The fried calamari appetizers, the salmon cake, the crab risotto and grilled fish were absolutly delicious. The service is very appreciable and efficient, and the White Scoma's Reserve Wine was delicious.

Wmh9vK9LX-sxeuTb6vzM2A.review_text: Scoma's is one of the rare places where I've had an expensive meal and thought it was definitely worth it. Granted, I've been twice and didn't pay either time but it was still really good, some of the best cooked seafood I've ever had. Service is a bit slow but this is the kind of place you want to have a long meal at anyway. This was apparently my grandmother's favorite restaurant back in the day and I can see why.  The Oysters Rockefeller are amazingggg. I normally don't love this dish as much as I do here. So, so tasty. Crab stuffed mushroom is also a favorite.  The first time I came here I had the Alaskan Halibut Siciliana, which was perfectly cooked and so flavorful.   The second time had the Mixed Shellfish Sautee and Oh my goodness was that amazing. It comes with prawns, scallops, crab meat and lobster - ridiculous amounts and again cooked perfectly. Well worth the price. This dish was huge and delicious.   I've also tried (through people that I was eating with) the Lobster Ravioli, Prawns and Scallops Alla Gannon and the steamed clams platter. Not to be repetitive but all were amazing as well.   Pro tip: go later if you can, at ~9:30 pm. They don't take reservations and for obvious reasons this place is crazy popular but by this time it seems like there's not really a wait. Tried it out on a Thursday and a Saturday.

iCYiQLmnGriuxbpN_MWq6Q.review_text: TRIPLE YUMMILISCIOUS!!! Very Romantic Dinner with Scot ... Lobster and Salmon were wonderful and the service was AMAZING! The view from the table was GREAT near the San Francisco Bay with the moonlight shining down upon the calm waters. You can also dress up although it is not required and they have a coat check in area too! LOVE SCOMA'S in Beautiful San Francisco! Posting pics of the food , drinks and location!

FFNbIFieCFnEKelKAcaibw.review_text: My husband and I ate lunch here last year on a short trip to SF. We had done some morning sightseeing and major walking and really wanted some delicious and fresh SF seafood. Scoma's was out of the way and almost off a dock on the water behind the main action of Fisherman's Wharf. We chose the restaurant based on Yelp reviews and boy were we happy with our research results! The pacific oysters were INSANE! So incredibly fresh and delicious! Best oysters I've ever had! Decadent Swordfish Con Fagioli and wine! The service was fantastic even though we weren't dressed up. I felt like we fit in. We wanted to stay and sit a while because the atmosphere was so comfortable. Upon entering and leaving Scoma's we walked directly past the small building where they clean and prepare the "just caught" seafood!

v4OSDIDxgwqpa4bvH4QIqg.review_text: Nothing sucked, nothing was great. The simplest dishes were the best. Steamed dungeness crab, raw oysters on the half shell. Even the steamed broccoli and cauliflower were adequate.  But the swordfish piccata and pasta dishes were overcooked and gloppy. Hardly any flavor at all, and even a couple squeezes of lemon and liberal application of salt and pepper shaker could not cure their blandness. The garlic in the sautéed spinach was overcooked and bitter.  Ingredients seemed to be freshly prepared (except the swordfish which was obviously frozen) but the kitchen staff apparently had a production line training and mentality.   The service was friendly and efficient. Too bad the food at this place is far below premium seafood restaurants elsewhere. We will not go back.

XFGqNlqKAaaNFxrpkyMN5g.review_text: Scomas - 4 Stars: a nice old find in San Francisco - on Pier 47 at Fisherman's Wharf. Opened in 1965, we first had dinner there in 1974, long before the internet arrived; returned for the fourth time, on June 20, 2012. While the restaurant is a bit dated and the wait staff shows their age, this is still the place to go if you want fresh seafood...emphasis on fresh. The food is still the draw and well worth the visit. We'll be back again. Recommended.

iahyDjVaVCU6O6Lsnmollg.review_text: Super romantic and the food is fresh and good!!! We ate here while touring fishrmans Warf!! Who doesn't like eating on a boat! A boat with good food! It's s very charming restaurant!! Old skool style ;)

-mTVPMopYEhcUuOL1fX2Fw.review_text: We visited Scoma's on Dine About.  We arrived at 5:25 for a 5:30 reservation and at 6:00 we were still waiting, thanks to air-headed hostess.  As we were preparing to leave the "elevated window table" we had been promised at last became available.  Our table was one of the worst in the house, we were stuck in the Ken Venturi Room between 2 Canadian parties. Our waiter was inattentive and did not even know the word service. He was horrible and could barely fit in the tiny closet we were stuck in. He kept brushing against me and I just wanted to go home and bathe. The food was excellent, but we will never return to Scoma's due to deplorable service issues. After posting this review I learned that 1 of our party actually became sick from the food. To be fair, the Bartenders were pleasantly efficient and the Valet was fantastic.

ET8n-r7glWYqZhuR6GcdNw.review_text: Some may call it a tourist trap, but when a restaurant stays open for 50 years, it's for a reason. And that reason may just be their clam chowder. Best ever. I was so grateful that I opted for a bowl rather than a cup because I would have been super sad with a smaller serving. The delicious broth was filled with large, tender pieces of clam. I've never had another clam chowder like it. I don't think I ever will, unless I'm back at Scoma's.  Man cannot live on chowder alone so we also ordered an appetizer that consisted of shrimp dusted in cornmeal and lightly fried. Pretty good, definitely fresh, but not up there with the chowder.   The restaurant is definitely on the hilarious side of outdated but I think they are looking to retain some of their old school charm, and that's fine by me. Since I'm not sure if anything else could live up to the chowder I might just keep this spot as a light lunch destination while in San Francisco.

lp2f1viw61OKUTs7z08ecQ.review_text: This restaurant was recommended to us by our hotels manager, who was kind enough to make us a reservation later in the evening.  This is a nice little restaurant at the Wharf with great views of the city.  When we first arrived, we went to check in while the rest of the family was around the corner on their way.  They said they had a table ready, but wouldn't let us sit down until everyone was there.  Kind of disappointed because we ended up losing our table after we told them they would be here in two minutes.  We were seated in a small room with about 5 other tables, of course tight on space which is pretty annoying.  The menu was packed full of delicious food, though a little pricey.  But you get what you pay for, delicious dinner meals and deserts.  Recommend to try the Jack Daniels cake for desert.  The waiter was friendly, prompt and knowledgeable with everything on the menu.  Overall would come back for dinner here again, but would make sure to make reservations well in advance.

rxi66uVFxghqaO6qu3DWDA.review_text: "I need to have crab legs and clam chowder while we are here in SF!" exclaimed my beautiful wife. Alrighty Yelp, be my guide, help me find the way! Hmmm, The Fanciscan Crab Restaurant at Fisherman's Wharf looks like prospect. Made reservations, headed out to Fisherman's Wharf, parked in the main lot like an idiotic tourist and walked to The Franciscan or so we thought. "The dumb GPS says it's right here!" There was nothing there, just an alley. The GPS lied, Yelp lied! We kept walking and lo and behold, Scoma's!  We had no reservations, but lucky for us, they seated us really quickly.   I ordered the Prix Fixe Menus: starter of a small cup of clam chowder and a small side of caesar salad=5 entree of Blackened Prawns over Pasta Vodka; Brown Rice Penne Pasta, Pancetta, Tito's Vodka Sauce=5 desert of vanilla ice cream and warm brownie=5  My wife ordered 1/2 a crab, guess what? She ended up eating half my food! If you go on a date, guys, make sure you order the whole crab and pretend that you're Diamond Jim, you'll impress her, but in actuality she won't be eating your food!

US7Ol4LW5-lCg8qwXmEEOQ.review_text: Great little spot. Nice to go after a bike ride accross the GG bridge, a bit expensive however. bring a jacket if you want to sit outside.

53d4qjoAw3XVlFbpfRS5TQ.review_text: I was somewhat skeptical about going, after reading some of the negative reviews. The  Scoma Seafood Saute was incredible - I am so glad I went! Great food, service and location.

V2TCCue6lWUR3NQwKsJ87w.review_text: OMG! this place is heaven!  their lazy man's cioppino was hugeeee and full of yummynessss.. fish, shrimp, scallops, clams.. yummmss...  i first tried their cioppino at the location in sausalito but it does not come closeeee to this location.. it is much bigger! and who doesnt like more of the best cioppino ever!  They have a pre fix menu with 3 course.. I would not recommend as the portions were smaller than regular entrees but if your partner is ordering a lazy cioppino then there is nothing to worry about because it will feed the both of you and have left overs...  I asked for an extra bowl so I could share my cioppino and they even gave us an extra piece of butter bread to dip in the cioppino... :))))  I am in love with this place and will look forward to making a trip back to SF to go thereeeee...

eyZMVULSReESQsweVBrrZw.review_text: Great ambiance, killer view, friendly and professional service, and fresh seafood.  This place is a great combination of the best of Fisherman's Wharf.  They have a happy hour at the bar that features several good appetizers, worth trying them all!

6O8NjN3o3K9UcMdVntT-7Q.review_text: *** For all of you seafood lovers out there ***  Scoma's is a hidden gem within Fisherman's Wharf. Nestled in a little back lot off of Al Scoma Way, this place can be tricky to spot if you're not paying attention. If you do drive there, the parking is strictly valet unless you park on the street.   The decor gives off almost a boathouse type of vibe. Depending on where you're sitting you can catch small glimpses of the city or the bay. The service here is excellent, they are friendly, knowledgeable of the menu, and very attentive.  I highly recommend the Spice Crusted Salmon and Shrimp Cake as a starter. Cooked to perfection with just the right amount of crisp, you catch both the salmon and shrimp flavors with each bite. For an entree I recommend the Scoma's Shellfish Saute which is an assortment of shellfish (2 Lobster Tails, Jumbo Prawns, Large Scallops,  and Dungeness Crab meat) served over penne pasta, rice pilaf and a vegetable medley in a buttery wine sauce. This is the epitome of perfection. Each savory bite is filled with sweet decadent flavors of the shellfish. Whenever we dine here I can never bring myself to order anything else. The Saute is a winner and worth every penny.  Whether you consider this a touristy spot or not, it's definitely a must if you're craving fresh, delicious seafood. It's a bit on the pricier side so I wouldn't say this is a go to every time you're in the area but it's definitely a great spot for a nice intimate dinner or special occasions.

_jg7sgGBRKiW3PZoep0-oQ.review_text: I went here for a friend's Birthday lunch celebration. Most of us got the lunch prefixed menu. Which was Clam Chowder Soup or Salad, an Entree (either NY Aged Steak, Scallops, Crab Salad, and another dish).  $24.95. Mimosas were $8 and mojitos were $11 (typical restaurant price)  The clam chowder soup was delicious. It was in a small cup, but just enough. It had a lot of clams. I was really impressed & satisfied.  I requested my steak to be Medium Rare - and it came out just as I wanted. It was although a bit dry at the ends, and tasteless. We asked for A1 sauce to save the day ! (:   Then there was the chocolate dessert. It was pretty yummy with an oreo crust.  The menu was really expensive - but it is off the pier. I like how it felt as if we were in a boat inside. We were in a private room, away from the entrance - which was nice.

Rdt-JiAN7Qlw3dJ7UVdNtw.review_text: While we were at Fisherman's Grotto Yelping places, Scoma's came up and we decided on this spot.  We walked down here and had about a fifteen minute wait to be seated. We waited outside near the water and took pictures and enjoyed the weather.. There is an intercom outside so you can hear when they call your name which is nice so you don't have to just sit around inside doing NOTHING.  We were seated in the back of the restaurant next to the window with a nice outside view. We get a round of drinks and then start with a half dozen oysters on the half shell. These were very good! Personally I can't really taste the difference between different oysters but I know when they are BAD. And these weren't.  Next we move onto the whole Dungeness Crab! We get it steamed plain (you can get garlic steamed or something too) and it is served with warm drawn butter. I usually don't use butter with my crab but I did this time and it was QUITE delicious!! Half of the crab was cracked so it made it VERY easy to eat and the other half wasn't for some reason... I would have given FIVE stars if it had been.  At the end of the meal they gave us warm towels to wipe our hands with and lemons to clean off the crabbiness!

-4B1rRNS18CcA7duD2tp9A.review_text: This was the best restaurant that we have been to.  The service was amazing.  Someone always coming by and clearing off dirty plates and refilling drinks.  The food was the best seafood I have ever had.  Everyone was so nice.  We requested a table by the window and that's where we were seated.  The restaurant was totally filled and they still were on top of everything.  They even gave us a piece of complimentary cheesecake for our anniversary.  Would definitely return there.

aHEaxb8_vJbEWb5Do06Ixw.review_text: We were really lucky and got seated within ten minutes for brunch. I saw people lined up after us.  Bread was good and food was good. Service, not so much. I had to look for our server twice.  Overall, I enjoyed it.

sBQHJzPlQYVdwjEeqtvgrQ.review_text: Situated in the heart of San Francisco's Fisherman's Wharf, Scoma's provides a romantic waterfront setting, along with a lovely selection of pasta and seafood dishes that create a fitting menu for Scoma's ambiance. The complimentary bread appetizer, as well as other appetizer choices, along with the wine selection, further makes Scoma's a great restaurant for a romantic dinner with a date or an intimate dinner with a small group of friends.  Another plus is that Scoma's provides free valet parking which is a definite benefit in the area.

I7TQJq7cn8TmQgoDZNS4Ug.review_text: We came here after a wine cruise out in the bay.  After properly boozed and cruised, Matt B. suggested that we come to Scoma because it has really good cioppino.   Indeed!  The cioppino was delicious.  The broth was flavorful and the tomato wasn't overpowering, masking the freshness (and saltiness) of the seafood.  I enjoyed the cioppino here because it's "lazy man's" cioppino, meaning that there was absolutely no hands on work.  No cracking open crab shells, no pulling shrimps out by the tails.   The service was friendly and the water glasses were constantly refilled.  The wait was definitely long for a Sunday night, but we wouldn't expect anything less from this touristy place!   We also had their rich and creamy lobster bisque - very tasty as well.  Actually, I prefer the lobster bisque over the cioppino simply because I enjoy creamier soups!

CK-9yOBxEwXcS6efJM8lTg.review_text: A while back I ate at Scoma's and had an inconsistent experience, but since that time I recently returned and our dinner was much better.  I would go back again for the fresh seafood they are known for.

MrHOzab16pg4EGFHyoROPA.review_text: Excellent! I ordered the mixed shellfish entree. It was a very large portion of shrimp, scallops, crab, and lobster. The seafood is right off the boat fresh, and their prices are very reasonable considering the quality and amount of food they give you. Also, they have free valet so you don't have to worry about finding parking. Overall, great experience!

hZo9zjadQWsbZkY1Sr0iPg.review_text: This is a great seafood place. Like pretty much every seafood place across this great nation, the decor is outdated (wood paneling ) the silverware started out formal but has been run through the dishwasher one to any times. And the food options are more originals and old fashion as opposed to more modern cuisine.  With that being said some things don't go out of style and fresh seafood cooked well never does.   I had the scallops in saffron cream sauce. These little puppies were delightful. Nice crispy on the outside with a perfectly grilled crust, moist and juicy on the inside. Some of the best I have ever had.   My wife had the local caught salmon. Man oh man could I have eaten this everyday. The salmon is so stinking good I would call you crazy to order something else.   Ordered the fresh  caught salmon.   Order the fresh caught calamari. Boom best app  Clam chowder...enough said.  Thank me later

S7y4b02kZHy3SzIhSEbG0w.review_text: I food was okay, not worth the price. Though more importantly, it came with a bout of food poisoning. Don't order the swordfish.

oP217-ZV7zgtTQF2O0jd6Q.review_text: A San Francisco Landmark not to be missed! We had a wonderful Mother's Day lunch at one of the oldest establishments in San Francisco. The restaurant is very accomodating when it comes to large parties and children. Our waiter was wonderful, and we never felt rushed. It was as if they wanted us to stay all day...and we did! Thank you for always making our dining experience so wonderful.

azlNapykyOvdl7cEI2wFEw.review_text: Scomas is the best.  There is a reason that they have been here for 50 years in SF.   The best seafood.  Boom.   The lobster bisque is to die for.  I have never had a bad dish.  Do not come Here thinking you will get right in.   There is always a wait.  That's because this is the most popular place on the wharf or anywhere    It's worth the wait and then some.  Anyone who has anything bad to say about this place is a big whiner spoiled baby

-Ih4ezfe150bS0B9tPqxgw.review_text: Incredibly fresh seafood! I had the combo crab and shrimp salad.  The flavor is fresh and tasty. The service... Impeccable.  While the decor is dated, it serves to the overall experience of an established icon of the neighborhood.  Well recommended.

BYgwqKrgcmXwE1kCsdCzTA.review_text: Yum.  Great old SF feel.  Good wines and drinks, really good fresh seafood. This place is a must every time I am back in San Francisco!

ggVZLUj4WIRdE9L3Mgdb3g.review_text: The waiter was very nice and helpful. It was my first time here so I wasn't sure what to order. He asked me what I liked and he basically created a dish off the menu.   I got a fettuccini Alfredo plate with prawns, crab legs and scallops. The seafood was scrumptious. The sauce was lacking. I was very watery and lacked flavor.  I should have taken it back considering how pricey this restaurant is.   The sourdough bread is good but think it could have been warmed given the style of restaurant.

7nJrkjSd9DqBkVgCyXzoMA.review_text: A driver cab suggested this restaurant to us, he said the food is great so we decided to go and give it a try This restaurant is really pricey and the food is not as good as I expected,  I ordered bake cod fish in a butter lemon sauce and I got and oily tasteless fish, we paid $160 for soft drinks, appetizer and entrees.... Was not worth it  I wouldn't go back

zjcSGQUgiCz50LFJoRzd7g.review_text: We loved our meals!! The Shrimp & Crab Louie was excellent. My favorite although is the sandabs. If you have never had them you must try. Buttery smooth and not fishy tasting. The service was very attentive.

VqRKdMSsKfQrmcMdqkDqbw.review_text: Not the place it used to be.  Great for the tourists who don't know better seafood. My "Seafood risotto" was way overcooked bulked up with peas and zucchini, found a few bits of crab along with the prawns.  And no porcini mushrooms, they substitute shitakes.  My friends seafood pasta at $38.00 !!! was a ripoff.  Pasta with a handfull of bay shrimp and prawns and shitake mushrooms. .  Yikes !

4UjS4PxlfrUOATK4eqP3gg.review_text: Clam Chowder is a must...but lobster bisque was great too.  Food was amazing, hands down just amazing.  The price was pretty steep but the service was great and we had a great time!

eMUvk1q9uk1Ni_RQdMtNIA.review_text: We've been coming here for years, and it never disappoints.  Fabulous food, service, and view of the old buildings. Best seafood on the wharf.

c5Wt7ktEQkUDEBXKqphlkQ.review_text: Amazing seafood, even better people that work here what more could you ask for? Oh maybe some old celebrity photos on the wall? Yeah this place has that too. If you are eating here and have room get the Clam Chowder, Cioppino, or the Grilled Salmon with Lobster Ravioli. Every time I have eaten here it was great and I am going to be making another reservation to come here in the next week or two.

VtNCQX1H00Uq_0Kg89XuMw.review_text: Awesome place to eat. I'm very picky about my clam chowder and theirs is fabulous. Great little place. Our meals were wonderful. I never would have known about this place if not for Yelp!!

-ki-qIZHP4zZ2D49-b8ZzA.review_text: OK, I admit went here with friends based on the hype. Went in for lunch with a rather large group of 11.  For me it went bad as soon as our two servers started openly arguing over who serves who while trying to take our order. The appetizers we ordered, Wasabi Oysters were great. I also ordered the Clam Chowder, great. I then tried the Seafood Grill again very good. Over all, great food, just poor service and openly hostile servers...at least to each other. Kind of ruined it.

6F0uGYwpJUGxhlMO6C3r_g.review_text: My first visit to Scoma was 15 years ago.  15 years later it's still one of the best seafood places in San Fran - if not the best.   Lunch for two was about $150 bucks.  The appetizers were to die for.  The crab Louie salad is incredible. The Lobster Thermidore - equally stupendous.  It's a bit old school and old looking.  It's also a little touch to find (look for Scoma Way off the main street), but be prepared to drop some coin here.  At lunch time it was filled with locals who appear to visit several times a week.  We know why.

lDKbTlZqjIn2gn490gU2HQ.review_text: For starters, we ordered:  Trio of oysters (1/2 dozen): The oyster meat was smooth and yummy! (5/5)  Scoma's famous clam chowder: Creamy and delicious! (5/5)  Lobster bisque: Probably the *best* I've ever had. I've tried lobster bisque at other nice restaurants and I am not a fan of the bitter aftertaste. However, when I tried the lobster bisque here, it didn't have that strong taste of bitterness. I'm a fan! (4/5)  As for our entrees, we ordered:  Swordfish: Everything about the fish was perfect. The meat was moist, soft, and fresh! The penne pasta that came with it was great too. Only thing we didn't like was the capers. You can request to have them taken off. (5/5)  Lobster Ravioli: A TOTAL MUST! It's served with saffron sauce! The ravioli itself is large and pretty filling. The lobster meat was fresh and delicious. Yum! (5/5)  This place is a little bit hidden near the piers, but it's a seafood gem! We made reservations ahead of time and were seated promptly with a wonderful view of the waters. If you ever want a nice place to dine-in at Fisherman's Wharf, definitely swing by here for a visit! It's quite romantic to have dinner by the waters. :)

rUnA4AJnSZWLRVsvWmoypg.review_text: I had the cioppino here again the other night.  I must say it doesn't get any better than this - a heaping bowl of sea morsels in finger licking delicious broth, accompanied with some crusty toasted sourdough bread.  The cioppino is loaded with crab, fish, scallops, squid, clams, and mussels.  Besides the quantity, the quality is excellent, fresh and cooked to perfection.    According to our waiter, they use same day fresh catch used for other dishes unlike other places where they use less fresh ingredients for this stew.  Also, the person that makes the cioppino has been making it for nearly 30 years . . all at Scoma's.    At $36, it's not cheap.  I suggest splitting this and another dish with your dining companion.  Also, reservation is highly recommended.  Even on a Monday night, it was packed.   And yes, it's in Fisherman's Wharf and it is touristy.  But if you like cioppino as I do, you just have to try it.

vaEnw-xi7h4wrdx7VSD8ig.review_text: A treat. We went for lunch. The waiter was excellent-friendly, unobtrusive, personable. I had the grilled swordfish-as good as I've had. Sweetness had the crab and shrimp Louis salad-it was very good. But the capper was the starter-the best clam chowder I could imagine. Delicious and loaded with clams. I would go back just for the chowder, but everything we had was top notch. A definite recommendation.

EaeekNRTHToAAVmp-PymtQ.review_text: Yum! If you're in sanfran, this place is not to be missed. Apparently, they've been around forever, as you'll see from the decor but don't be discouraged. They sit tucked back on the wharf, and a little pricey but well worth it. I got the lobster bisque and petrale sore and had a bite of my family's calamari fritti and risotto...all of which were excellent. I don't think it's possible to order a bad meal here!

cPCjyKxlzrIC8bhyVNYJew.review_text: I have been here twice with my family and every time the experience was great.  My mom is a huge fan of their crab salad, which tastes really fresh (highly highly recommend). The serving size is huge also. I honestly don't think this place is much more expensive than the crab stalls outside. Let's face it; a crab doesn't have that much meat. Given the ambience and the service, I would much rather eat at scoma's.  We usually come here for lunch to do the prix fixe. They have valet parking also which saved me so much headache for parking in fisherman's wharf.   Their dessert is awesome too. I had their raspberry/blueberry sorbet once and it was the best sorbet that I ever had.

0lDl1Jg1Qz2KhvkfJKk6fw.review_text: Scoma's on a Sunday is not for the faint of heart but yay valet parking. We had a wonderful time. At Fisherman's Warf. On a Sunday. Let that sink in a moment. On a whim, we decided to go to Scoma's and it was a madhouse. We had an hour wait in the cocktail lounge but everyone was so nice. Employees. Other waiting diners. We were then summoned to our table which was perfect and on the water. Our server, CC, was friendly, knowledgeable and spot on in her recommendations. I can't say enough good things about her. We started with Oysters Rockefeller and moved on to Lobster bisque. We split a whole crab and finished up with Bread Pudding and a lemon dessert. The Joel Gott Sauv Blanc ($8 a glass and wonderful) was a perfect pairing. The valet guys were friendly on the way out. It really could not have gone better. We'll be back but maybe not on a Sunday.

I5PaiOdOl0lQKhDJbpc8pA.review_text: We don't visit San Francisco often, but if we have a chance, we go to a new place as much as possible. Scoma's Restaurant was suggested by Yelp when we searched for seafood and soup after the AIDS walk this year. This place has a funny, attentive, and friendly server named Salvatore. He made our experience great. My husband and I both ordered Fresh Half-Shell Oysters and Lazy Man's Cioppino. Their Cioppino was so good. Lots of seafood meat in it, and the broth was thick, creamy and flavorful. Their bread went well with it. It was one of the best Cioppinos I've tasted. Now that I'm recalling it, I'm craving for some. LOL

pwRM_dUm4q1hL5NMCoy_1g.review_text: Good crab, took forever to get a seat even with a reservation :-(... And on my birthday.  So so, won't be back.

Wnxhk0AdpyFwubxESl6Rcg.review_text: Very disappointed. Atmosphere was very old fashion, touristy. Food was just ok.

-slK6EpqPvmjnG8eQNRTsQ.review_text: Best calamari we have ever had. They say Scoma's has it's own fishing fleet. Direct to restaurant. Until I tried it, I did not believe there was a difference.   Nothing fancy on the outside. White jacket waiters and a 1960's decor/vibe. Excellent lobster bisque as well. Many say to go to Puer 47 for dinner. I say grab same meal at lunchtime. Avoid the crowds, and taste some of the best seafood in town.

YQoY_ygdtOaYgmdj3cNi1Q.review_text: It was ok.  The food was ok for the price and the service was ok in the sense that they gave everything we asked for but it all seemed like a favor at times.  Free valet parking and a place right on the waterfront are positives but this is really for the occasional visitor in town that wants San Francisco seafood and to see Fisherman's Wharf versus someone who lives here.

K6t_6uutCnz-1wnHb9cgvA.review_text: The best shrimp I have ever eaten. Came here as a tourist in April and I still day dream about the shrimp here.

zLaGvDtBPupMOjpc-2xHag.review_text: So far at the beginning of dinner I am super impressed.  I think my Yelp status ( humble though it may be) plus my Open Table points merited me quick seating.  I had 8:45 pm reservations but we were seated and had placed our order by 7 pm!  I'm having dinner with the best friend in the world and feel like this is going to be a memorable meal.  We gad a great seat with a view looking out on several fishing boats.  For an appetizer we chose OYSTER ROCKEFELLER ALLA SCOMA for $18 which consists of six tender oysters lightly breaded in a delicious sauce.   The meal was also excellent! I had the MIXED SEAFOOD GRILL which will consist of 3 types of fish and 3 shrimps with grilled veggies and garlicky mashed potatoes for$39.  Tonight's selection included 3 small (just enough though) pieces of salmon, tuna and swordfish all very moist and tasty.  My friend had the LOBSTER RAVIOLI with Saffron Cream Sauce for $30 also very good.  The ravioli was tender and well seasoned and the filling had a nice texture to it.  The saffron cream sauce was very tasty.  The presentation was great with a very tender lobster claw on top. The server was attentive and kept our water glasses full.  From my review it seems like I should have given them five stars, each dish was very good but there just wasn't that memorable dish that deserves five stars.

dYHZbU-QWN_V2QL-FzVc0A.review_text: My husband and I love to eat, and when we traveled to San Francisco for a vacation, Scoma's was on our list of places to try out based on the recommendation of a family member who had been there.  I ordered from the prix fixe lunch menu (not a bad deal), and my husband got the seared tuna sandwich.  The food was well-prepared, but we thought it was too predictable and overpriced.  Nothing notable about the food at all.  Also, the atmosphere in the restaurant was really dated, and is overdue for a face lift.  We walked away feeling like we could have saved some money AND easily had a better experience somewhere else.

pjIkQ4ozCVJV7fi1VT_Dug.review_text: Showed up looking for a snack because the wife and I were trying one item from every restaurant on the wharf.  We told the waiter that we just wanted to share something and asked for a recommendation, but it apparently frustrated him that we wouldn't be spending $100 and he walked away and never came back over ~10 minutes.  Apparently our money is no good to the servants of Scoma's.  It was an old man with gray hair and a big belly - do not use this server if you go!

FtGEpYCF6DYwiBL4zFMfRA.review_text: So my parents flew out to visit me for Mother's Day and she requested that we go to Scoma's because she loves seafood and had heard that it's a classic. As a trendy foodie-type I rolled my eyes disdainfully of anything up in that darn touristy area, but ultimately acquiesced. When we walked in the door, it was packed to the gills (fish pun!) and I was wishing that I had been able to sway my mother earlier. It looked like it was straight out of the sixties and reminded me of restaurants we'd end up going to when visiting my grandparents.  I shall scoff no more at Scoma's. They're still in business for a reason. All the seafood was fresh and excellent, and I was able to pick good wines by the glass to go with. I don't remember what I chose w/ the cioppino other than it was red, but I recommend the Grgich Hills Fume Blanc w/ the mixed seafood plate. It's a sauv blanc that has spent some time in oak, so it's light, yet has some body.

BOETp4Xhi8apbdCyWG8O_w.review_text: Unreal food ciopinno was the very best I ate in San Fran grilled sand dabs and the petrale sole then get a pillow

BzuKRfaUpbr8gaWb2Dom8g.review_text: Our family "go to" for special events. Again We loved everything this last visit, raw oysters, calamari, bisque and scallops are a must. Complimentary Valet parking is key.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: 2.5 STARS WELCOME TO TOURONVILLE! Touronville is where you will find a flock of homogeneous tourons. You know...the khaki, socks with Birkenstocks, and fanny-pack wearing tourists who naively wear their $1k DSLR camera around freely like a puka shell necklace. Like a moron, they overpay for a mediocre meal that ends up hurting more than having your wrists cuffed to your ankles. Sadly, I was THAT touron last night... I've heard great things about Scoma's being this great "SF Institution" serving superb seafood. Well that may have been the case 40 years ago when their only competition was Sizzler's, Lyons, or Auntie Flo's diner (my lame assumption at least) but today it's more like an SF retribution. Craving sashimi, I ordered the closest thing to it on the menu, the Sea Whistle Smoked Salmon Plate. For $19, I got a $5.99 three ounce pack of grocery store quality smoked salmon that had been laid out on a plate to air dry like a Downy detergent commercial with red onions, capers, solidified cream friache, and sliced toasted baguettes. yelp.com/biz_photos/jqEp… Don't worry Costco, Scoma's got nothing on you. For my entree, I chose the highly acclaimed $37 Lazy Man's Ciopinno. yelp.com/biz_photos/jqEp… After having a the most phenomenal bowl of ciopinno from Anchor Oyster Bar on Monday (yelp.com/biz_photos/ZDvI…), I was sorely disappointed when a pho sized bowl of Campbell's tomato soup was laid before me. It was like going from an artisan cup of coffee from Philz to Sh*tbucks coffee. The cioppino was more like a fish stew and a poor one at that. The fish was noticeably "fishy" and there were just 2 clams, 4 scallops, 4 tiger prawns, crab lint and a plethora of bay shrimp suffering from Napoleon complex. With the exception of the scallops, everything was overcooked. The tomato broth was too thick and tasted like diluted Hunt's tomato paste yearning for fresh herbs (garnishing with herbs does not count) and garlic to rejuvenate it from its lonely canned shelf life. Service was equally as unremarkable as the food. Our brusque waiter was MIA the entire night catering to the whims and wants of the obvious tourons trying to get the non-existent San Francisco treat at Scoma's. Sitting in the outdated restaurant surrounded by 70s-80s sports memorabilia and a adorable congregation of those casting to be on Grumpy Old Men Part Deux made me feel like young cub as opposed to the usual cougar that sticks out like a sore thumb in a nightclub. The best part of the meal was the FREE valet parking...now that IS a San Francisco treat! *Woot Woot*

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: This place is a cute little gem tucked away from Fisherman's Wharf. You can't see it from the main street, so you have to know it's there.  At about 5pm on Memorial Day, there was already a good crowd in the dining room. We only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table for 4. My mom and I split the seafood sauté, my sister got the prawn risotto, and my dad got the fettuccini with smoked salmon and shrimp. We all got some of their famous clam chowder, also. Their portions are quite large, so I'm glad I split my place with my mom. Even so, I didn't even finish all the pasta, and was still full!  The chowder was creamy, but not too rich. It did have potatoes (not a big fan), but also a hearty helping of clams. My seafood was cooked to perfection with a mini lobster tail, shrimp, scallops, and crab leg meat. The sauce was also quite good and light, without being overbearing in flavor. I also liked that the rice (pilaf?) soaked up all the juices.  Our waitress was also very personable and nice!   Fresh seafood and great service! Their prices are a bit on the high side, but it is Fisherman's Wharf, so it's to be expected.

ZtLuIXst2ubmAFeRnYeEBw.review_text: I found jesus in the cioppino. I will come here to get this every time I find myself in San Francisco.

RjQLTEpG8ITM9ep1DRcv1g.review_text: Perhaps I had higher expectations because of the location and the exorbitant prices, but I felt the whole experience fell flat.  I had the fish special which was very basic fish, veggies and rice; I felt I could make similar if not better at home.  Service wasn't bad but not really memorable either.  I'm always on the hunt for great seafood in SF and this restaurant is off my list.

JTB_5P3Ua92FXW1Ob6FU-Q.review_text: Best seafood in town.  Must try for tourists and locals.

RSM8buemcnx4t03roVomOg.review_text: I keep it simple at Scoma's and have never come away un-amazed;  1. Roasted whole Dungeness crab 2. Classic crab Louie salad with avo  Waste your money elsewhere if you must, but for crab in SF you best dollar is spent here.

RXaDwsFHvYDliwQJu_sYGg.review_text: I have been going to SCOMA's for years whenever I'm in the San Francisco area.  Their waiters are well trained and have been there for years.  They really know how to treat customers.  The food is always outstanding and the portions are large.  The ambiance is great overlooking the fishing boats on the pier.  Make sure you include SCOMA's in your travels.

2GRdLwKs-6oyPzPsB3xC-A.review_text: The clam showder and the dungeons crab are excellent! Get the fudge brownie to close the deal.... Old school restaurant with a nice ambient and ok views it's a little hidden from all the fuzz in the pier but that's what makes it special!

vdMJFmbbDe0nDQr9-CjiGw.review_text: The place gets a five star for location and a one star for density of patrons. They took a plan from the airlines play book and stuck as many micro tables as possible within their footprint. It is very cramped. I was practically leaning into the window waiting for the exit procedures to be announced.  Waited for the seat at the bar. Very cool. The bartender was one of the best. I had a cable car to get an "authentic drink". It was amazing even though I'm not a tequila fan. My friend on this business trip had a bloody mary which he said was perfect.   The host really was pushing us to get our seats, which was funny. Told him to tell the bartender and the two should work it out as we were waiting for him to make our drinks and then to close out the tab.  The waiter (as all of them appeared to be) probably had worked there 30 years. Very knowledgeable, confident and humorous. He gave us a rapid tour of one of the most ambiguous menus I've ever seen. Unlike Cheesecake Factories encyclopedias, this was a couple pages of bullet notes. I kid you not, my choice was "Mixed Shellfish $40." I also ordered the Lobster Bisque.  At these prices, my quality meter went way up. I don't mind paying, but now I'm expecting. I love Captain D's cause for bucks you get $5.  The Lobster Bisque was fantastic, but I think a lobster may have bathed in the pot two years ago. I don't remember anything solid bumping into my teeth. The mixed shellfish was a huge plate. Half of it crisp vegetables (quite a "mix") and a third was rice and pasta. The pasta was incredible and the sauce was very good. The mixed seafood consisted of  3 scallops, 3 shrimp, and two chunks of micro lobster tail that made me think they were fishing in the crustaceans' preschool.  The fantastic waiter practically disappeared after serving us long after our order. If I had my wife on a romantic evening, the alone time would have been welcome. On an airline with a business friend, it only reinforced how uncomfortable this was. The bill eventually came back. I thought the food was very good (not exceptional), but totally not at the same level as the bill.  Would I go again? If someone else was buying and if I wasn't choosing. San Fran has thousands of other untried restaurants that I would rather check out. I can understand ANY rating between 1 and 5 depending on how crowded/busy and what's ordered.

NUgkzQlwmLeXbLBOuRBSkQ.review_text: The food is good. Very filling and enjoyable. Nothing over the top. Large portions. Would definitely come back!

TYVbm4d6b1xJjbZwndfHcw.review_text: My parents and I lived in San Francisco when I was young and have since made our way to Texas. Our relatives still all live in Northern California, so we try to visit at least once a year.   We have been going to Scoma's as long as I can remember, and it never fails to disappoint. Maybe I am emotionally attached, but then again it tastes better than I remember every single time we go.   A trip to Nor Cal is never complete without visiting Scoma's, and I recommend it to anyone that is in the area. Sure the prices are a bit high, but to me, it's worth it.  We have never had anything short of great service and always at least get the clam chowder and calamari, both my favorite I've ever tasted. We always leave completely stuffed, because none of us ever want to stop eating the deliciousness. I also often crave their melt-in-you-mouth sourdough bread and butter.  It is a bit crowded, but it doesn't bother me. The place has character.

zUEoXNjUReZ8Rjpea7JU1w.review_text: In the past five years, I've been privileged to visit San Francisco quite often. It was a Californian/German friend that recommended this place. I owe him big time. Yes, there are several great restaurants in this town, but Scoma's is really "something else". First, it is not a tourist trap, as I see and hear most of the guests are locals. Then, the overall feeling - elegance yet unpretentious, quality yet not snobbish, efficient yet not pushy.  Tonight, I was "party of one" - probably least interesting type of guest. Perhaps I was lucky, but I got excellent table, and no waiting.... I'm pretty sure that they don't recognize me from before, so this is luck and/or standard practice. As for the food, I ate all. The portions are not "amerikanski" XXL, nor French "taste a spoonful" - this is genuine Italian - you get decent size meal. This evening it was Mr Sonny, but service was very decent any time before as well. So, price/performance this place is a true Gem. Yes, there is better food to get in restaurants that are significantly more expensive, but hey I've had more expensive "stuff" that is far behind what Scoma's delivers. Consistency, quality, style. Clear winner.

F9QvUzHpqzIHcFSU07fvEw.review_text: Fair, but not worth the cost. Ordered a filet medium., came out well and took another 30 minutes to get a new one. Our fish was good but cold by the time the steak was right.

mwSGMrH1Mv9mKq_qSRy17Q.review_text: I give 0 stars to this racist restaurant. You have old white men serving yet they think they're better than Mexicans who have money. I guess I needed to be with white people to be served. Terrible. I came once on my anniversary with my husband years ago. This time I brought my 2 year old daughter. No water no food nothing. Who starves a 2 year old. Never coming back.

F4PWEzITzUUfxZQsS_cIpA.review_text: Very disappointed. ... 55 minute wait to discover that the 2nd day of crab season ... This place is OUT OF CRAB ! !  Fortunately we walked less than one block to have a good laugh with the manager and waiter of neighboring restaurant.   What a joke ... I am embarrassed for them.  But trust the me the crab at the other restaurant was great!

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Scoma's is a nice departure from the hustle and chaos of Fisherman's Wharf. Right on the water - it's a timeless example of classic San Francisco. With a slightly dated but altogether charming interior, lined with pictures of celebrities who have once enjoyed the Scoma menu - it's bursting with character. We were seated quickly and were able to peer out at the docked boats gently lolling on the mellow water ripples. Seals even swam by with relaxed elegance as we dined.  Our waiter was suited in up in a formal white shirt and black pants. It was evident by the way he discussed the menu that he's been a fixture at Scoma's for awhile. We ended up getting a plate of the prawns and scallops - which came nestled beside creamy garlic mashed potatoes, seasoned rice, and steamed vegetables, the Petrale Dore, and the Broiled Wild Salmon. The salmon was incredible. Moist and paired nicely with the mashed potatoes and simple vegetables. The scallops and prawns were huge and exploding with flavor. The Petrale Dore was tasty - but it is served fish and chips style - so it was a tad heavy and greasy.  We all thoroughly enjoyed our meal, but moreover we enjoyed that we could hear each other talk and welcomed the quietness apart from the busy main wharf.  Highly recommend this fresh fish restaurant and would definitely love a return visit to enjoy their other acclaimed dishes such as Scoma's  "Lazy's Man's" Cioppino.  Trust.

6isLnxwJO1Ypzw7njpEp5A.review_text: Is there such a thing as too much dungeness crab in December?  I never thought so until we ordered the large louie this week.  As fresh as it gets and bountiful.  The interior looks like one of the tired boats in the adjoining harbor but all that passes once you sit down with a view of the bay, top service and a hearty menu.  It is off the path of tourists - not that that should make any difference - and is as San Francisco as it gets.

VWcuHdRuEenK6k11v1pvHQ.review_text: The food was 4 star.  The location is 5 star.  The ambience is dated but interesting, so 3 stars.  Our waiter was insulting and should be terminated. We were eventually served, so 1 star.  I have eaten here before and know better wait staff work here.   Ok food but a crap shoot on being served.

UFrMtW4z6Bauap6PHY9wnw.review_text: Great Service, ok view if you like run down buildings. Food was ok, defiantly was expecting much more.   Bread was the highlight of the dinner.

TSXhE-W7FF2wQA4SBg0EXA.review_text: My wife had the oysters and I had the clam chowder as appetizers, both were excellent. We then followed with fresh halibut and sole. Again excellent. Very good wine list. Great atmosphere and service though we felt a little rushed. Recommend making reservations as they were very busy.

G43x7mt15BNyQBdpBcE7Qw.review_text: What a way to end a trip to SF!  Good rule to follow: When out of town, ask the locals where to eat. Don't follow the clueless mobs of tourists that don't know any better. Remember the rule of the blind leading the blind?  I decided to avail of the prix fixe menu they have and this is what I had:  Lobster bisque and lobster salad Lamb t-bone on parmesan polenta with caramelized shallots and sauteed swiss chard (main course) Tiramisu and sourdough bread pudding duo (dessert)  Love love LOVE the lobster bisque. I cannot sing it enough praise. The lobster salad was okay, but the lemon wedge made it better.  The lamb I ordered rare and it came out the way I wanted it: nice and bright pink. It was tender and juicy. The veggies that came with it just made this wonderful dish just better.  I liked the tiramisu; I wished there was more of it. The sourdough bread pudding was more firm than I expected from a bread pudding. Oh well, that's ok. It was still good and not bad at all.  The place overlooked the bay, and had a nice view. The staff was uniformed and looked neat and clean. My waitress was nice and polite, and joked back with me when I joked with her.  This place is a seafood haven. You get to splurge a little, but it's worth spending the extra few bucks considering the food and the service here.  My hat's off to you, Scoma's of SF! I can't wait to come and see you again when I'm back in town!

H13Q7JVk6-gk7_9HCzLKnw.review_text: Really tasty seafood salad (along with other dishes) and valet parking makes this place a must-visit eatery! Check it out next time you're in SF!

54TicaQMeLzd8qK8o9W0aQ.review_text: I heard great things about this place, so we decided to try it late one night after visiting the Academy of Sciences.  The atmosphere was just OK (no spectacular view), and the food was mediocre at best.  I did appreciate that they had their gluten-free items noted on their menu.  I ordered the crispy polenta w/ cheese sauce, and it had the weirdest taste I had ever experienced.  The shrimp risotto was OK, but a little salty.  My husband's fish was good, but nothing spectacular.  Not worth the hype or expense.

H-3ALVBtykMjXm2PUb-l-g.review_text: We stumbled across this restaurant today. I was taken back by the prices, but when we discovered the lunch special, all was good. I had the ahi sandwich with extra salad and no fries. The salad was delicious!  The ahi was a very generous portion and seared perfectly.  We will come back as we were pleasantly surprised!

UhrtCI2WBxsubN8vGDSHuQ.review_text: Really grateful that my aunt treated me to this place, otherwise my broke ass would not even think about coming here. This place is tucked away behind the rest of the restaurants you see on Jefferson St, but finding it is like a kopi luwak farmer finding coffee beans in civet crap, IT'S GREAT.  Wait time on a Saturday night around 9pm was 30 minutes, but well worth it. Really good clam chowder, really rich and flavorful. Lobster bisque pretty good too, but personally preferred the former. Got sauteed mixed seafood with linguini, where the seafood was amazingly tender and fresh. Portions not bad, while those for the cioppino are very generous; however it has a heavy tomato-based flavor, so if you're not a fan of tomatoes I would not recommend. Not sure if it's just me, but the complementary breads I've had in SF (including this restaurant) have been relatively hard, but I guess that's what sauce is for.   Best seafood I've had ever.

_9TKddYP4YX7G0vDa7yAMw.review_text: Okay seafood place. I expected more since it's oh-so-famous or well-known.

Ust0z0l6J3t5e-nIgToxPA.review_text: While walking along the wharf with my cousin, two elderly British men followed us (one wearing a bowler).  They approached us and asked where we were dining for supper and we were not sure.  They raved and raved about Scoma's abalone and were insistent that is where we should go.  My cousin and I looked at each other, and I said, "It sounds like it might be a great restaurant".  Ok, well we walked with a more rapid pace to get ahead of them.  We got to this crowded restaurant and were told it would be a 45 minute wait.  We decided to get a glass of wine at the bar while waiting.  Suddenly, the British men approach us at the bar and said, "The wait for the table may be 20 minutes".  We responded, "We were told it would be 45 minutes".  The man with the bowler said, "I cancelled your table, so you will be dining with us".  In horror, my cousin and I looked at each other and didn't want to create a scene.  We didn't know what to say.  Just minutes after this conversation, the hostess called us.  As we passed the other patrons and then the front door, my cousin darted out and I was just behind her.  We never got to eat there, because of the British gentlemen, but we felt hijacked, and laughed about what their faces must have looked like when we pulled a sly one on them.    I can only speak from my experience here, and the hostess should have never changed our reservation without our consent.

NybkJNwr7Hn6wagoL9BIFg.review_text: Our party really enjoyed the risotto and the lobster ravioli. Friendly and attentive service. The view and decor are sort of old fishing dock quaint. I would return to try a catch of the day.

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: This place is awesome! I was a little weary to go here since it's in Fisherman's Wharf and I thought it would be too touristy for my liking, but the food made me think otherwise.  The service is awesome too!   THINGS TO GET. Cioppino Halibut Pasta Garibaldi Clam Chowder  *Free valet parking is a definite plus!   There is a pre-fix lunch ($25) and dinner menu (around $40) which includes 3 courses.  It's very reasonable given the quality and taste!

-XZ4PxcGK2232Yb9HsoYfw.review_text: I'm giving this two stars because I'm over the hype. Frankly, I'm just confused about it. They say this is a "local favorite." By that I think "they" mean that a lot of old people come here. Which is cool, I have grandparents; I'm down with the old folks.  However, it's pretty pricey and the menu is standard. All the classic meats, pastas, and seafood. Nothing unique. I could have gone to a restaurant with the same quality of food for a lower price.   We were not impressed and regretted spending so much money here for average food.

mS-4O56dx6wt5fWxbbx-LQ.review_text: It's been a while since I've been to a restaurant that is a solid 4 stars, no borderline 5 or borderline 3.   Scoma's is an upscale and classy seafood spot in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf with a staff well versed in everything seafood and wine and an impressively extensive menu.
