The servers can sometimes feel a bit lethargic and come across as a tad pretentious but given the upscale ambiance and old-SF vibe, it fits right in.   My friend and I headed here to celebrate the crab season and thus ordered the Crab Risotto and Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab. We also prefaced the meal with some calamari as an appetizer. All three items were fabulously solid in their own exclusive way - the risotto was creamy in a tomato-based broth with large chunks of fresh crab meat spread evenly throughout. The dungeness crab was fresh, tender and came with some butter for dipping pleasure. And the calamari was crispy and fried to perfection. We paired all of the above with a some Prosecco and it matched perfectly.   The food gets 4.5 stars, service gets 3.5 - 4 stars and ambiance gets 4 stars - hence the 4 star average.   If you're in the Fisherman's Wharf area and are in the mood for an upscale seafood dining experience, definitely consider Scoma's.

c9-jEIfBnLa4iNHxVmXAHA.review_text: My parents have been dragging me to Scoma's for years and every time I come away happy, but not that impressed.   Granted, my parents have been coming here for over 40 years but I feel like in that time, the food hasn't changed.   Sure I understand...that's an admirable quality with a restaurant "if it ain't broke, don't fix it" but some of the items....at least for today's younger diners like myself, seem bland and dated.   I feel that with a couple of modern tweaks to the menu to bring the food up to 2013 standards the place would erupt....but then again that's only my opinion.  Still a solid SF staple, just don't lose your mind with the FW tourists.

Ud8tcgnxp0w0qBtXt_DKOg.review_text: My friends from so cal raved and raved about this restaurant.  Funny thing is, I'm from the yay area and have never heard of Scoma's...and no one else from home had heard of it either.  Well, I'm glad they introduced me to this place because it was delicious!  It was an upscale dinner on the water.  Upscale actually might be the reason why I've never been to or heard of Scoma's.  Food was amazing!  We started with calamari and I got the pasta "Fisherman style"-  seafood linguini in red sauce.  Delish!  The cioppino was also amazing.  The portions are huge and definitely sharable!  The highlight of our meal was our waiter: Andre.  Without a doubt, we were the youngest (also darkest) people at this restaurant and Andre seemed to be really refreshed by the change in clientele.   He was hillarious, polite, quick, and a little loopy.  In other words:  awesome!  Scoma's?...S'co!!

W-Y-vrNyufeKqWifoY1ppA.review_text: We love to eat at Scoma's when we go to the city.  Had lunch there yesterday. As always it was awesome.  Our waiter Jean Marc was attentive and knowledgeable. I had the Pasta diplomatica and my daughter had the yellow fin ahi.  Both were delicious. I have eaten here many times and always a fabulous meal. Thank you Scoma's.

jaKOnWN9eEfLvYhjLfYTbA.review_text: Disappointing. The food was excellent (as always), but the service was not up to the standard I am used to and the changes to the menu are equally disappointing.  Their prices have increased but the portions are smaller, the side selections have narrowed and are not up to the standard of their traditional rice pilaf and garlic mashed potatoes. The main dishes are still the highest quality and in the 15+ years I have been going there, I have never had a bad meal, but the 25 minutes between ordering my salad and getting it and the additional 15 waiting for the entree (while waiting the whole time to get a refill on my coffee), was unacceptable. The explanation of why they replaced the traditional rice and potatoes was to offer more"healthy" choices. Clearly, they mistake the purpose of a fine restaurant. If I want someone to watch my calories for me, I'll get married.  When I go out to dine, I am looking for quality food and service.  I felt this was not what I received. The service was slow, the selection of sides to my meal less than satisfactory, and while the entree ( prawns and scallops) was outstanding, the overall experience was less than I have come to expect from Scoma's.

tSeWl6LU6vvTjBDXCf-P4Q.review_text: We were very disappointed with the reception we received at Scomas. After getting many recommendations for this restaurant, we made a reservation for a window table a week in advance. We showed up at our reserved time and waited for our window table. Hostess said there would be a wait... But we were next up.   We then witnessed the hostess giving OUR table to a later couple b/c they complained about waiting!!! I told the hostess I saw that and she denied it. Baaaaaad   Food was very good and our waiter, Bruce, was outstanding. If he had been at the front desk this would have been a great experience instead of just "good".

f-Pi9Kw6NGeELr6nbZJ9yQ.review_text: Scomas has always been one of our favorites, can't go wrong.  Love the garlic roasted crab!  Food is always fresh and well prepared.  Been coming here for years and will continue! Love it's historical charm.

gOBkinOIsBUSNP8byXKsrw.review_text: It is really to bad that this place has settled as a basic tourist spot.  Now as tourist spots go this is one of the best, but that is not saying a lot.   I have gone to Scoma's for years and it has finally reached the point where we will not be back.  The food has ZERO flavor.   Crab Stuffed Mushroom's - very bland and dry Salmon and Shrimp Sandwhich -  very bland and dry Wait Staff - stuffy and forgetful  So if you are a tourist this spot should be OK, if you are a regular to SF stay away.  There are so many great seafood spots to check out pass on this one

WwF6Ug5mYksdJbznmJ2eZg.review_text: It kills me to give this Staple of American Restaurants anything lower than 5 stars, but after 30+ years of coming here, I was really disappointed this last visit.  I come to SF once or twice a year and always try to make it to Scoma's.  I know its a tourist place, but for the last several decade, it has been extremely consistent.   With this visit I had a very boring meal, and iit may have been PREVENTABLE!!  I ordered my usual, Patrale Dore.  When the meal arrived, it a was the usual nice piece of fish, but it was on a bed of rice.   Historically, it is served with Penne pasta.. When I questioned my server Catherine, she said that is how it comes now.  Later she told me I could've gotten it with Penne pasta, but management wanted her to push rice instead.  WTH?  I should have been informed up front.  I will probably visit again...but I will make sure up front, that I get pasta.  mmmm, Patrale Dore on Penne pasta with butter and garlic, and fresh parmesan cheese...come on!  That is how it is supposed to be served!

vgHK87dg7LAy8a9nTRWFIw.review_text: I was sadly disappointed in our meal and the room we were placed in for our dinner.  We flew in from Cincinnati, Ohio and made this place a priority!  We were a table of 6 and we were seated in a very small half round booth that we squeezed into and was left facing a large party of 10 in front of us and we were the only tables in this little space.  It was warm in this room and there was not a very good view out of the windows.    What was most upsetting is we had called last July to book a table in the larger room with a view and were told that they would do their best and make note of our request.  To spend over $600.00 on a meal with drinks, appetizers and a meal and leave sadly disappointed was just not what I wanted to do on vacation.   I would not recommend this spot to my friends.  The food was average.  We have better seafood restaurants here in Cincinnati and the service was okay.  Our waiter seemed to want us to keep buying drinks and upping our bill.  He had been at the restaurant for years and did not treat us as special as he could have considering the fact we had never been there before and we wanted to hear all about it.  He rushed us into making decisions and did not give us the warmth and friendliness we expect and receive here in the Midwest.  I wish I had requested to move the minute we sat down as we were all very squished into this booth and it was very uncomfortable.  Not to mention watching another table celebrate a birthday and feeling like we were invading their space.  This place was not what I was expecting at all and do not feel it deserves such a rating as you have given it on Yelp!

sSwNEr1LELuogaxFfWqjtw.review_text: Our  place to eat in SF!  Amazing food, wonderful service.  My family love the lobster ravioli, I'm a fan of the cioppino. I've never had a meal there that was anything but excellent.

gd1RhLvaN6Zs0iJyrcVGVQ.review_text: I come to Scoma's whenever I'm in San Francisco for my favorite clam chowder. The clam chowder at Scoma's is thick and tasty without being overly salty. I've also grown to love their calamari fritti and Dungeness crab cocktail! The Cioppino here is also one of the best I've had but my favorite is still the Cioppino at Phil's Fish Market.   The food here is good but pricy.

fxEo8P2QS2anNnhWF0r1tg.review_text: So, so sad. The boyfriend and I booked reservations for Scoma's for our nice evening out while in San Fran. I initially was concerned since the place is in such a touristy area and that usually signals sub-par food to me...but after seeing the reviews on here and getting a recommendation from a friend thought we would try it out. Upsetting.  We started with a bottle of wine and the calamari. It was so-so....I was really expecting the best calamari I've ever had...but then again when the fish is fried, I guess it doesn't really matter how fresh it is anyways.   For my entree, I asked the waiter what his favorite risotto was...he said the Prawn Risotto, so I went with it. So disappointing. It was so FISHY! The entire dish was, not even just the prawns. I will give them credit that the risotto was cooked properly, but still...just a disappointment.  Boyfriend had some fish dish...I did try it, but don't recall what it was, so it must have not been that memorable...or perhaps it was just the second bottle of wine that is making my mind so fuzzy...but even if so, you'd think I'd enjoy the food then, right? ;]  Anyways...had it not been for the wine and the really outstanding service, Tim was his name, I would probably give Scoma's only one star. Will not be returning on my next trip to SF.

isC4-oLc-TqPXYlUmuHLdA.review_text: Overpriced and crowded. I've been here twice and think I"ll try someplace else. The food is fine, not spectacular as the prices imply. Just one of those old SF establishments that doesn't have to try to hard.

IIlSJgf_KNPbbw5Vr9hvbw.review_text: This place is so elegant. The food.I'd great the drinks.are the bomb. Of I could I would eat everyday. Seafood sec is on Dec

BvPXKwNeVIh9gGATWICm1w.review_text: Came here for my 6 year anniversary with my fiancé. We had reservations for 8 but showed up at around 7:20. We were seated at 7:30. We were given waters and bread with our menus. Now. I know this is a seafood restaurant. But for some reasoned both had a hankering for steak! I had the filet mignon and he had the Cowboy Steak. What I loved about this was that I asked for medium rare, and that's exactly what I got. It's very rare for me to order a medium rare steak and to actually get it. We also ordered soup; clam chowder for me (delicious) and lobster bisque for him (also not bad at all). All in all, I had a really good experience here and would definitely come back soon.

Bv9hxkLqarmTj63cyNj70g.review_text: Great location, great view, and a cool old school feel. Service was patchy- but I've had worse. Food was also decent.  We had: - Crab cakes- amazing. Get them. Now. - Lobster ravioli with broiled salmon- also decent, but the ravioli was better than the salmon (a bit dry). Bonus point for the saffrom cream sauce being an amazing dip for the pound of sourdough bread we consumed. - Seafood platter- scallops, shrimps, crab, and lobster. I dont care either way for scallops or shrimp (my friend left most of the scallops behind, and he loves scallops)- but the crab and lobster were delish. This comes with rice AND pasta- strange! - Apple crisp a la mode- sugary apple sauce was good and I ate this with the ice cream, after finding the apples were far too hard and spongy.   Overall worth checking out- but next time I will probably come just for the heavenly crab cakes and wine.

2nfGdDq4cYOMuRgeGJGYrw.review_text: We enjoyed a great vacation in both Sonoma and San Francisco.  Ended our stay at Scoma's for dinner the night before we left.  We first had drinks at the bar while we waited for our table and the bartender recommended the cioppino.  Thank God I listened to him!!! Food was fantastic and it was the first dinner in a VERY VERY long time that I could NOT finish.  The bowl that the cioppino came in was filled to the brim with seafood.  The appetizers were unbelievable as well.  I had the ahi tuna and my wife had the crabcakes.  I recommend either of them.  Service was good.  Why 4 stars you ask?  The service may have been slightly pushy...the minute you finished there was someone on top of you taking your dish away.  I guess we felt a little rushed...All'n'all a great dinner and I would definitely be back when I'm on the west coast again.

F1uCFF8QqK0P5xx-nIZDhg.review_text: Classy, upscale place.  A bit pricy, but it is a nice convivial atmosphere.  I enjoyed the lobster bisque.  It came with fresh Boudin bread and breadsticks.  Nice.  I also had a caesar salad that wasn't good.  When I noticed there were no anchovies, though, a waiter brought them over to me - exactly three anchovies!  Bartenders are friendly when you're drinking a lot, and quick.  This place does a killer business that caters mainly to tourists, but it can be good for a special occasion.  Evidently the views are good as well.  Maybe from upstairs; not from the bar.  The bar can be loud, but everyone I talked to in the whole place was having a great time, so I liked that.

yjqybvIvxrrhGH0zzJGXEw.review_text: Don't remember what I got but it was something with an assortment of lobster, crab, scallops, penne pasta, and clams?  It was insanely good! If only I lived closer. :/

m8TnxdbnXeI_Wywl8I40HQ.review_text: Great atmosphere! Getting to this location has the feel of a place only a local would know about as it is down an unassuming alley with only a small sign. Inside feels upscale but folks in all sorts of dress are dining.  We had a problem with our reservation as the hostess could not find the details. The 6p reservation ended up being 620p after she found a table and then had to find another for 7 instead of 2. The questions she asked me made it seem like this was a problem they'd had before with phone reservations.  Other than that it was great! The waiter was super friendly and great with the kids. The food, though pricey, was excellent! I had a sort of combination platter with steamed vegetables and rice pilaf along side a mix of scallops, lobster tail, crab claws and shrimp. It was quite the load of seafood. Even at $40 I'd have it again.  Save for the hiccup getting started I'd highly recommend it and will return when I get the opportunity!

Og5lv2yeSg-JRxbxc5_8PQ.review_text: There are so many amazing things about this place.    1) Free valet parking!! Self explanatory  2) Awesome service.  We waited for less than 5 minutes to get seated.  There is a waiting area with seats and guests waiting can order drinks etc.  Our serve was incredibly nice.  Not only was he patient with explaining and recommending different items on the menu, he also started small chats with me and the boyfriend very sincerely.  3) Reasonably priced.  I ordered the sauteed scallop with pasta etc.  The portion was even bigger than what our waiter had warned us about.  Bf ordered the pre fixe menu so we got to try their clam chowder.  I really liked it so I ordered an additional one.  And we got it for free!!  Love free stuff.  Everything we ordered were very fresh and yummy.    4) Atmosphere/location.  It's located in a cul de sac on Pier 47 and has a very nice view of the bay.  The inside is incredibly huge.  That is also why they can afford to have a small lounge for waiting.  As we sat there, we could hear laughter coming from all over the restaurant and between waiters and customers.  It was just a very casual and friendly atmosphere.   Love this place and will definitely go back again!

Ng8FR41UoOL64zT7NrcdqQ.review_text: My wife and I got 2 whole garlic crabs.  They were fantastic!

4qN6pRVY0HkwNoW82vKMoA.review_text: Old school décor, and old school feel.  You expected the rat pack to walk in.  Great food, and the wait staff was awesome and full of personality.  We had reservations so no waiting.

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: + great food. calamari, desserts, pastas well cooked, fresh seafood  + great service + peaceful ambiance + along the water, tucked away from the touristy attractions

7CsQfZGaIBM4Xb3Xn0ShAw.review_text: The food is good, and view was oddly just okay.  It was of the dock and close up, docks are dirty and the windows were dirty too (I'm not knocking them for that - they're on the ocean!).  Three stars for our food & server!  Our server was faaaaaabulous~, they give large portions, wonderful bread & butter (that my family and I are so good at eating before dinner rolls out).  Be careful when you order the ciopinno!  It's huge (could feed 3-4)!!  This place is a good spot for tourists.  She found a pearl in her oyster.  FTW.

7MRgjyhnAtcnoAnv7T0bCw.review_text: The best smelling urinals I've ever had the pleasure of using. (Sorry ladies - you'll never know.) The seafood was exceptionally good as well.  Try the calamari.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: Touristy, expensive, and not that good at all.  I wasted $50 here.

m91rWRWBkMS9vQ5jhW-_Bg.review_text: Came here with my family for lunch and was very impressed and also lucky because the weather was perfect. The view of the bay is spectacular and the food is delicious as well. I ordered a glass of the Pinot Grigio to start and followed with the shrimp cocktail. I would love to come here again and sit outside if I got lucky enough to come when the weather is warm

NO0DNuFm36oRyu8AMgRi6A.review_text: Love at first sight ! My hubby took me to this place for our first American date, he knows about this place because his family has been coming here for 30 years! We had the Fried Pacific Oysters with Wasabi Aioli which is just fantastic ,and for the main dish we had the Seared Yellowfin Tuna !  This place is just amazing ! I Must say that after a month from our dinner date , he proposed to me ! we have been happily married for the past four years !

NTGjlZ4E5KD234lUQ9Yskw.review_text: Best Cioppino I've ever had. My wife said the same about the Calamari entree. Heros was our server and he was as good as the food. If you like the freshest seafood prepared perfectly, then check out Scoma's on your next visit to the wharf.

HSz-e89-hr-g0Z4qgfOskA.review_text: On the water. A little too pricey.   Clam chowder- good  Dungenous crab- good  Chocolate fudge tort- fabulous

4gs3sWfbQ5j0wv73-lZLhw.review_text: I love sea food. But like another sea food restaurants it is not better but simply the good. I visited here last month for only one time and took their smelish hospitality. i was so disappointed since ever other experience I've had here was so much better. Its ok, But their Salmon was awesome and so pretty. If I come back, just for it's delish Salmon not for others.

vVq6QUi2l2mgx_qHOa6VxQ.review_text: Fairly decent food for a very touristy area, and huge portions, but for some reason i didn't get that 'four star' feeling.  Wait was long for a table, but expected given we had 7 to seat.  Grabbed a drink before dinner and the bartenders were great - probably the best part of the experience.

1G7UG_phJmvqKk2z4zzz9g.review_text: Went here for the first time this past weekend. Although it is a tourist trap due to it's location there's something about it being around since 1965 that makes it worth it.  Some pluses: - Great, attentive, and friendly staff - Free valet parking! - Nice view in the sense that you're pretty much on the water while enjoying your dinner  Some negatives: - A bit pricey for what it is... but hey, it is the pier right? - The food was decent but not mind blowing. Worth to go for the nostalgia of the place only  Overall, a decent place.

Q_Pgb-t6clsURXQI1fQM0w.review_text: We had a large group, service and food was amazing!!! Crab cakes we delicious, lobster bisque was fantastic!! I had the Dungeness crab legs which was was huge portion that was prepared perfectly.

f81Y2EzuRqefayCrL1Ra3Q.review_text: Great view, great service but food was definitely lacking. We came in on a random Tuesday night, it was pretty dead inside and was hoping for a really good meal.  I ordered the Lazy Man's Cioppino (yes, sometimes, it's just that kind of night) and I mostly thought it tasted like ketchup and definitely not flavorful enough for the price it was commanding. Maybe it was my fault but down the street, I have definitely gotten a better cioppino from a place name just that...  I'm tempted to try Scoma's again because I feel like it can redeem itself food-wise. I just have to order the right things is what I'm thinking. So Yelpers, look for the best dish that everyone loves and gets that but stay away from the cioppino!

VwUG8ifJNsyROCBKFpBxhA.review_text: I friggin love this place. Been here 2 times before but have to come when in SF. I was in Sonoma and rented a car to drive here with my wife.  We started with the calamari fritti which is fresh, lightly fried and delicious. The horseradish is light so even my wife didnt think spicy.   She had half dungeness crab which was perfect for her. I had cup of clam chowder which was hot, fresh and very flavorful. I had the lobster tails which were 12oz and very tender, with green beans and wild rice. I eagerly finished all but the rice. We paired with the 2012  Benizinger Chardonnay which worked well, though we finished a bottle.  We saved a little room and had brownie and vanilla ice cream. I worked Tue ice cream and my wife said the brownie was excellent. Always awesome here.

7yZuSx3Wla8wVCmy9thkIg.review_text: I've been a frequent of Scoma's for years. I've traveled quite a bit and have been privileged enough to truly experience fine dining. Always at the top of the list is Scoma's. No fluff. Just all around great food and a great experience.

sktAlsn5d0bBh1UOevRwMg.review_text: Ha, so the first day in SF walking around the Fisherman's Wharf, we picked out Lou's to get my fresh seafood fix but the whole time sitting there I seen droves of people walking down this side street. Fast fwd to the next day and we went down said side street to take a look. Wow, what a great setting, all these little boats moored up and this great looking restaurant overlooking the bay and harbor. Walking up I see the white table cloths so you know its gonna be fancy and then looking at the menu outside the prices confirmed it but you get what you pay for and I wanted more than bar food. Quite posh inside, we get seated at nice window table and our waiter, Jose A and his helper were quick with menus, bread & water. He was very helpful as I couldn't decide which fish to go for tho ended up on the Alaskan Halibut. He was also great help with some of the beers that I was not familiar with and I tried Anchor Steam and Liberty Ale.  The fish was awesome, cooked to perfection and I wiped the plate clean with the extra bread. Best dining experience in a long time and the bill wasn't that bad!

oMrI1VlYPTNzstOz6kELug.review_text: It's been a few weeks since I went for the first time for my birthday dinner, But I feel like I need to give this place a hand for the awesome birthday dinner I had. After a very long wait a Saturday night (30+minutes), they generously gave us a window table so we could see a bit of the bay/sunset.  Appetizer  Calamari- best ever and best dish of the night to me!!! So perfectly crispy and well-seasoned without being too heavy.  Comes with a very delicious tartar sauce and spicy tomato-based sauce.   Entrees  Mussels in white wine/garlic sauce instead of a tomato-base- very very good, the sauce was more of an afterthought but the mussels were very fresh. I liked this base much more than the cioppino.  Cioppino- Great seafood, but not the best tomato sauce (too watery, not memorable in terms of taste). Since the sauce was so bland and the dish was hyped so much I had really high expectations and though the seafood itself was steamed/cooked well I would not order it again. Nothing in the soupy sauce enhanced the seafood to me.   Wonderful free Birthday dessert:)!!!! Splendidly rich fudge cake with some whip cream, raspberry sauce, and powdered sugar.  Fantastic serivce once we were seated (water filled all the time, wonderfully kind waitress) and ambiance overall. Will come back for the Calamari whenever I'm in SF:)!!

vAS046IKV1teS_SQ_VFsZg.review_text: Just sat at the bar for dinner. Spent over 120.00 service sucked had to ask for water utensils etc. Bottom line poor. I am shocked how bad the experience was. Inventory was more important than the customer!!!! Been coming here for 30 years may be the last time!!!

CzAQw3BTHWYhSNboBOkVnA.review_text: Excellent service and quality food. Their cioppino is pricey ($39) however the best I've had. Great fresh sourdough bread. Very busy and after 5pm usually a long wait so best to.make a reservation.

s8U7i_eK1dSwnMyhfsuogw.review_text: Let me start by saying that this would have been a five star review, but for mediocre service.   Some reviewers note that the prices are on the high side, even if worth it.  Scoma's does have a three course price fixe for $45, a great option for those on a budget.   Ok-now about the food. Amazing lobster bisque, and this is coming from a New Englander. The price fixe version comes with a deconstructed lobster salad on the side. I added the lobster meat from that into the bisque and was in heaven. The main course was a scallop and pasta dish in a light cream sauce. Everything about it was perfect. Dessert was a brownie and ice cream duo. The brownie was mediocre at best. BUT, the homemade caramel sauce that accompanied the ice cream was pure heaven, so I didn't mind not eating the brownie at all.   I would definitely recommend.   We went on a Sunday night, without reservations. They were very busy, but the wait was less than half an hour. It is down a small side street, so you have to have an idea of where you are going.

oKrct4Hc8hZNMYXecitLCw.review_text: I had a very nice business lunch  here with my company. I was here in the middle of the week, in the middle of the day and it was very busy.   I ordered the lobster ravioli and salmon and it was excellent.  There was a lobster tail also with the dish. I had garlic bread and you sure can't beat sourdough bread with seafood and Italian food.  I was salivating over the dishes my co-workers ordered. Crab piled high on salads. I love crab.  I am making plans to go back.  We all shared some tiramisu and cheesecake.  I don't think the Scoma's parking validation for two free hours in the Triangle Lot is enforced. I had to pay $15.00 but I will expense it.

q7kebVCt7dfxYmDsweRmuQ.review_text: Exactly what I expected from a fisherman's wharf experience. This might be my only time in San Francisco and I wanted a great meal...I got it here. Service was very understated and unobtrusive. No surprises and I feel like I got my moneys worth.

IWR1GOgIg0LELF0YXjPhLw.review_text: I was completely impressed with the food and the service. Our waiter, Kevin, was the best waiter I have every had in my entire life! He was incredibly helpful, knew when to clear plates, bring more bread or water, answer any questions we might have, and help my mom...who has some physical challenges. He was extraordinarily kind. We enjoyed the appetizers (crab cakes, calamar, shrimp), and the clam chowder (get the bowl, it is only $1 more.) Two of us shared the cioppino (over the top!), and the risotto - with scallops or shrimp - was tasty. Ah, and the view from our table of the SF port was beautiful/relaxing. The decor is definitely from another era, but it is still a great place to eat. Ah, and park there. I believe all you have to pay is a tip to the valet.

AwWWxN2E77o0udcdpvYyNA.review_text: Always one of my favorite San Francisco Old School places to eat. The dishes are all great. Great Calamari, Great Crab Louie, Great hug fish dishes and the lobster bisque OMG. Always hits the spot if you are craving REAL FRESH right out of the sea dishes.

IJeecoGCQPCcuifxeqac9A.review_text: Been to Scoma's before and it was the same both times, good food and good service. Weekends are crowded and you may be seated really close to others, but I found it nice to chat a little with others near you. Must try items are crab cakes and the garlic roasted crab in season. Did I say I like crab? Okay, the Caesar salad was great too! We had the crab out of season this time and it was good, but it's even better fresh. The sampler appetizer for two is excellent with a small crab cake, calamari and shrimp scampi which was like shrimp in cioppino broth. Nice mix. The food is better than the tourist traps just a short walk east on the Wharf. Restaurant has valet and it's around back on Al Scoma Way, kind of behind Castagnola's restaurant off Jefferson St.

Kckxk3jXvNIQ4tktTVokpw.review_text: I went to scomas with such an open heart... With such great expectations, and an empty stomach.... ughhh such disappointment.  We went on both a recommendation and on yelp reviews.  :(  I don't even know what to say.  We walked in... Old school, 70's style decor, very wharf style.  I was ready.  Got the menu and my excitement fell... Shot.... Down the drain. Prices were out of this world.  Soup for $15.... Ughhh.... But I trucked on.  I spotted what I wanted, the crab risotto.  The waiter was interesting to say the least.  No other way to describe him. If you don't like fancy waiters with white coats, and lavish talk, walk away.  So I ordered my risotto and a bloody mary.  The rest of my group got the squid salad, lobster bisque, and lobster ravioli.    We waited for our food, that came very quickly.  I tried the squid salad..... It was delicious.  Then I got my meal. hmmmmm..... Lets see.  So the risotto was way under cooked.  I mean, I was crunching on risotto.  not much wine flavor, which is key to risotto.  I mean, there were large pieces of crab.... But, I was so disappointed.  I was so sad.  I wanted to like this place... It was so highly recommended. The lobster ravioli was a hit. But here is the bottom line.  Over priced, over hyped.  I guess I need to give it another go, but I just wasn't impressed.

GWaCI4tiGmt0_3Tp5dM-MQ.review_text: Stopped here before our duck tour for a quick lunch. There was a short wait, about 15 mins. The hostess was a bit rude and not very friendly.   I ordered the lazy man's Cioppino. There was a lot of seafood, but the overall taste was mediocre. I was expecting it to be more spicy with more flavor, but was disappointed. The soup is big enough to share for 2 people. It can also be an entire meal for 1 person. I would have to say the fish was excellent.   The service was a bit slow and the place is pretty crowded. I wasn't too impressed with this place and wouldn't mind skipping it to try another place in the future.

h4o8e_Xbca2kXQO_vzOqgg.review_text: Excellent time here at Scoma's!! I came for lunch and our timing was perfect because they had dine about town deals. So we got a 2 course meal for $17.95!! We were seated right by the window with a beautiful view of the boats and the water. yelp.com/user_local_phot… The service here is nice, our server was so genuine and knew a lot about seafood. He was polite and kind. So rare now a days. I ordered the clam chowder and the petite dungeness crab Louie salad. The Clam Chowder = 4 stars = TASTEY! yelp.com/user_local_phot… The petite CRAB Louie Salad = 5 stars = fresh ingredients, tons of crab for being "petite", best salad I've had for awhile. I'll definitely be eating more greens if all my salads tasted this good. yelp.com/user_local_phot… Oh and dessert was tiramisu with a whole chocolate spoon! Beautiful presentation. yelp.com/user_local_phot… I love the history behind Scoma's, I loved the service and the food. Full on 5 stars for me. Nothing bad to say on my visit.

QZSkofjBvMm1E0t2mEyrbQ.review_text: I've been coming to this place since I was a little kid. My favorite thing to get has stayed the same..... The lazy man's cioppino, extra spicy. It's pretty much the standard of what to get here. But also the seafood saute sec. is amazing. The pier is always a nice to walk after a hefty meal.

Vkj42md-5O3VoOD9pBg6Sw.review_text: The Fixe Price Lunch Combo for $24.95 is great!  I chose the 3 items as follows:  1) New England Clam Chowder (Cup) - other option was a Cesar Salad  2) Bay Shrimp and Dungeness Crab Louis Salad   3) Desert of the Day (Chocolate Cake)  The cup of clam chowder is good, it's a cup 'tho, not a bowl, so it's so delicious it has you feeling like you could eat more.  The Shrimp and Crab Louis Salad has the Louis (Thousand Island) dressing over a generous portion of Bay Shrimp and Dungeness Crab Meat (no shells to peel or pick at here!) on top of a bed of lettuce with beets, and other garnishment.  This is the lunch sized portion, not to be confused with the full dinner entree portion which costs over $30.  But, make no mistakes here, I'd assumed it would be a small portion, it's actually a very fair and fulfilling portion, that is perfect, it's big enough as an entree to get you filled.  The desert was great, it was a slice of chocolate cake.  Of course, all meals come served with sourdough bread and butter too, so you can always fill up on those carbs.  The service at Scoma's is always friendly and welcoming.  Parking isn't too hard if you're either willing to pay or willing to walk, it is Fisherman's Wharf you know, so the heart of the tourist area as well as it having lots of restrictions to the street parking and a high demand for spaces.

dcjrPcU-q7sxF0L_E1YqdA.review_text: Very attentive wait staff and fresh seafood. Sand dabs were delicious!  A bit overpriced, but really enjoyed our meal. The decor is outdated, but it works.

tX30yNjriupAW4KvUeP4Cw.review_text: I had NYE dinner at Scoma's and to my surprise the wait was only 5 minutes for a group of five. Scoma's is right on the pier, you have to walk to the back and make sure you watch your footing if you are wearing heels because their asphalt is pretty uneven.   The restaurant has an old feel, old pictures on the walls of celebrities who have visited Scoma's, the lighting is perfect, the service is friendly and even our food came out very quickly.   I ordered the broiled Swordfish, garlic mash potatoes and veggies. The sour dough bread is not too chewy and everything was very flavorful. The food is pricey but what you are paying for is well worth it. Definitely check it out if it is in your budget.

Xoj_CYbHK15f2sUmWDK1FA.review_text: This is my first time in San Francisco and I was told Scoma's was a must go to place to eat...and it definitely is! The garlic roasted Dungeness crab was amazing, very meaty and had superb flavor. The oysters Rockefeller was excellent; the dish consisted of 6 servings and per serving, there was 3 oysters.

aGUZKSRPA-MHHj6b8GhOww.review_text: When in San Francisco, go with seafood. On a referral from my boss, Scoma's was the place to go. Situated in the wharf area, Scoma's is tucked away from the street, almost secluded. They process the seafood on premises - cleaning, filleting, etc. You can watch them through a picture-glass window right next to the restaurant. The interior design is nautically themed, yet classic. A long bar is near the entrance where you can have a libation while waiting for your table. The dining room is beautiful with glass on both sides of the restaurant. While there's not much to see at night, we did watch seagulls perch on the wooden wharf beams outside watching us eat our dinner. I love clam chowder and it is usually one of my staples that I use to test the level of the food. This has to be the best clam chowder I've ever had! It's creamy, buttery, and chocked full of clams. It was held and served at the perfect temperature so the cream didn't break. I worked with clam chowder for 9 years at Disneyland and you really had to watch the holding temperature. Once the cream breaks, the soup loses its creamy texture (almost like curdled milk) and needs to be discarded. The fresh cracked black pepper on top sealed the deal. Scoma's, you had me at "clam chowder"! I decided to try something off of their daily special menu, Lobster Raviolis topped with lobster tail and salmon fillet. It was pretty good. The salmon needed a little more seasoning, but had a nice buttery flavor and soft texture. The lobster tail was tender and perfectly cooked. The raviolis were okay. I would have liked more herbs like tarragon, rosemary, and/or oregano to punch up the sauce as it was a little heavy.  My mom ordered the Dungeness Crab.  As it was summer, it was out of season so it was "fresh frozen". She was a little disappointed that she couldn't have the insides (miso or mustard of the crab) as they are cleaned out when prepped. Our server assured us that if we came back during Dungeness crab season that we could order it with the "miso" intact. She enjoyed every bit of it as it came out steaming hot and ate it to make our ohana proud, bib and all. Our meal ended with roses. A man proposed to his future bride that night. They were leaving on a flight back to China and couldn't take them. The staff gave us a couple to take back to our hotel room. They were beautiful!

hXSYiApbVJPjqRJEF-yloQ.review_text: As I'm reading the dismal reviews left by some of the others I'm shocked!!   Now before they had opentable (so thankful they do now) yes the waits were ridiculous as you had to walk in, no reservations before... But this place is so worth it!! Now most people have a smart phone or cell phone for that matter, so there's no excuse not to call ahead...   Food reviews... I've NEVER ever had a bad dish here... From the scallops, fettuccini, smoked salmon, lobster bisque, clam chowder, seafood sautée, tiramisu, their cocktails, lobster raviolis, everything has been superb... We drive and hour or so here just to eat!!   This is the best seafood in the Bay Area!!   Ps they do have valet parking!!!

gWXH61bWjPIOJC9rzAxKoA.review_text: Amazing atmosphere...service was excellent and the food was perfect. My companion had the seared scallops and I had the halibut. So flavorful ... Delicious!!!

69CVGNN-JGALhelaU0cdcA.review_text: You're luck if you get a Friday night table.  We went at 8:00 and waited 35 minutes (not bad!) Great Chioppino, but I disagree with the last Yelp review, the dessert was great! Got the bread pudding and seemed like a reasonable dish.  Good wine prices as well.  Its a see and be seen place!

VFgHy8C8EYpxd5_EcmlMag.review_text: Came here on my boyfriends birthday, had made a reservation a week in advance noting that. The hostess sat us and said happy birthday but it wasn't acknowledged by our server at all, disappointing. On top of that, my lobster was overlooked and tough. All the side dishes were no good, cold pasta with no sauce or any seasoning, bad veggies looked like they were cooked out of a frozen pre packaged bag. You could find way better places in San Fran.  The wasabi fried oysters were good though.

c5jhbG9xsd8Ci_EFX-MyGg.review_text: Best seafood restaurant I've ever been to. The shellfish sauté blew my fricken mind! Buttery delicious lobster, scallops, and other shellfish over rice pilaf. It was unbelievably awesome. The staff obviously love working there. It's clear that the culture there is all about treating you like family. It's believable because they mean it. I don't think I can ever come to San Francisco again without a visit to Scoma's!

JEJjk4COmdqnDE5hQHsksQ.review_text: Scoma is a seafood-lovers dream. The menu is bursting with a variety of local fare prepared simply but full of flavor.  My boyfriend ordered the lobster bisque and was thoroughly surprised by how delicious it was (coming from the east coast he was skeptical). He said it had the perfect balance of cream and lobster. He also ordered his first Dungeness crab and loved it. It comes with a side of either regular melted butter or garlic butter and he said the garlic butter was definitely the way to go.  If you aren't a seafood eater there are few options for you so i would suggest going elsewhere. They do seafood exceptionally well and that's definitely what you should come for.  As far as ambiance it seems to be on the fancier side though it's filled with tourists for afternoon lunch and it doesn't appear to enforce a dress code. I imagine that's different for the evenings. It's also situated back off the main drag basically in the marina which makes for some wonderful views and a quieter atmosphere.

7KFWWjzHOSBl9HDVXkyusQ.review_text: Its really cramped in there but the food is wonderful. They have valet parking (its a little pricey) so its convenient. You get an awesome view of the Warf from where ever you sit. I have been coming to this place for almost 30 years, and I will always make a trip to Scoma's when I am in San Francisco!

gyvBwQPhZiJkND2tpjYz1A.review_text: Love, Love, love Scoma's! The Dungeness Crab Cocktail is to die for - you have to get it everytime you go. You can't go wrong with a seafood pasta dish or ordering shellfish a la carte. I don't eat red meat but my friends have never complained. :)   The waiters are lifers so don't expect them to be too nice but know they know the menu. Give em hell - ask lots of questions, I always do.

kXXrzVUFZJvPaj5cEcixpg.review_text: All I can say is Its the best!!!!!!!!!!! My favorite place by the water!!! Awesome service and the fish is very fresh. A must go to!!

JcKk7zEd46yj0hnuSQUwXQ.review_text: I have been coming here my entire life! No joke....do the math. This has been a family favorite for years as well as a family tradition. I haven't needed a menu in many years. The food here speaks for its self, staff here is a very regular thing that you can always count on.....however, today my server was CC. The single best server I have ever had here in many years! Great personality and introduced the menu like a true professional. When a very small issue arose she did everything that was needed to do the first time and was very gracious and polite!

3tzF8fVMfwDgm6UuM7GGZw.review_text: Great Sicilian style fish, soups and the oysters were some of the best I ever had. Excellent choice if your in the area.

ESrzDFy58BXa_ZOsa41yVg.review_text: Every single time I've eaten at Stevens Steak House, it has been a truly amazing experience! I love their steaks and seafood! The Latin dancing and atmosphere after-hours is also outstanding! The #1 Salsa and Bachata nightclub in CA for sure. Sunday nights are the best!

WRLPpHbEBjgf160n5pfdoQ.review_text: We were looking to find a good seafood spot around Fisherman's Warf trying to avoid chain restaurants or over the top trendy & pricey places. A friend told us try out Scoma's, they have been there forever and continue to add on due to great business.  My wife and I split the salad, some oysters, and the Shellfish Saute.  it was all great.  They did not have saltines for the Oysters but they were fresh and good enough to have out of the shell. The prices are not cheap but good value for great seafood and what little you might save at a chain is not worth it.  Live Life !!!

jFnmh5tfjLJFBiG7rMg5yg.review_text: When searching for 'best crab in SF',Scoma's comes up. Be advised that this is not a place for a hearty lunch in your sightseeing clothes. Although the ambiance was similar to that of a wood paneled 60's ranch looking out on an industrial park.we felt out of place. This is more of a planned dinner destination. The wait staff was professional and the food was good. My bf started with clam chowder which he loved, my lobster bisque tasted tomato-y and not at all of lobster. We ordered the cold seafood platter which had two oysters , 4 pieces of dungeness and 4 shrimp that were all delicious.  Pricey and the raw clams were iffy.   Def recommend coming  not on a whim

Nw2CWSef8zlpc79XMLlRjA.review_text: Best fresh seafood in the Wharf.  Scoma's "lazy man's" cippino ($39) is large enough for two and still leaves some to take home. We ask for Bruce-best waiter.

m_dpeYKcVRdCoQIVJ6DoOA.review_text: San Francisco ledge.   Sort of underground, off the beaten path of the touristy crab traps, which is why I love it! Great crab, oysters, wine and fun old school atmosphere... on the ocean!   Go here!

bhJ6ivAuSpgXP4JiKWjSZQ.review_text: Expensive!  Wasn't as easy to find as I thought it would be.  Small restaurant.  Nice ambiance.  Our waiter was a little arrogant.  Good bread.  Son ordered lobster tail.  The market value was $54!  Husband had salmon and enjoyed it.  I had the vegetable risotto. It was good but nothing I would order again.

w2YNH3J0autlqlg35m_iSw.review_text: We had a great waiter (Waiman) and the food, wine and service were faultless.   The crab was delicious but the star was the clam chowder. No surprise to the staff at Scomas there I think.

2_cYY6CX82oblZZDC1MOpQ.review_text: I had to try the San Francisco institution for crab. They did not disappoint. Let me reiterate what others have said -- don't let the fact that it's in the central hotbed of tourist action dissuade you from coming. The food is legit.  The service was also impeccable. I brought my own bottle of wine and made a special request (spinach served before crab), both of which were handled perfectly. Love them, mean it.

ar_UdO8bU_jknaXSM6ytNw.review_text: We found Scoma's on Yelp and not disappointed. The Seafood we had fresh oyster, Garlic Dungeness crab, Sand Dab Fish, and clam chowder are really fresh and tasty. good sourdough as well. Our server "Lillian" is knowledgeble in the menu list, and helpful. We all enjoy the food, service, and our trip to the Fisherman's Wharf.

QsMLT06-s4vltVIz8DgpMw.review_text: Their seafood is ridiculously good, I can't believe this was the first time I've ever been here. We came for dinner on a Saturday (we made reservations ahead of time), and were seated right away.   We ordered the Ciopinno (drool...) and the Mixed Seafood Grill (consisting of grilled shrimp, scallops, and salmon). We also ordered fried oysters and lobster bisque as starters. I'll begin with the fried oysters, which were fried perfectly. Breading was crispy like a panko breading, and the oyster was fried just enough to give it that crispy edge, but without drying the oyster itself out. The lobster bisque was on point, savory but not too salty.   Now, the Ciopinno was great; the tomato broth was a bit on the rich side, but not enough to cover the taste of the seafood. Mussels were cooked just right, soft and not rubbery. Scallops were amazing, and the fish was fantastic. The mixed seafood plate was amazing; their grilled shrimp was probably the best shrimp I've ever had. The seasoning was SO good, and the shrimp itself had that snap/crunch which all grilled shrimp should have. Salmon was perfectly cooked through; moist but not raw, and was seasoned well. Scallops were great too, as expected.   I'd recommend coming here for any special occasion. The staff is well trained, courteous and very accommodating should you have any special needs.

tMT6ICot_b1cAeZPvG7JxQ.review_text: We came to Scoma's on a recent trip to SF to visit family, and wanted to try some local seafood. They suggested this place - so we figured if the locals thought it was good - it's probably pretty solid.   It's definitely really old-school - both in terms of the atmosphere and the food. The service was great, they helped us navigate a somewhat vague food menu. The food was also really good. My scallops were outstanding, but my prawns were a bit dry. Everyone else at my table really enjoyed their meals as well. One person we were with - who is originally from SF - swears by the Cioppino and made all of us try it. It's HUGE, and despite four people trying bites, and her giving it her all, she still took a boatload home.   It's pretty pricey, but it feels like one of those classic, old-school seafood restaurants that you have to try. Why change if it's still good, right?

auPmZp0fAi0kxlYppfg1XA.review_text: We had several dishes, including the Seared Tuna, which I get everywhere, so lots to compare it to. Hubby had Crab Louis salad, which was way overpriced. Everything was okay, but nothing was great, and the prices were high for what you get. Older decor (and not in a good way). Very good service, though. I'd say 2.5 stars would be more a more accurate rating, but I couldn't give 3 stars based on the prices..

AR5UkND2s1kj4JBGWmX2MQ.review_text: Its good food, I was happy with my meal. I also sampled off the other plates in our party, those were equally as good.

Io1ILaKfXwA0XUratbsKhQ.review_text: Here's what you need to know...  It's a tourist trap but a decent one.  Their fish and shellfish are very high quality and fresh.  If you have a view of the water you scored; I usually am seated with a view of the parking lot and pier.  They have a surcharge of 4% for the "health and welfare" of their staff; thanks Obamacare!  Their soups, both clam chowder and lobster bisque are delicious.  Entrees are fairly expensive, don't let the cheesy atmosphere here fool you, the owners think they have quite the classy establishment  Vince Scoma was in my 6th grade class at Moraga Junior High. :-)

obYOl9fLdlvU_0nRmGY1Bg.review_text: The place is old school italian place which I love....You get the mom and pops vibe right away. The food was amazing. The Deep fried calamari is the best. I ordered salmon on veggies, it was amazing. Better than any Seattle salmon I have had. The staff  is very nice. Free bread.

nL2lx_DKWp0QTJ1t17dATg.review_text: Love the atmosphere and the food was great - perfect portions.   The staff is EXCELLENT. From the host to the waiter, everyone in the restaurant was friendly, informed and genuinely very nice. They were very nice to my kids and the children's meals are actually very generous. Loved the fact our waiter was so nice when my son asked for shredded cheese on his french fries!  Also, you can't beat the location on a small pier on the water. Gorgeous.

EWPk6-PeaOt2k6GcJ0JKjg.review_text: Scoma was recommended by a friend who had lived in SF many years ago and this place used to be her favourite restaurant, frequented by a lot of locals.   From my experience, I dont think that holds true anymore. Like myself, I saw a lot of tourist/ out-of-town patrons....well, there is nothing wrong with that but with that said, it is disappointing to see people walking into such high end restaurant in football jersey or jeans. I almost felt overdressed!  Food was delicious. The clam chowder is one of the best I've  ever had ($9 a bowl, it bettter be!) and for my main, my grilled prawns was really good and cooked to perfection (love the slight burnt grill taste)...the sides that came with my main were vegetables and some sort of wild rice (love it!)...very buttery.  From reading other reviews, it looks like Scoma's standard has dropped throughout the years. But from a first timer's experience, I enjoyed my meal tremendously and would definitely recommend to others.

XSs6zVmiwH_r5D5QQ7b-sw.review_text: I cannot believe people wil wait 30, 40, 60 minutes to eat here.  We had a reservation, were seated 35 minutes late, and sorry, the food  is NOT good enough to justify any sort of wait. We  had a fantastic server who single-handedly saved the evening, but the hostess-on-a-power-trip was just awful to deal with.  No explanation, certainly no apology.  Just a sour, smug blemish on our celebratory evening.  We will not be back.  Life is too short, and San Francisco is too wonderful to waste on this outdated and grossly over-rated restaurant.

s2mC8x80m86Vzs62Z8fbHA.review_text: We decided to give this place a try since it had 4 stars...  I'm quite disappointed at the service we received here. The waiter took forever to come and acknowledge that we sat down. He brought water with him but took forever to bring out the beverages we asked for. He even forgot to bring an alcoholic beverage that we ordered.  We finally knew what we wanted to order so we placed it. 2 whole crabs, halibut, calamari, lazy man ciopinno, clam chowder and a ceasar salad.  When my brother said he wanted the whole crab and then ordered the halibut the waiter said so you don't want the whole crab?? And we all looked at him crazy!  My brother said he wanted both and the waiter said oh that a lot of food and told us the market price for the crab, making us feel like we couldn't afford it or something.... This guy was pissing us off! Maybe because he serviced the Caucasian people a lot faster then he did us brown folk!  Everything took forever to come out!!! Our drinks were empty and our waiter was nowhere to be found!  The food was honestly mediocre... The ciopinno is nothing fancy at all. For our bill being $230 for only 3 of us wouldn't have been bad if the waiter didn't take so long! We still left him a decent tip even though he made us feel like we weren't worthy to dine here.  I usually go to Pompei's Grotto which is a lot better and the service is amazing!! The food is also better in flavor than Scoma's.

6-US7xMW86ogW4fJ4CWBzg.review_text: Right on the water. The food was great. I got the cioppino and it was awesome.  There are a lot of older people here. Not saying that's a bad thing, but it just seemed to be their target demographic.

pDRTHlNjs0Z8a6JuhW2UCA.review_text: WOW !!!  What a find. I asked a few fisherman at the bar we were at where is the best place to get Cioppino... Both at the same time said Scoma's. I asked where it was and was told ats just around the corner on the right. Walked over in 2 mins and put our name in(always busy here btw ) and were called in 15 mins. WOW !!! one of the best I ever had and I have had it in a lot of places too. Will be back next time in town... WE LOVE SAN FRANCISCO !!! Great city to be in

onXW3feeMlULCH5z-ebyEA.review_text: I enjoyed dining at Scomas! Many reviews mentioned that the resturant needed updating, but a Detroit girl like me can appreciate a resturant with history, good service and an ole school feel :-)  The food was amazing!! We ordered crab cakes for an appetizer. The cakes were soooooo FRESH, served with a delicious sauce and atop a small bed of lettuce.   I ordered shrimp annuzzi. Let me tell you...this dish was bursting with flavor. The shrimp were cooked to perfection (lightly pan fried in an egg batter) along with rice and veggies. Btw, the dish had eight large prawns, for thirty bucks. Really??? Why are people complaining about prices??? Very satisfied!! I have no issues with paying for good food.   My boo ordered shrimp/Dungeness crab risotto. I had a spoonful of it. It tasted amazing.   Too stuffed for dessert. This is a MUST STOP if you're in San Francisco. The waiters were cute, with their formal outfits.

XnKUcmayZd-N43fR2n-0Ew.review_text: Best Crab meal I have ever had. Well trained professional and mature wait staff was very nice. The sourdough was sublime, and the wine was aplenty. That all makes for one memorable night out in San Francisco, and Scoma's delivered on a an enjoyable Fisherman's Warf Dinner out. I am old school seafood and cut my teeth at The Rusty Pelican, putting in almost a decade as a manger, so I know quality when I see it. The only reason the place got less then 5 stars was it needs a face lift and a good dusting. The hostess stand is antiquated and needs to be changed. The hostess stand is almost like a betting window at an old race track, only less welcoming, and the rest of the place, except the dining room seemed dingy.  Would I recommend Scoma's? HECK YES!!!! plan on a wait but there is a bar!

TVgDN-CZ0wdszYCFXDtOug.review_text: I have been to Scoma's on three different occasions - twice for dinner, once for lunch.  Each time, I have enjoyed my meal and the service has been excellent - from the hostess, to the bartenders, to the wait staff.  The couple of times I have been for dinner, there was a wait so I would suggest making a reservation.  Ask for a table overlooking the bay.  It is a bit pricey but given that it is located on the Wharf, I guess it is to be expected.  What you will get in return is a quality meal served by experienced and attentive wait staff.

XYew8zIiR2AgELJKG9qpsw.review_text: This Really Is Worth Your Time And Money.The Service Is Impeccable And The Food Is Outstanding.Their Clam Chowder Is Incredible.I Had Halibut And I loved It Also. The Hubby Had Shrimp And Loved It As Well.

OVePUY8f_l6fj-7-roweTw.review_text: Went twice while i was in town for 3 days. Just go you will not be disappointed!! Great food great service!

P7Z8zXZDDrxY9P14Znjc-g.review_text: Because of Yelp's high reviews we decided to eat at Scoma's for lunch.  I ordered the Fix Petrale which was baked sole and vegetables. Included in this order was a small bowl of chowder.  The clam chowder was the best item that was served. The baked sole  was dry and  not very tasty. The vegetables were also undercooked and cold. The service was alright but not great.  I understand the chowder on the street is as good if not better than Scoma's. I wouldn't eat here again.

ZM1bouHR6IvPTUQLvtQVCQ.review_text: One of the best dinners I've ever had. Simply amazing! Our server was so nice. He left us alone when appropriate and was there when we needed him. Love the atmosphere of this place. Go!!

bztV18ThPu9_94kS4lMeRA.review_text: Hello,  My name is Shelly and my family and I have been coming to Scomas for several years.  We have always said Scomas was our favorite restaurant in the city to dine at and we would always make the drive from San Jose to San Francisco to enjoy our favorite foods and see the wonderful staff who have become friends to my family and I.  Yesterday was my Mom's 67th Birthday, so we all came to Scomas for lunch to celebrate her special day.  We found out yesterday that Scomas is not the same anymore and we are so very sad because we will not be returning.  My husband and I would always order the cioppino and yesterday we were shocked to see that the portion size was cut in half and the price remained the same.  No one in our party had the chunks of crab legs in our food like we always were served.....the crab was a small portion and shredded.  I ordered the vegetables because I have always loved your sauteed veggies and yesterday I was served grilled veggies that were horrible.  Everyone in our party was so upset to see their lunch entrees were not the same anymore.  It is very sad to know that your menu has changed and the food we have always loved for the past 20 years is no more.  It saddens us to know we will not see our favorite servers anymore.  You were like a family to us.

VIEK34UOVmyzmnJtwv8ByA.review_text: I agree that this place is a hidden gem in SF's Fishermans Wharf. It has great food with a nice view of the bay and the yachts (depends on where you are seated).   My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday celebration last month, he knows that I love seafood so much and I don't like to go anywhere fancy. This place passed all my expectations! They serve the best seafood in Fisherman's Wharf although very pricey. I didn't know what to order because there are so many selections to choose from. But our server recommended the food that I had. I forgot what it's called but it has lobster, crab, scallops  , shrimps, pasta and rice in it. I was first hesitant to order what the server suggested because I always know what to get and I'm not quite use to being told what to get. But soon as they serve my food, it smelled great and it tasted great! The portion was really big too! After that, they serve me a surprise birthday chocolate cake (on the house), I love how it's not too sweet, just perfect!   I want to talk about our server really quick, he is very nice and funny because he sang me the happy birthday song even it was just by himself singing. Lol Thank you, server!  The ambiance of the place is OK, it's dated and there are more oldies than young people. It's casual attire and the place is not too loud. If you want to go to this place, make sure you have a RESERVATION!  Highly recommend and I would definitely go back again! :)

WM4DXNTq4vb81rEFXsH_9A.review_text: Love This Place......  Can you say, "MARKET PRICE"?   ALL of the food is Fan-Tas-Tic!! Service is Spectacular, especially if you have "Papi".  Old World Charm, Excellent Service, Very Good Food... Make a reservation or expect to wait, but its worth the wait!

jBMtAP37MR9Kk--iiooqjw.review_text: It's on the pier, but views of the bay are limited. The fishing boats and SF hillsides at night are lovely, though. We were seated at a table that received a big draft of cold air every time the doors opened, which wasn't comfortable. On the other hand, the food was delicious, prepared to order, and the wait staff were friendly and observant. Children (at other tables) were made welcome, and that is nice to see. A little overpriced, I think, but bayside property (even on a pier) must be pricey, too. They're forgiven. Go for the fresh seafood! It's wonderful.

T2gH3azj_24N4DiyoPPZQQ.review_text: We were there in oct 2014. Enjoyed and very good food. Highly recommended for fresh seafood.

Q6cB7t4wHNMCK5HR8aagXA.review_text: The food was just ok, but I was expecting something amazing for all the rave reviews all the tour places gave it. They must be paid off.   My wife had lobster ravioli and it was bland. I had shellfish sec and it was still just ok. Bland.  Way overpriced for what you get. Blue mermaid was much better and cheaper.

6lS5-2TYITCAL2snIqMx7g.review_text: I have been here several times, although I never checked in here.  All I can say, is this place rocks!!!!!!  I have never had a bad meal here, the service is always great, the food is consistently great, and for San Francisco, they offer free valet parking, and that is huge.  The seafood is great, the steaks will melt in your mouth, and the oysters are fabulous...  I strongly suggest you try this place if you have never been here....

5piB75GyRvlhCOSxfnhwWg.review_text: This place is out of its prime.... We had 4 different entrees, each for nearly $40 a pop, and all were "ok" at best. 3 of the 4 were downright disappointing. I had he "Lazy Mans Ciopinno" - I should have taken the hint. It tasted like Campbell's tomato soup with some seafood. Portions are huge, but it doesn't matter if the food isn't good.

Ml2i2mGdUyrRswXZZlbKNw.review_text: Overdue review... but better late than never?  Known for their seafood at Fisherman's Wharf. Thank goodness they offer valet parking! Definitely saves time and it's FREE! :)  Food-  Dungeness Crab Cakes on Watercress Salad - Crabcakes were crispy with small chunks of crab. Watercress salad was refreshing and complemented well.  Lantern Scallops and Fettuccine - Scallops were pretty small... Pasta was rich in flavor, but nothing to be amazed or wowed by.   Chocolate Brownie and Vanilla Bean Ice Cream - Can't really mess up with this dessert.... but tasted delicious especially mixing the brownie with the ice cream!  Service was just OK.... but prices are definitely higher since you're at Fisherman's wharf. (This restaurant is definitely a tourist trap!) The restaurant was really packed that Saturday night. In my opinion, I don't think I'll be back just because I have had better seafood meals elsewhere.

sT5rA-ELaGdf65KXWjPKLQ.review_text: Nice place on the wharf. Good food & nice atmosphere. Little pricey but its a tourist area, so we expected that. Wish all restaurants would season food though.

xicLYs-5BIHLKQv8Hhq_ow.review_text: Eh... I was wondering if this was one of those touristy places that draw you in. My coworkers wanted to go here so I did some research and it came up in the top 10 seafood restaurants in SF. The seafood was fresh, but the dishes and flavored were not my favorite.   We had a sampler to start with calamari, crab cakes and shrimp scampi. Everything was ok, but nothing wonderful. I was not very hungry so I had lobster bisque and oyster alla scoma for my meal. The bisque had good flavor but don't expect to find any chunks of lobster. The oysters were rather disappointing. They were covered in aioli! I love mayo but it was just too much. My colleagues had salmon which they all enjoyed, but no one was raving. Desserts looked although I didn't have any.

KeiOUdpKz3hOn8ncAeddjg.review_text: Had a delicious meal here but beware- the entree portions are huge! My boyfriend and I each got a cup of their famous clam chowder which was tasty but very rich/creamy. For entree, I had the mixed shellfish saute and my boyfriend and had the diplomatica pasta. We definitely could have shared one of the entrees. There was so much seafood which was refreshing because most restaurants skimp on the seafood. For dessert, we shared the apple crisp a la mode which was just okay. The place is a great location being right on the water. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone coming to the Wharf.

xCZoEjVXr6rvmEIlSpSm9w.review_text: My favorite place to get Dungeness crab that's excellent every time! Service is always great even when the place is super crowded

mIo2cFs_89a7i0DWHT9F-w.review_text: After multiple trips to Scoma's I still can't give this San Francisco institution more than three stars. I know I am going against the grain but I can't compromise my honesty.  Here is how I came to this conclusion:  - Pricey: $190 for a bad Louis salad, one good entree, two mediocre entrees and a glass of house white wine -Seating: The chairs remind me on banquet chair.  There isn't much space between tables either. -Views:  Old fishing trawlers and assorted other beat up boats with an occasional seal. -Food: Swordfish piccata was yummy. The rest of it was unremarkable (Louis salad, crab cakes, seared tuna). Seared tuna was overdone.

3_hUWVllRGwj7fVRGbVDjg.review_text: Amazing food. Great service from waiters that aren't there just to sell you whatever's expiring in the fridge. Romantic location by the water or even intimate corners for the couples.  Ordered the Cioppino and Lobster tail. (Was planning to order a clam chowder [cause I heard about the raves] and the polenta [just cause I was in the mood] but the waiter warned us against, even though they were both delish, that we were going to be too stuffed and wouldn't be able to enjoy it all) props to the waiter.  Cioppino was very big! (Thank Tony for the warning!) The sauce was amazing, salty, tomato-y, and full of flavor. Big chunks of fresh fish, crisp shrimp, and fresh clams. Lots of pieces of crab too.   Lobster was a very good portion. Sweet and tender while keeping that crisp crunch you like to see with fresh seafood. Comes with a side of veggies, rice, and pasta.  Service was great. Food was great. Price was on point to the location and food.

OSU8q3vkb8t6IXac4y9vHw.review_text: I give a 3.5 stars.   One star for the awesome staff and service. Our waitress Lilian was friendly and attentive.   One more star for their fried calamari. Best fried calamari I have had. And another 1.5 star for the trio appetizer the boyfriend and I had ordered.   As for my plate, the Sand Dab, it is usually a great tasting fish but what came with my fish was boiled Pennae pasta and over cooked asparagus. The sand dab did not have the garlic caper flavored sauce that the fish was to be cook in. Instead, it tasted like a light white fish in batter. I would call my sand dab, fancy fish filets or fish sticks. As for the Pennae it had no flavor. When I say boiled that's it. It was dry and had no seasoning. And as for my asparagus it was too mushy and soft. Not worth $30. I wish I ordered something else.   And I did not want to hurt my boyfriend's feelings cause he raved about this place being awesome, and that he wanted to take me here to try it out. So thanks to him, but I guess I wouldn't order the sand dab again. At least not here.   But overall, I will come back one more time in hopes I order something better and not be a disappointment.

OLTUhNOaZ8dE9FIvYg8R6g.review_text: Great seafood and good customer service.

Qq-0s5rHNZvSys3hbpwB7w.review_text: Never disappoints us!!! Always fresh, deliciously prepared. A must-do on the wharf!! If you like Cioppino (fish stew) you won't likely find a better (more hardy and fresh) preparation anywhere.

E_liLDoiGAWdEByYrnKCIw.review_text: Scomas is a San Francisco institution. It's located in crazy touristy area of Fisherman's Wharf, but it's tucked away from the hustle and bustle right on the water. They have a great happy hour in the bar. All their bar menu items are made in smaller sizes, but it's only $5 each plate. I ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl and oysters, along with a Brancott Sauvignon Blanc ($9). The only open bar was facing the parking lot and pier, which was a bummer. They have another bar with a better bay view, but it wasn't open yet.   I arrived at 4:30 on a Wednesday, the bar was full. The service was quick and attentive. As soon as I sat down, the bartender took my order. The clam chowder bread bowl was excellent and quite substantial. The non happy hour price is $11, for $5 this is the best deal in town. The chowder was thick, full of clams, sourdough was fabulous and oh so tasty!   My oysters were great. For the happy hour, you get 3 nicely sized oysters.  I can't wait to come back for dinner!

ZpUI9ze0YlA6nMSHwx3ZYQ.review_text: Used my Yelp app on my Android phone in the Fisherman's Wharf area and found Scoma's. Scoma's was a little hard to find from the main Fisherman's Wharf area as one needs to walk down an alley towards the Pier 47 before finding the main entrance at the back of the restaurant.  The interior is upscale, classy, and dated. The host was in a full suit and the wait staff were all in white tuxedos. Our request for a table with a view was honored.   Our meal started off with bread which was the worst part of our meal. The bread was cold and stale. ...the butter was also cold and didn't even start to melt on the cold bread...  The appetizer sampler was out of this world! At $26, there was plenty of fried calamari which was super fresh, perfectly cooked (not rubbery) and lightly battered. The crab cakes were melt-in-your-mouth good and the shrimp scampi was delicious too! :D  The Lazy Man's Cioppino that our waiter and Yelpers raved about was over-rated and over-priced at $36. The seafood stew was okay. The best part was probably the garlic bread that was dipped into the marinara sauce.   Service was friendly by our waiter. He even brought and tied a bib around our neck, which was definitely a nice touch! :)

iHVE2rY2N6X8XORc7HYeAw.review_text: I actually forgot the exact name of my dish but it was basically Parmesan encrusted sole fillet with some other things (Ha!) and it was super delicious. Its located in a nice area so it had a nice view if you sit by the window it even outdoors.  Their clam chowder is also a good choice if you're looking for a nice meal and don't want to pay $20 for your dinner.

XiRtOenP8pJobOcqd-JUYQ.review_text: So I'm already over 2 years over due for this review, but believe me it is not easily forgotten.    Growing up in south Florida I thought I couldn't travel anywhere where the seafood could come close to that of the Florida Keys; I was wrong.  I visited Scoma's on the recommendation of an acquaintance that lived in San Fran for many years.  She said it wasn't to be missed, that is an understatement.  Located on Fisherman's Wharf, I wouldn't have thought to try this place.  I tend to gravitate and investigate where the locals go as opposed to the tourist traps in major city's which are usually mediocre at best.    The experience at Scoma's was far from mediocre.  By far the freshest most delicious shellfish I have had to date.  I ordered the shellfish in a garlic and butter wine sauce over pasta along with the dungeonous crab appetizer.  Truly a heavenly experience.  The service was top notch, the view from the restaurant was beautiful and the food was outstanding.  I don't believe I ate for the remainder of the day as the serving was rather large and frankly I don't think my palette would have been pleased with anything else that day.  When in San Fran this place is not to be missed.  On my next visit to this most beautiful of city's I intend to fulfill my glutenous desires at this little gem.

vPw0gHjjFRzklcekC5qlgw.review_text: I ordered the seafood pasta from the pre fixe lunch menu.  The food was delicious, was a great value.  The decor is definitely outdated but I know some people like that.

OvR19daYCBiL4FnZOQzQsA.review_text: The pearl of the wharf.   Within seconds of being seated, I hit the waiter with:   1 bottle of Kendall Jackson 2011 Limited Reserve 2 Lobster Bisque 1 order of Oysters Rockefeller 1 Cioppino 1 Pasta Diplomatica  This is how its done people. This is the perfect dinner. I really don't have much more to say. Try this.   You're welcome.

LYu1i818sRwZIf8Atany4Q.review_text: Have been here a few times but this was our first time ordering the shellfish saute. Incredible mix of lobster, crab, shrimp, and scallops. Drinks were okay, dungeness crab cocktail was also incredible.

7sxLWrECG44ZMnmbLSGYMw.review_text: I was recently there a few days before Thanksgiving with some visitors from out of the country.  I was quite disappointed, I had the Lazy Man's Cioppino and the clam chowder.  The chowder was not good... The Cioppino was watery and bland.   For the price, better to go to The Waterbar down the street...

7mXrlHTcWT_g8Z6BWVZgKw.review_text: The first time I ate here was on a visit with my parents when I was a teenager. Loved it then and I've visited a number of times over the years when in the area on business. This time I was in SF on vacation with my family and we walked over for lunch. This place is lovely with great service and such a lovely old school feel. The atmosphere is a cut above some of the other restaurants in the area and the food is outstanding. Even the kids loved it. Great service, view and food. I always leave thinking of when I might manage to squeeze in another visit.

-z4PYdA2F5O-r3nf34LiCw.review_text: Super happy with this friends reccomondation!  Pasta alla scoma was fantastic. Yelp came really handy with a photo. The Wild Alaskan Halibut was so fresh it tasted more like chicken then fish. Absolutely no fishy taste what so ever. Also had the calimari Calabrese fritti.....  So GOOD! A must have. Older atmosphere but with traditional pier flair. Out waiter was off the boat from Greece and served us well. Must recommend and or return.

fitXjNnwVB_HzqaBSrIGXQ.review_text: Excellent old school seafood restaurant. This place isn't fancy (save for the classy white dinner jackets of the waiters) but it is pricey. It's definitely worth experiencing at least once since it's such an institution. The wait on a Saturday can be easily a hour or more without a reservation.  From the time you walk in until you walk out, you are greeted from friendly hostesses and waiters. The waiters are funny and know the right amount of attention to give you.  The shrimp cocktail starter is a bit pricey for what you get but it's solid and on par with the value at any other place that has something like it on the menu. The clam chowder is EXCELLENT and I recommend splitting a bowl for two if you are thinking of each getting a cup (they just give you 2 cups worth in a bowl for $2 more). There's a lot of clams in the chowder. This place overall gives big portions though you're paying for it.  The ciopinno is excellent though it's more about the parts than the whole. The broth is almost a tomato bisque and it is filled beautifully with large pieces of seafood excellently cooked. It's less about the stew mixed together like other places in North Beach.  The whole garlic roasted dungeness crab is amazing. It's generous size and well cut up and prepared.   Definitely worth trying once. I spotted the large size crab louie salad and was blown away by the sheer size of seafood -- must try it next time.

7Wsd6EZ6GQhyvvrNJSHkkA.review_text: My all time favorite place for a delicious meal at this fabulous restaurant.  My boyfriend took me in a romantic date to Scoma's.  I ordered the Cioppino and my boyfriend mixed seafood grill, as well as lobster bisque and oysters.  Fresh and wonderfully prepared.  Excellent!  And well worth the price.  I also suggest going for lunch or happy hour at the bar. They have a great selection of appetizers at more wallet friendly prices.  Love this place!

ev3ufSElWCrqfi9js5FTmA.review_text: Great food and service. They were quite busy during the lunch hour, but we still received a wonderful experience with their staff.

xR4engcg6Vm8xToBgKI5FA.review_text: The perfect classic seafood restaurant on the water. Fresh, delicious food that is beautifully prepared and served with friendly, classy flair. Everything we ate was fresh, simple and delicious. We'll definitely be back!  The atmosphere of wood paneling, old photos of Scoma's fans, white napkins and sharply dressed waiters is a perfect complement to the delicious cuisine. Our Dungeness crab appetizer was so incredibly fresh! The individual flavors of every type of seafood in the Shellfish Sautee jumped out in every bite. The bread was fresh, the butter was soft, and the dessert plate was practically licked clean.   In short, if your wallet can support a special night, this place is a great choice.

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: Scoma's is old fashioned San Francisco. According to their menu they've been open since 1965 and most of the waiters look like they've been there at least that long.  They do not take reservations, but there was no wait for a party of 6 Sunday night at 6:30. Had we been a group of 3-4, there would have been a wait, but all of the larger tables were empty. So I guess if you don't want to wait, find some friends at the bar and see if you can't come up with a bigger group.  Cocktails were very good and I thought the bread was fresh and chewy. The portions here are enormous! I ordered the pasta garibaldi (linguine with salmon, scallops and mussels) in a sundried tomato pesto and could barely eat half. The sauce did not taste anything like sundried tomato pesto - in fact I'd be willing to bet money it was tomato sauce - but it was good, so whatever.  Others at the table got cioppino, crab spoon-bread, prawns and scallop platter, lobster bisque, and the crab cocktail. Everyone had good things to say about their food.  Service was ok - our waiter seemed like he was in a rush and left the table before everyone had a chance to order drinks. Water was refilled frequently and special requests were accommodated.  The atmosphere is really nice but the tables are much too close together. This would be a bad place for secret plotting, as the table next to you will 100% hear every word that you say.   Free valet is nice, but drive VERY slowly when entering and exiting their lot as it's one lane and a blind corner.
