fjrym7CX6prOoK04eet2WQ.review_text: 3.5 stars   My family's been going to Scoma's since before I can remember. Biggest negatives about the place are the parking and the wait. They do NOT take reservations.   Also it seems that the menu's downsized quite a bit over the past few years, as well as the portions. Dishes are very expensive, but the seafood is fresh, and the sourdough bread is delicious. Keep asking for more, and eat it with the clam chowder.   We usually get the King Louie salad, the pasta diplomatica with white sauce, and the clam chowder (always get the bowl, not the cup -- only $1 more!).   They have a lunch prix-fixe for $24.95 that's a good deal. Portions are large. Order to share.

OExAE3SpYNpWL6cHNV0jPg.review_text: Went here for the first time recently, and had the best salmon I have ever had!  Seriously, worth the price for a special treat lunch or dinner out.  Unfortunately, our server was not on top of her game, so not a 5 star meal for me, but the food was fantastic.  Oh, if you go, don't forget that they have complimentary valet parking.  Otherwise, parking in that area costs way more than the tip to the valet.

HR1wozuAE_3KAHFP1XvIjw.review_text: My mom actually recommended this place since she comes with her girlfriends for dinner whenever they are in the city.  It's a little tricky to get the restaurant since it's down a tiny alley that you have to pay really close attention to while driving, otherwise you'll miss it.    The second time around the block (since we missed it the first time), we drove right down and it was nice that there was valet service to take the car.  Once inside, it was cozy, and the view of the ocean with the ships in the distance made for a real San Francisco experience.    After being seated and looking at the menu full of items that all looked great, I made the smart decision to order from the Prix Fixe menu where I chose the Clam Chowder, a main entree that consisted of a shrimp/crab salad, and dessert.  For $24.95, it was the best deal of all and in the end, all of us decided to order from it.    The low down:  Clam Chowder:  Creamy, perfect potato to clam ratio, and great portion in a little cup.   Main Entree of Shrimp/Crab salad:  Cannot say enough about how good this was.  It was a huge plate of shredded crab, mini shrimp, romaine lettuce, kalamata olives, beets, and thousand island dressing on the side.  I almost couldn't finish it because it was so filling. Dessert:  Chocolate Mousse with Raspberry sauce-  Perfect ending to a perfect meal.

k9nUcZwsgRL3MdWBgd-28w.review_text: Touristy yes but still some of the best seafood in SF.  I'd recommend it to anyone looking for good, fresh seafood next to the water.

zQfszAWNRDjoo2RA_AD34Q.review_text: This is a nice classy old timer place with very nice ambience. You will know many people have been customers for years. The price matches the quality. We had to wait about half an hour to get seated but we sat at the bar and sipped more Pinot Noir while we were waiting. When seated I ordered the combo sea food, calamari and oysters to start and more Pinot Noir, We then noticed the portions were very good for this type of restaurant. It's not Majiano's Italian Restaurant but it can be very filling. You can share the food if you are not a big eater which places you in an outstanding position. I am glad I found this place. This will be my great refuge from frugality of my earlier years when I can enjoy some good seafood and feel I deserve a treat once in a while. It's. Sometimes enjoying life is what we are after without regard to saving money.

4hfETiyxeV_6O1zNIO8FhQ.review_text: Great location on the wharf although the location in Sausoiito is far better than five stars. Even with the normal wait if 45 minutes for a table it is well worth it. Best clam chowder and the sourdough bread comes fresh hourly from the bakery around the corner. Best advice I can give is before ordering the special ask the price. I failed to do this when they had a lobster special and it was $150. Anything with scallops is incredible. If you like it spicy, request the scallops be blackened.

vjcX3R3oSWASn5ge18KzGw.review_text: Wonderful seafood!  Ordered Cioppini and a shellfish which included rice pasta and veggies.  The food was absolutely wonderful.  A bit pricey, so I expected a more updated environment but I'm assuming they wanted to keep with the boat theme.  It would be nice if they made it a bit more spacious, it seems a little cramped.  Long wait to be seated but once seated it wasn't long for the food to come out.  I wouldn't mind going again.

rEBYbz6q2XXwNhzHZsBoKQ.review_text: Recently visited Scoma with friends in town from Europe.  Excellent meal.  Joey the waiter provided great service and enhanced the dining experience with his personal touch and recommendations.  Definitely recommend and will be back next time in SF

H8a-W9858Q9tbwEADFKcKQ.review_text: God this place is good. If you are going to do the wharf in SF, do it here.  After my dad begged for years, we finally brought him on Father's Day. We made a rezo online day of- no problem getting in! No wait! Valet is strange here... Very tight but cheaper than any parking garage in the area!!!  Large wine list. 4 different kinds were selected at our table and all were delicious.  Calamari for appetizer made the spicy way... Perfection!!!  Highlight of this meal... My dads CIOPPINO!!!! Omg!!!! Please. You must get this. This is the end all to be all.  My half baked crab was exquisite and garlicky, but if you are not willing to get cracking and stink like a shellfish the next 24 hours... I don't suggest it:) crab takes work!  A standout in this meal was my sisters lobster ravioli. Wow. Fresh lobster stuffed in pasta with a huge piece of salmon laid on top. Need I say more?  They have the best sourdough with EVOO for dipping..... Pair this with the huge bucket of cioppino  (it's seriously a huge portion) and you are set my friend.  Ps- if you watch the horse races on tv you know how legendary this place is! Ha!!! (Except hostess did not get this reference. Sigh-what a newb).

Dp73YMsqLBIIw97o6ruFsQ.review_text: We have been coming here for years and love that it seems out-of-the-way even though it's at Fisherman's wharf. The seafood is the specialty here. The chowder is thick and creamy. If you like shellfish, the sautéed shellfish is excellent and so are the salad Louis' if you prefer a cold dish. The tuna filet sandwich is very good. They also make great bloody Marys. Old school decor with impeccable service too. The servers are knowledgeable and efficient.

gBgQPUil0lYyOcBsMwebvw.review_text: Not bad..but not great. A bit over priced and super old school. The oyster sampler was good.

rmwyZXSoyjIgw_q18bzjjA.review_text: Very classy and very fresh. Valet parking is awesome.   Scoma has been around for a while and still standing strong. With fresh seafood, great service, and appropriate pricing.. I see why.   For the appetizers, we started off with half a dozen raw oysters. There were 3 varieties and 2 of each kind. It was a cool way of trying out different types of oysters to see which ones we like best so that we can order more of that kind.   I had the the wild caught king Salmon and it was divine. The outside has been seared nicely and the inside was pink. Served with some mashed potatoes and seasonal veggies, its a winner's dish. I can really taste the freshness of the salmon.   My partner in crime had the pasta with the little clams and holy jebus there was a lot of clams. We counted at least two and a half dozens of clams in that pasta.. which wasn't a bad thing. The juice of the clams imparted a lot of flavor that the pasta soaked up which was just great.

VAEUcVCiNwsjr_LN8rj51A.review_text: Scoma's was amazing. My friend and I came here for lunch. We both had the pre-fixe lunch and got clam chowder and a mixed louie salad (shrimp and crab louie mixed together).The lunch also came with a chocolate mousse cake. Delicious. Loved this place and I will for sure be coming back in the future.

D8RbIwp274MIazomRQ2oDw.review_text: Never knew this restaurant was located here. Tucked away from all the touristy restaurants. Brought our family who were visiting from out of the country.   If you love calamari you must order it here. It was super delicious! One of the best calamari appetizers we have tasted. Lightly battered and cooked just right. Bowl of clam chowder was also amazing paired with the warm and fresh sourdough bread. Tried my husbands Lobster Bisque and was also amazing. As my main dish I ordered the Fried Combo Platter - Shrimp, Scallops, and Pollock - this dish was good but not fantastic. Wish I would have ordered something more interesting. Nice list of wines to choose from.

7w3wy6oBwre3Bilc1cTOEw.review_text: Go here for your authentic local San Franciscan night out.  Recommended to us by one of the locals, my husband and I were so glad... I repeat SO GLAD we decided to eat here for dinner. The wait was about one hour for a table of two . We enjoyed conversation with our bartender. We did not mind. However, if you are the type that does....then I recommend doing a reservation. Awesome 1960's vibe.  Feels like you've stepped back in time. Now, I'm SUPER into that sort of thing. If you are uppity & wanting something super modern ...... steer clear of this place because you will give a buzz kill to everyone else attending this beloved establishment.

uRdmfjer9cTfYLmP0ky93A.review_text: very good pasta / seafood combinations.  You can change your sauce if you prefer a different one.  staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. calculate a 40 min wait even on a Monday night if you don't have a reservation

IgyUHX7lsh1zPAdaW4zikg.review_text: Sublime.  This was a tremendous experience for all six of us.  I had the cioppino and it was every bit as good as any I've ever had.  If you are looking for a good seafood restaurant in SanFran, this should be at the top of the list.

DU9kqCNO1_OH2MBndiMUfw.review_text: Seated right away. Long wait once seated to be greeted. Drink order wrong. Told no sole. Ordered cod. Out of that too! 2 drinks .. One wrong ... $26.00. Won't be back!!

BGDIspFceI6OcvBIQIlZ0A.review_text: Went here for the cioppino based on all the reviews. Maybe it was an "off" night but I and my dining companion found the cioppino lacking in flavor and agreed that the abundant white fish in our bowls was more reminiscent of the rubbery white erasers from grade school and less like fresh seafood we so expected to have.  The service was good, friendly and attentive, but I hope my review balances out those that raved over the cioppino which like a siren song, lured us to Scoma's.

GGSfLyM88SbFGhnm46ykXQ.review_text: I don't get it.....   Maybe because we went for Dine About Town, but the quality shouldn't suffer because of it  DAT lunch:  Clam Chowder - nothing wow and not a lot of clams  Salmon, Mussels, Sun Dried Tomato pasta - first bite it taste good, toward the end, I can't finish it because I was afraid all the oil will clog my arteries.  The bottom of the plate was soak in 5-6 table spoons of oil    Mussels were good, and the salmon was a little over cooked  Grilled cod - not a lot of taste and nothing wow.  Cod was a little over cooked too  Service was below par too, I asked for hot water and  the waiter didn't note it down so had to ask for it.

jfpL7iZ79fMSP3sodkjLfA.review_text: Very good food with service that was quite good. The waiter was more than happy to banter with us while we ordered and while checking in on our meal.   The only major critique I have was that it took a longer time to order than it should have. It was busy, but not to the point of slowing down the kitchen or waitstaff.   Overall I recommend to anyone seeking an Italian seafood restaurant.

iLUkEj-XMTYIr45ukkaMXg.review_text: Ok, maybe my love of being a tourist and childhood memories of this place taints my opinion but we had a wonderful dinner here.  The waiter was fun (and from Fresno) and the food was outstanding (Clams, Halibut, and Filet Mignon). Great SF wharf spot to eat.

FVk12H4Cz4DkRzl8N5-PGQ.review_text: Great chowder! Expensive but was amazingly delicious. My husband had the swordfish and really enjoyed it. I had the sand dabs and was also very happy. It seems like all the signed celebrity photographs on the walls are from the baby boomer generation but the food was worth the price tag.

N7x9AKSXgLOCMDbtpd50-A.review_text: if you want fancy, fresh seafood, come to Scoma`s. If you don't want to spend a lot of money, then order from the tasting menu if it is available. Smaller portions and smaller prices! Even with smaller portions, you will fill up! I love the woody décor and romantic candle-lit atmosphere Although, it may be a bit crowded depending on which part of the restaurant you are sitting in. Because Scoma`s offers the freshest, finest seafood dishes, they truly are the best seafood restaurant on Fisherman`s Warf!

s3bY53dDTJomRRusjsRwcA.review_text: 2nd time in San Fran, 2nd time at Scomas. Ridic amazing perfect clam chowder, literally headed straight there when I got to the city. Such a great location and classic feel to the place, overlooking the bay the fish were caught in while you eat. Chowder is incredibly spiced and I smile the entire time I eat it haha go get some

-nhBPP8dhKM1I_9_J8wmPQ.review_text: 2 Words. Fresh Seafood!!  I found this place using my trusty Yelp App while looking for a place to eat near Fisherman's Wharf and found this place. Its kind of hidden and you have to walk off the main street to get here. Anyway, I got the Fresh Salmon and my gf got the Clams. I have to say, everything was so fresh and tasty!! The clams were so delicious and the sauce was to die for! My Salmon was very flavorful and tasty as well. We also got the appetizer sampler, and I will say this, the crab cakes were so good they practically melted in my mouth!! MMMM  Service was top notch and service was prompt. If you are ever in the SF area and want fresh seafood, then give this place a try!!

7fH5EOeSEnQxRf4evoNeZA.review_text: Spent our family dinner here and had a delightful time. The service is friendly, and the food is absolutely delicious. It may look like an ordinary small restaurant by the bay, but the interior is as if I'm on a nice ship. You could definitely come dressed casually but the atmosphere allows you to go dressed up as well.

tj5PexVAfowjvoBW4u5y0Q.review_text: Have been here multiple times.  Guaranteed good quality food.  We wanted to get fresh seafood for lunch so we stopped here.   We had oysters, shrimp cocktail, clams on a half shell and lobster bisque soup.   The fresh Scoma sour dough bread is fantastic.    Service is good.   Would definitely return.

ljOSCLojeaQ336M59zEUKQ.review_text: Thank goodness for the Maps application on my iPhone. Scoma's is located right off Jefferson street, down an alley and next to the water. Great views of the marina and water!   The food here is solid! I loved the lobster bisque! So rich and creamy plus a bit of lobster pieces. This was my favorite part of my meal here! I ordered the rock shrimp and smoked salmon fettuccine. The shrimp and smoked salmon were cooked just right. Not overcooked at all. My only gripe with this dish was the over abundance of red onions! I like red onions, and a healthy addition of finely chopped pieces would be ok. Unfortunately, they put large slices that were overwhelming. Everyone else in my party was happy with their orders.  Seating here is kind of tight. The service was just ok. The host and our server lacked personality and enthusiastic service. Overall, good food and nice views. I definitely recommend to remedy those seafood cravings!

WmQpVokWmWMVja7sTDNm6Q.review_text: We came here today to celebrate my fiancé 30th bday lunch. Our waiter was Gus.  This gentleman has been there 17 years and was very exact with his recommendation s. The crab sandwich was delicious but the highlight of the meal was the clam chowder.  Normally I don't feel there is a difference between most restaurant clam chowders however this one absolutely stands apart from others as amazing.  I would strongly recommend it.  Also ask for Gus he was pretty kickass!

2t-9ivd6MszB7a_kLbfHsw.review_text: Clam showder is below average and all dishes came so fast that it looked like they were pre made in the kitchen (looks & taste). Lobster Thermidor was left on the side 'cause my dad could hardly eat it. My shrimp risoto was heavy and ended in the same way.

xaGHnjxQ-FfaTJZA9c37uw.review_text: Bad experience here.  Had dinner here at 6 after walking around the Pier for a few hours. Felt like we were judged by our appearance.    Our waiter Sergio was horrible. It was clear that he was favoring his other tables more. Never gave acknowledged our needs.   We left feeling neglected with service.  He only came by once to see if we needed anything.    The busboys gave us better service and were personable.   1 star for the food. I will never think about going here ever again.

RFpnfgB2dSLfGY00FppcAg.review_text: We were very much looking forward to eating at this restaurant because of word of mouth but weren't that impressed with the food. We like the feel of the place of an old school type of place with a touch of class with waiters in white jackets. The soups that we had were both very good, the lobster bisque and the clam chowder. Had the appetizer platter with calamari- good, crab cakes-below average and the shrimp- very good. The steamed crab was good but the dish I had was pasta noodles, rice, vegetables with very little seafood, and was covered with way too many mushrooms and for 40 dollars? The service was very good though.

wTe4kWXjAhtNq4litsYVXg.review_text: Everything was great intill we got to the  main course  my wife  halibut was dry  there special the scoma signature dish was horrible

B4hUj7DsgbHcckJ3Yl2FFQ.review_text: If you consider yourself a foodie tourist, be sure you take the extra little hike to Scoma's. You won't be disappointed, and you will avoid the less educated tourists wasting their time and money by the seafood shacks closer to the Fisherman's Wharf tourist traps.  Went here for lunch on a Friday. The lobster bisque rivals the best I've had in Boston. The flavor is perfect, not too creamy, not salty at all. Just fresh lobster goodness. I also tried the Grilled Tuna Steak sandwich. It was moist, and tasted super fresh. My companions had the Cioppino. It was the best I have ever tried. The broth was sweet from the tomatoes, but the natural seafood flavor added just the right amount of flavor without once making me think it was salty. Everything was cooked perfectly. The scallops had that snap and texture that is the mark of true freshness. Wow.  Our server Sean was great, very friendly and welcoming. In fact, the entire waitstaff here is all over the place (in a very good way), always attentive to the customers.  My only regret is that I got full. They have a great wine and draught beer selection as well.  Don't be a tourist, go to Scoma's!

MZuvl0oUK3QSv7faGx9i5w.review_text: We stopped in for a meal after passing a sign for this place on Jefferson Street. You'll need to walk/drive down an alleyway to get here. Don't mind the raccoons that live in the alley, they are as afraid of you as you are of them.  I started to see a trend that if you walk into any restaurant that has been opened for any length of time on the bay, it will be known as a "tourist trap." This is another one of those places. Tourist trap or not, it wouldn't still be open if the food wasn't good. I didn't identify where everyone was from in the place, so from a qualified standpoint I can say it was busy without the known tourist status of the visitors.  The place appears small, but deceitfully seats more people than you'd expect.  We sat at the bar and had their Seahorse cocktail, in other circles this would be known as a Moscow Mule in glassware. The drinks were refreshing and our bartender was extremely helpful during our visit.  From the menu, my fiancée ordered a cup of the clam chowder and the dungeoness crab cocktail. She said both were excellent. I had the dungeoness crab risotto. It is served in a generous portion and is a tasteful mixture of vegetables, crab, and risotto.  For those with gluten intolerance, the menu has an asterisk next to the options that are safe for you.  Scoma is a great seafood restaurant that is worth a visit if you're in the area!

hfZn7un8OZoT6B8JRTlMSA.review_text: If you are wanting wonderful cioppino on the wharf with a sunset view, this is the place.   The cioppino was full of delicious seafood and had a broth worth sopping up with the sourdough rolls.  Service was friendly and fast.

y3VYs63lDS2AD9TNLQSirw.review_text: The cioppino was delicious and lots of seafood. I think my husband's order of Filet mignon was messed up because I am gluten free. Good thing he filled up on garlic bread and didn't care he didn't get mashed potatoes. He said the Filet was very good. The service was good.

7dnh9OrD8LekBwvachGH5Q.review_text: Thanks to Yelp, I found this place.  But also, because of Yelp, it's really popular and the wait is long.  They have no clue how to estimate time since it took almost 3 times longer than they estimated.  I already made up my mind to give this place a bad rating.  However, when the meal came, I quickly forgave.  The best Cioppina and Clam Chowder I ever had!  Wow, it was that great.  The restaurant is hidden in Fisherman's Wharf since you have to walk in an alley where you can find this on its own pier.  But, again, thanks to social media, it is no secret  The waitress was among the best in service and advice.  The meal is 5 stars alone.  I knocked it down for one star for making us wait much longer than they estimated.  Be prepared for the wait and I guarantee that you will find the meal a great experience.  There are tons of places, much cheaper than this place, but you won't regret it.

LhFzr2vZDEc2KNHxuiHtIw.review_text: If I was a tourist I probably woudnt go to Scomas. You have to know about this place to look for it because it's hidden behind the touristy spots.   My friend told me about Scomas clam chowder so I had to stop by for some on my trip to s.f. It was restaurant week so I got clam chowder with a crab salad. Clam chowder was the best I ever had!!! there were tons of clams in there! and the crab salad was a favorite of san francisco, told by my waiter. I didnt believe him till I tried it! there were tons of crabs and it was so goood!!! Dressing was like a thousand island dressing. I love this place! and I would recommend this restaurant to anybody!!! get the clam chowder!!!! you wont be disappointed!

G9cOvWMz0u9wjtKc4sSL4A.review_text: Saw some amazing reviews on yelp and one of my older friends recommended this place. The restaurants been around forever and most of the servers have worked here for over 20 years or more per my waitress however they didn't have good food , well at least our lobster's wasn't good.   It's extremely pricey, it's an older restaurant, older demographic. Nothing trendy or hip. I wouldn't call it classy or elegant either, my chair was uncomfortable and my silverware was dirty, my waitress was super sweet about getting me a new set of silverware.. The servers have cute uniforms.   Our food cost around $150 for two of us, salad, entrees and desserts.   Both of our lobsters were super over cooked. My pasta had no flavor but it was cooked perfectly, no sauce , no seasoning just pasta. My steam veggies were just veggies , no flavor. I asked the server if the lobster is usually over cooked. She seemed offended that I asked her, she got into this whole thing about how they broil the food and how they have been in business since 1960's before I was even born, yeah she said that. She was an older lady and it was cute how she took pride in her job and the food, but at the end of the day we didn't like our rubbery over cooked lobster and the comment about when I was born was unnecessary.  My parents raised me to be polite to my elders, I just smiled and thanked her for letting us know. Anyways we didn't finish our meal and thankfully there is a thing called Yelp :) Despite our lobster experience I wanted to try the Jack Daniels bread pudding, so glad I did.   Personally I won't go back for their food however I might go back for the dessert if I'm in the area, however will never again make a trip to dine here. For us it was a complete waste of money and time.   The Jack Daniels Bread Pudding - 5 STARS - Delicious !!!    Lobster / Food - 0 stars  Customer Service - 2   2 stars overall because of the bread pudding !!

yzus_OrSfGNdmVYmOTcfBw.review_text: Good food, good location. Beautiful view.  Had discussed several different options near our Fisherman's Wharf hotel, and finally decided on Scoma's after reviewing our options on Yelp. It was my husband's birthday during our visit to SF and this was a great choice. We were a party of 3 adults and 3 kids and everyone was happy with their meals. Service was very good.  I'm holding back 1 star because the place needs an upgrade. The menu could be updated a bit and the decor/ambience could be improved a lot. It would take this place over the top especially in the location they're in.

LwqC94izxiTnbL1z4rhwvQ.review_text: I love it when i find a place worthy of a full five stars and this is definetly one! I love the free parking (they will even watch your segway for you). The hostess was friendly and made us feel welcome, the wait staff was just perfect. Our waiter Kevin was warm, genuine and he made me feel wealthy and important. The food was nothing but top shelf and all that i hoped it would be. I had the crab cocktail (worth it)and  the clam chowder (clam were soo tender you could just slurp um down except for good manners. The special fresh pick of the day fell on the saute' scallops, which came.with a medally of mushrooms rice pasta an veggies. Mmmmm mmmm! Just cant go wrong here. It is pricey but the portions and quality are worth it!

meKdJ1NunUhcR2ezjlEHXw.review_text: Great food! Awful service. Our waitress kept forgetting us. She also brought out the wrong salad order and was not clear on the "special". We were seated next to some very drunk couples who were so loud we could not talk to each other.

ew9IiI39GyH2vGyVhKSqaw.review_text: Best Tiramisu ever ! Drooollll The seafood was very fresh.On the expensive side. The menu had great variety.  The ambience is a little on the quieter side, with lots of senior citizens.Our server was very sweet and helpful . I have to try the lobster ravioli next time .

YdDbRhI1PS18MMttxQTVjA.review_text: This not only one of the best restaurants in San Francisco, it's one of the best restaurants I've ever been to!  It's a nice place right down by the water kind of hidden among the touristy Fisherman's Wharf.  I was here for lunch and the dress was pretty casual.  The wait staff was very friendly and helpful in explaining the menu and any special they happen to be offering. Their seafood is amazingly good.  Their bisque is the best you will ever have.

NPRyDEG1D2taLdbdXhrNlA.review_text: It must be me because the recent reviews are fabulous and mention that the food is always great but I did not feel that way.  I had the snapper and it was excellent but the broccoli was bland and the pasta was significantly undercooked. On the positive side, I enjoyed the view, the service was above average and I will go back because of the complimentary valet parking. In the coming months I will return, have a seat at the bar, and have a side dish because, in fairness, a restaurant with such a rich history deserves a second look. On the other hand, perhaps it was just me.

XuJxZu_tRiPCDZFaQF-Rdw.review_text: Tried will I was in San Fran on business 2 weeks ago.  I am a seafood junkie and this was one on the highly rated restaurants so i figured Id give it a try.  I'm a taster so I tried a bit of everyone's food.  LOL  My dish was the mixed seafood grill.  Very yummy!  I was afraid for the price I was going to be disappointed by the portions- but i was surprised.  Plenty shrimp, scallops, crab, and lobster.   I sampled the blacked shrimp, grilled salmon, and fried shrimp.. All very good.    The place is sort tight on space so expect to be elbow to elbow if you have a large party with you(We had 6 and there was no room at the table to move much).  Overall I would recommend...if you have the money to spare(bring a well packed wallet)  Entrees run from about $22 minimum on up.

_WDhO6yeZQoVo5agXH3Tbw.review_text: I came to Scoma's for Dine Around Town, and the food was so delicious!!  Me and my boyfriend came here with a friend for lunch, and we were seated immediately.  I was a bit surprised, since all the yelp reviews stated that they get busy and the wait can be long.  I guess I beat the lunch rush even though it was 1pm..lol.  When we ordered our dishes, I noticed the waiter didn't write anything down.  I was impressed by this, but I also hoped that he didn't forget anything. =)    While we waited for our appetizer, another waiter brought out a bread basket.  There were 2 bread sticks and half a loaf of sourdough bread.  The bread stick was crunchy.  I wonder if Scoma's made the bread stick.  The sourdough bread was very fresh!  It reminded me of Boudin's bread in Fisherman's Wharf, too.    There is a bottle of olive oil on the table, so my boyfriend and his friend poured it onto the bread plate.  They mentioned the bread stick didn't taste good with olive oil.  Appetizer: Cup of Clam Chowder All of us ordered the clam chowder as our appetizer, and we all loved it!  The clam chowder was filled with so many ingredients.  I remember tasting clams and crab!  The chowder was not too creamy, but it was very flavorful.  I think its the best chowder ever!  Entree: Broiled Swordfish with mashed potatoes and steamed veggies I was surprised by the huge piece of swordfish on my plate.  The swordfish was very juicy, so it was cooked perfectly.  The mashed potatoes was very good and not garlicy at all.  The steamed veggies was good, too.  Dessert: chocolate cheesecake with raspberry sauce and whip cream The chocolate cheesecake was very delicious.  The raspberry sauce went well with the cheesecake.  Even though the decor is fancy, the dress code is just casual. =)  The service here is great, too.  When ever we had an empty plate on the table, the waiter would remove it immediately.

deSAoTng9ytmUDx_q9bl2A.review_text: doesn't get any better then here. Fresh seafood. Excellent crabs in crab season. Reasonably priced as well.

Wxx8xDXJ4_P02Yq1tI92cw.review_text: LOVE this place. My dad has been coming here for 25 years. Lunch is the way to go...same great food and atmosphere at much better prices. Cioppino is amazing, but huge quantity! Could be shared easily. If you like calamari (fresh, and not breaded/fried), ask for the calamari vinaigrette. Not on the menu anymore, but they'll still make it :)

6s-bRtWG9eIkD9aOaDrqIA.review_text: Cute little place, but the food was not all that great.  I expected more with the number of high reviews.  Had the Lazy Man's cioppino and while there was a lot of food, the sauce was too thick for my taste.  The crab cakes were really good for appetizers and so was the bread.

9VUBm41ZyGrLo4seD7Iqgg.review_text: Pretty good seafood although the portions are way too big and the way they stack the side dishes that come with each meal, the plating is less than elegant. My son's shrimp and scallop dish came with both rice and potatoes -- carb overload!!  Fun atmosphere although very touristy and noisy.  Waiter didn't warn me when I ordered three extra sides for the table, even though sides come with most dishes already.  Better choices in SF although at uber-touristy Fisherman's Wharf, Scoma's is probably as good as is gets.

RATviC9wz4NZOuMI9_9Bug.review_text: I know this is a tourist area but for the prices and reputation, I expect better service. I was told it would be a 45 minute wait, but I could order food at the bar so I found a seat, asked for a menu but then couldn't get either of the bartenders to even look my way to take my order. And then, when they did, it was wrong. We're talking about a cup of bisque and an appetizer, not a complicated meal with lots of modification. I guess if I had been 20 with a short skirt or a businessman, it might have been different, but my wallet talks and it's telling me not to come back.

A8cPchGG9CppHpr8sTVQyQ.review_text: Rule #5, If your grandpa liked it 30 years ago, he was probably on to something!  Scoma's has been around for 50 years for a reason! I used to see the ads for it when I went to Golden Gate Fields with my Papa 20 something years ago and he'd always rave about the freshness of the fish there. It has that "old SF" vibe that has been dying bit by bit in The City. If you like wood paneling, sweet heart Filipino waitresses, and a great piece of fresh sea steak!  Because people like lists: 1) Fish so fresh, it blinks at you before you dig in. 2) Rule #1, Never eat at an empty restaurant, and this place is hardly ever empty. 3) All are welcome, look around, it's damn near the UN 4) Bring your water jug full o' pennies, you're gonna need them cause this place is pricey. 5) Don't go pasta, just go with the special/catch of the day, best bang for your buck. 6) Get yourself a souvenir glass, to remember these good times when you're at home eating Ramen. 7) This place looks like your grandmother's old house... before you sold it, and put her in a home... you know, you should call your grandmother more often.

KmHtoogKhK-ID7FWGOPvag.review_text: My fiancée and I were visiting San Francisco and our friend recommended Scoma's and we were definitely not disappointed! The restaurant itself is located right off of pier 39 in the fisherman wharfs area. The decor is very underwhelming compared to the food.   We started with the some fresh oysters which were very fresh and went down well. My fiancée ordered the market special, it was scallops on on spinach and potatoe purée. The scallops were large and flavourful. I ordered the wild king salmon on lobster ravioli. The wild king salmon was so fresh it had a dark pink colour and the lobster ravioli was perfection.   Overall the food was delicious and we would definitely revisit if we go to San Francisco again.   The only negative we had was the server we had was a little too slow. But she was nice and pleasant. Just not attentive enough.   A must go!

FvoFPjosY2TG6KGuw5mxuQ.review_text: This restaurant was a little hidden. It was on a boat restaurant hidden down a dark alley way behind buildings. Don't be fooled though, the inside of the boat was very nice and intimate. It was a very cute place to have a date and that's what we did!  My boyfriend and I started off with the Mediterranean Mussels and it was amazing. One of the best mussels my boyfriend and I have ever had. It was lightly sauteed and steamed in a buttery wine sauce and it was simply amazing.  I had the Shellfish Saute and it was lightly seasoned so you could really taste the seafood itself. This dish comes with a generous amount of scallops, shrimps and I believe there was lobster in there. I had a side of veggies and pasta. I wished the pasta was seasoned or had some sauce with it to make the dish more flavorful. Overall, this dish wasn't heavily seasoned and so it was simple and plain. But the seafood was so fresh and so good that it made up for the lack of seasoning.  Overall, we will probably come back for the mussels and to try their other seafood selections.

n_DDU8rBeKQlbBysaEx5hQ.review_text: I'm honestly confounded by the good reviews. While the service was average, the food was bland and tasteless. The food did not taste good. I've dined at thousands of restaurants, and was candidly surprised this restaurant could stay in business with such subpar offerings.  I would strongly recommend avoiding this restaurant on the Fisherman's Wharf. I really felt fleeced for $70 for our two lunches. There are much better options in the area.

px2AZNJaNKOoh8mj5q39Tw.review_text: Excellent food and service here. And free valet parking--almost unheard of in SF! Prices on the high side, though. And this is not (despite what you might think) a restaurant with a view (You can see a dilapidated pier and a warehouse.),  But, oh...that seafood!  Our group had calamari, prawn cocktail and lump -meat crab appetizers-all great. I tried the seafood cannelloni, which were superb, served with penne pasta and fresh sauteed veggies. All the other entries were good,, too (mixed shellfish saute, calamari, crab cakes and crab risotto). No room for dessert after that, though.  I really had expected to have views of the GG Bridge, but other than that and the rather high price tag, the place met or exceeded my expectations for a great lunch with out of town visitors.

jg17BlZ8CQzGg6UOKE0sVg.review_text: The ONLY place you should pay to eat in Fisherman's Wharf.  Fresh fish caught by their own boats.

L43BT3hd0QuVWqA5kPqVJQ.review_text: Nice old school feel and great service from  the veteran waiting staff. The food was delicious, you'll certainly pay a premium for this place but it's worth it.  Started with the grilled artichoke and steamed clams, both very tasty. Entree the balsamic crusted salmon (something along those lines), it was perfectly cooked and just the right portion.

drSF-9GYQkShY5_5SP7vpw.review_text: This place is okay, noting to write home about.  The décor is old,  70's old, you say charm, I say old.   The food was good, but nothing special, for the price, I want special.

RjkL9KkS6aX_s-_9alYFcg.review_text: I am often long winded, so I will try to keep this in cliff notes version.   Food was ok, I had the pork tenderloin with sautéed veggies and Parmesan polenta. The pork was served very dry and overcooked for my liking. The veggies were good; however, the polenta was fantastic.   Overall, this restaurant is overpriced and outdated inside. I imagine many of the dishes are very good, but you are really paying for prime real estate, not the food in front of you. Also, the view isn't that great, it has a parking lot view with a bit of wharf water and a warehouse across the waterway.   The valet was very rude to our party on several occasions. We were taking a group shot and he asked our uncle holding the camera to move so he could park a car. My uncle said he was almost done and would move, but it wasn't the immediate jump that the valet has expected. So he rolled his eyes and made several hand gestures showing his displeasure. It took another 10 seconds, and we moved our party inside to spend our couple thousand dollars on lunch.   I understand the valet is busy and has a job to do. However, there are ways to act, especially when we are your patrons who just tipped you, and are about to spend a bunch of money at your establishment.   We had a similar rude incident when leaving with this particular valet - I'm sorry I tipped him.   We also saw him park another patrons car too close to the edge of the dock, opened their car door into a wooden pier (somewhat hard), and then moved the car and walked away. Didn't check for damage, and I have a sneaking suspicion didn't tell the owners of the vehicle.   Needless to say, this valet left a poor taste in our mouths. Overall food was ok, prices much higher than the quality of the food was. Polenta was amazing though!  Also, sorry for getting long winded. My attempt to keep it short was obviously a fail.

jCeKLgAVZGIiGHhLHvLGKg.review_text: Maybe it's cuz we had just biked for the last 5 hours from SF over the bridge and into Sausalito on a beautiful clear sunny date and we were just fatigued and starving ... not really sure... but regardless, I have to say we had some amazing seafood pasta dishes here!  We had a linguine with light white cream sauce and shrimp, clams, etc. which was cooked perfectly... pasta was al dente, seafood tasted really fresh, cream sauce was packed with flavor and not too heavy.  Sad to admit this but at the end of the meal when the server was coming to take our plates I looked at her like she was crazy... i wasn't letting that plate go til every last drop of sauce was sopped up by their sourdough bread... which btw, was pretty awesome on it's own (as I guess most sourdough in SF is).  I mean, by the time I was done with my plate, it looked like it was already washed, dried n ready for serving again...  Ravioli was so-so, nothing special... calamari was great!  Another pasta dish with dungeness crab (can't remember if it was a special or on the reg menu) was just as amazing as the pasta dish above...   The restaurant has an outdoor deck which sits right on the water... inside looks a bit old-school... clean but if you ever make it out here on a decent day, def sit outside... beautiful spot.

R_QmwBJhwI5K0o6WZRTttg.review_text: Resturaunt is located next to the water. Beautiful views near the pier. They do vallet parking so parking is not an issue! Make a reservation or you'll be waiting for at least 45 mins. Service was great staff and waiters are friendly. Ordered the 12 oz steak medium well. Steak was prepared on point to how I like it. Was nice and tender juicy. Gf ordered the pasta diplomatica was very tasty in creamy sauce mixed in with scallops, clams, shrimp and lobster. Serving size was filling! Most items on the menu are pricey but I do plan on coming back. I guess you pay for what you get and the quality of the food is great!

3hJTWVOWYB0b9x9PKffNVQ.review_text: Very overrated. We're from out of town and were counting on Yelp to get us to the best restaurant in town. 4 stars for Scoma's is very deceiving. It's not terrible, but it is a far cry from great. It is mediocre seafood that is overpriced. Pick somewhere else!!

CbnrQMM7yi3SU0Q9fqSHNg.review_text: Great service, great food, beware of MSG!!!  We enjoy eating at Scoma's for the delicious seafood and good service.  I recommend the prix fix lunch menu ($25 till 3pm everyday).  The staff cares about your food allergy and special requests.    However, I must warn you that they use a lot of butter and MSG in the clam chowder and pasta garibaldo - my previously favorite dishes.  I can no longer order them because of the extreme fatigue, tiredness and sleepiness that follow the meals.  If you look through their kitchen windows, the Chinese cooks prepare the Italian dishes.  No self-respecting Italian cooks would use MSG in their Italian dishes.   Furthermore, they charge a $4 health fee.  I am against establishments that charge a health fee because of their greed and dishonesty:  they pocket the health fee and sign up their staff for low-cost or free city health insurance (Healthy San Francisco previously and Covered California now).

uouiFFetHG-aCQPBo8luEA.review_text: I went last night & was really disappointed.   ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant itself is really outdated. From the plates to the cheap wood panel walls & so-called "decor", it reminded me of my uncle's 1970s basement (without the shag carpet).  This place is in dire need of a makeover.   FOOD:  The lobster bisque was below standard. Don't expect even a single piece of lobster in the bowl.  The entree I ordered Blackened Prawns over Pasta Vodka (Brown Rice Penne Pasta, Pancetta, Tito's Vodka Sauce) was disappointing especially for its $34 price tag. The dessert was a joke.  When i ordered the "Fudge Brownie with Vanilla Ice Cream" for $8, I again felt disappointment when I received a cheap, dry brownie with no flavor. You get a better brownie out of a vending machine.   With so many choices of restaurants, I would NEVER recommend this place.

N8_PNk2yLMiqD6pbZSQHZw.review_text: This place was a disappointment.  It was right down the street from our hotel and my wife and I had heard great things about it.  We go inside and we are immediately blown away by how tired everything is.  The carpet is old, the walls are old, the photos are of old people.  It smells....old.  It looks like some kind of speakeasy from the '20s that was never once renovated.   We sit down and look at the menu.  It's basic seafood, but a bit pricey.  My wife and I both order something from our (old) waiter.  He is a little peculiar.  I hear him in the next room yelling at another employee about something minor and give my wife a sideways glance.  Oh well, we try the bread.  He brings out our entrees and my meal is not what I expected.  The menu was a little ambiguous, but I didn't return it or anything.  I'm usually one to just man-up play my hand if I'm at fault.  The waiter takes it a bit personally and tells my how beautifully prepared the meal is and that I will enjoy it.  It was an odd tone and I ordered a salad with crab meat on it.  I'm sure it will be fine.  He later returns to ask about the food and says, "Well, I know yours isn't what you wanted."  Whatever.  I guess I had upset him.  We paid and left.  Nothing is really bad about this place, but you can do a lot better in San Francisco.  Go to the dives and eat the seafood there.  Their food is much better and you don't have to deal with the snooty  time capsule that thinks it's "high class."

qUUMmANmVRuQxagzH8irhA.review_text: Yes, the seafood was delicious. The scallops were just AMAZING!   Dinner deal: one appetizer, one entree, one desert = $39.95. (order the lobster bisque and scallops!!!)  This was a pretty good deal compared to everything else that was $30+ for one dish. The dishes were pretty good portions though. For a family of 5, we got 1 dinner deal and 2 side entrees and took a small box home for leftovers.   Free valet parking. Calming view next to the bay.   30 min+ wait. But you can drink at the bar while waiting.  OVERALL: delicious seafood but a little on the pricey end. It's still worth it :)

XFhKCchgNDRxj43dAp4RIw.review_text: Excellent ,service and food . Took Uber from downtown and it was a great experience . I only choose this place based on the Yelp reviews . And once again you fellow yelpers did not let me down .

P7oKHASn4S_IkBiQaS02ng.review_text: We made a reservation and were seated almost right away.  It is tight quarters inside, but we did not feel like we were eating with the people next to us.  The wait staff was good, but not incredibly fast or responsive.  The food however, is excellent!  Everyone (all 9 of us) enjoyed our meal and although pricey (at least $100 a couple), it was a nice treat!

wE_BzyibHCASTjEpMVRq-g.review_text: I came to Scoma's to purchase one of their souvenirs.  I arrived before the dinner rush, so I hoped to run in and run out with my purchase.  When I walked in, there were a few parties waiting to be seated.  I told the person at the podium I wasn't there to dine but I wanted to purchase the olive oil dripper I had my eye on during my last visit.  He told me he would send someone out to help me.    Then...I...was...completely...ignored...by...­their...entire...staff.    The person I spoke with never made eye contact with me again.  In fact he avoided it.  I had a dinner reservation elsewhere, so I could not wait forever.    So I left empty-handed.

U7YCRdXHUKvaS0iT1hvq0w.review_text: I have been waiting to eat at Scomas - heard so much about it.  I and two of my friends were in the City with friends Wednesday 1-15-14.  We were all excited to try the food!   We arrived about 6:30pm and were seated after about 45 minutes.  We were seated in an alcove at a table that would have nicely seated 2 people however with 3 in our party, it was cramped.  The staff kept bumping into two of our party guests - a bit uncomfortable but not a deal breaker! However, the end result was that the service and kitchen was soooo slow!  Once our dinners were ordered, the dishes took forever to come out of the kitchen - the starter dishes came out about a half hour after the order was taken!  I had the Lobster Bisque - great tasting however very small portion.  And when my entree dish did come out, the pasta was cold!  I ordered the prix fixes of blackened shrimp with organic brown rice penne pasta.  3 tasty but small shrimps - Really??!!  After I shared with my two other dinner partners, I had 1 shrimp - and remember, this wasn't a starter dish - it was an entree dish!  We then had dessert - I had tiramisu - extremely small portion! For spending over $200+ we felt that it was well overpriced, and coupled with  the lacking service and attention, we thought the experience was very disappointing.  Sadly, we could not recommend this restaurant.

2d3W8FgX62KXSbz3Miiz0g.review_text: I really don't know why Scoma is getting reviews that are less than 5 stars. It's probably the dumb tourists.   The food is great, the service is fantastic, and I can't think of anything wrong with the restaurant. I've been going here for years and the only thing that's changed is the patrons' dress code. Yes, I wish I saw less khaki shorts and striped polos, but times, they have'a changed.   Five stars, Scoma. Good work.

fj654yv6kkCtQfygTSWQYA.review_text: Good old fashion wharf restaurant in a great location with a spectacular view and fresh seafood.  They were very busy so expect a wait.  Locals and tourist share the Scoma's experience, which is nice.  We paid $220 for 4 people, so a bit on the pricey side, but we had a lovely dining experience.

53ZHvp6xgqNQxcmssYEYEQ.review_text: Delicious fresh seafood! Valet parking is free and you're on the water. While it is a little pricey, you get what you pay for because the food, service, and environment is great. The jumbo prawns and scallops are some of the most fresh and large I've ever had. I've always left satisfied.

bsNPOZzmhJJQ8U4V4QDYIQ.review_text: chilled oysters on the half shell....lazy mans cioppino...and a few pints of anchor steam.  it just don't get much better than that on a beautiful afternoon in san fran.  thanks to all at scoma's, i really enjoyed the visit.  see you next time.

oNfTTqEybwsDy17JptM3sw.review_text: We have been going to Scomas since 1972.  Have had Birthdays, Anniversaries, parties and just the two of us for lunch.  The food is great.  Chappino is one of my all time favorites along with calamari vinegreta.  My wife loves their fried prawns.  The service is exceptional.  If you go in the afternoon ask to sit in Chris's section.

3138MStlsCBZUlQHIZjbPQ.review_text: This is a tourist trap. They have excellent service, funky ambiance, and ludicrous location. On the other hand, the food, while fresh, is not up to par to the price. I paid thirty some dollars for the swordfish lunch and I got a soggy fillet which was half grilled and half finished in the oven (a bit overcooked probably becaue the amount of food they have to move), and mashed potatoes and boiled veggie medley that you probably can find at walmart in the frozen section. Same thing with three other entrees...good seafood, really poor execution, and questionalble sides. C'mon guys, for the price you're asking for I should be getting a little more attention...I don't wanna think about the dinner prices...  For the same money, you can have amazing three course dinner a little up the hill.  Recommendation: no way...you can look a bit more and find ten-times better food

lyCpHiFR5-JfUFGVupGfMg.review_text: Fresh seafood in the simplest of preparation = excellence! I believe that if it is fresh seafood, forget the sauces, grill it. They do fish well. If you are here in March, make sure you order the fresh halibut (today started the season)! Fantastic.   The wait staff never rushed us nor over sold the dishes. Felt like Europe!   Worth the wait for a seaside window, if you are two. (A few flying deuces)   Only critiques, limited wine menu and cramped seating.

gpRL3XO7HlAwhS-9YsAjpg.review_text: Very good place food is perfect waiters know what they doing, nice. I did tried several places besides this one Scoma's place nothing could beat it. I would recommend to visit this place first and then check all other one. The only thing could be as negative I guess this place is not easy to find it located back from main street, just ask local hotels stuff I am sure they whould recommend this place in the first place and tell you how to reach it. Best place I would recommend to anybody who can appreciate good food and perfect service

58GDRxQ7TdZCNNliSLJ9Pg.review_text: I had the grilled combo which was excellent and my husband had the rock cod which he says is the best fish he has ever had. Service was great. We didn't know about the valet parking so next time we'll use it.

rnfZmzeWVxlSirBhtWT7Bw.review_text: While vacationing in SF, we dined at Scoma's to celebrate our anniversary. The service was quick and friendly. The food somewhat disappointing. I mean, it was fine but not how others have raved. We started with the crab cakes. Perhaps I'm crazy, but they were in no way as good as the crab cakes at Pappadeaux! We split a pasta dish, which was decent. I personally think there are many other fantastic seafood restaurants in San Francisco in which to choose.

12RBGrVS7yNhRfDzlnFahA.review_text: I have never written a review before but I feel the need to after my experience at Scomas this past weekend.   My family and I have been going to Scomas for over a decade.  We make the long drive from San Jose and Gilroy just to enjoy their delicious food.  Service has always been excellent and the food was always amazing. Unfortunately our experience this past weekend was terrible.  While prices remain the same the portion sizes have been cut in half if not more.  We always order the lazy man's cioppino which used to come in a large bowl with tons of seafood.  Now it is served in a small soup bowl and the sauce, which used to be AMAZING, tastes terrible.  My mom had the crab louis and it was half the size it used to be (she pulled up pictures on her iPad of what it looked like the last two times we dined there).  The crab sandwich didn't even have lump crab meat on it....it had a pile of stringy crab.   Service was excellent as it always is, which is why I am giving it one star.  We normally leave the restaurant full and feeling like we got a great value for our meal.  This time when we left we were all starving!  I don't understand why management wanted to change something that was so wonderful.  It looks like other reviewers are noticing the same changes and are deciding not to dine here anymore.  Sadly, management probably doesn't care about customers like us because they know that tourists will continue to dine here because they don't know any better.  We will surely miss Scomas and all the wonderful servers who work there.

qTUJzyNeORGlT_I7zUwqEQ.review_text: My parents and I heard so much hype about how amazing this restaurant was, but were extremely disappointed.  The portions are super small but expensive. We knew this place would be pricey but we expected the food to be worth it.  We ordered the stuffed portobello mushroom and what we got was just one small portobello mushroom with barely anything in it.  I ordered a lobster salad and bisque, what I got was a tiny cup of tomato soup and a tiny clump of lobster meat. However, The entree portions were much better and cioppino was very good. But when it came time to dessert we were treated to a tiramisu inside an espresso cup. I seriously ate it in one bite it was that tiny.  I think I might have been able to over look all of this had our server not been horrible. He was very dull and unfriendly. It felt like he didn't care if we were there or not. There was another server there talking and being entertaining with all of his tables. I might have given this place 3 stars if we had him. Overall I was really excited for this restaurant but ended up leaving broke and hungry. Pretty disappointed.

QpzP2Odkk2UX_mlxeXOQzA.review_text: This place is consistently good. The cioppino is ALWAYS good. It's so large that it will feed both my bf and me and maybe even have leftovers. But no, we never do that, because how can you come to Scoma's and not get another dish? That is just absurd.  My new fav dish, only when in season from Nov-June, is the crab louie salad. A plate piled high of dungeness crab meat. Seriously, PILED HIGH. It's accompanied by some lettuce, thickly sliced and crunchy carrots, slices of tomatoes, wedges of lemon, and a thousand island dressing on the side. It's so good you won't even need the dressing.  We've been here so many times and have had a number of different items on the menu and nothing ever disappoints.   I also love that there's free valet parking (aside from what you tip) and the waiters here are all so pleasant. They are professional, friendly, and very experienced. Always a great time at Scoma's!

EfYNsqr9S2qZaWRvbpZGXw.review_text: Had lunch here on a Saturday and they were packed.  Service was great as was the food. Only thing that makes it a 4 star instead of 5 is the price.

zswWYrNJsiSOFmDkqSWjKA.review_text: First and foremost, I would like to clarify that the Scoma's in Sausalito is owned by different people!   Scoma's is always delicious, savoring, filling, and the portions are big. It never seems like they're trying to conserve the ingredients. My favorite dish at Scoma's is the Mixed Seafood Plate. It consists of rice, noodles, scallops, lobster tale, shrimps,..etc. The portions are huge! I usually go to Scoma's for a family dinner (I'm a broke college student, and therefore can't afford food above 20 bucks sighs) and we order about 4 plates for 5 people. We always come back with leftovers!   If you're searching for a place that gives generous portions, delectable taste, and a beautiful view (at the pier), this is the place for you!

8k4Dr7-XVS3ywpYsksf_MA.review_text: Parental tour 2013 was in its infancy, and their first full day on the west coast was spent in lovely San Francisco. We'd already tripped down to Alamo Square so my mom could get pictures of the Painted Ladies, and up to Lombard to check out switchback alley (I mean the Crooked Street!) so the only thing to do from there was walk/run/jog down Hyde and head for lunch at Scoma's!   Ok, I've never been here, but the reviews are really great, and who doesn't love a little old school charm right along the waterfront? I knew we had to be in for something pretty great when I saw how many open seats a lot of the restaurants we passed had, and then how few there were at Scoma's. Maybe it's just good marketing?   The building is pretty unassuming, the interior however is all dark wood, low ceilings, and tablecloths. White shirted black pantsed men hover EVERYWHERE. We were seated quickly and brought menus. Drinks were ordered and bread was munched upon. Now, the ever important task of deciding what to eat!  Well...I had to try the cioppino...despite its' steep price tag. Seriously...40 bucks for soup? It's soup. Again, trusting to my reviewing counterparts, I just didn't see how I could turn it down. My mom was apparently feeling the soup vibes as well, so we both ordered it. My dad got a scallop/shrimp dish, and the boy got salmon fettuccine.   Oh. Holy. Crap. This soup was...ok, first off there's a ton of it. It should come with some kind of warning like Caution - Bowl Will Be Size of Your Head. I don't think I could have eaten this whole bowl if I'd starved myself for three days. As it was I barely got through half. My mom was the same way - if only we'd known, we could have split it! Dad loved his food - he felt they were a little chintzy with the scallops, but he really enjoyed the shrimp. The boy was just kinda meh on his salmon. I tasted a bite and I could tell why. Seasonings were a bit off, and, well...he's from Alaska, and has pretty high standards for smoked salmon.   The service was really on par. Our waiter was helpful and very chatty. I just wish he'd given us some indication about the enormity of soup that was coming our way.  I mean, by all means, get it. There's a ton of fish and crab and scallops and shrimp and everything under the sea. It's seasoned excellently. There's just so. so. much.  I felt bad cause we couldn't really take it with us, given all the sightseeing still left to do, but...yeah.  The place is legit, the food is stellar and plentiful, and the servers are excellent. Totally go here. Bring your family.

czqJEm4LhQpsYUjW8qyviw.review_text: I have never written a review before, but this place had terrible service during lunch today. I went there with 3 other Asian friends and the waiter immediately assumed we didn't know English and had the Chinese busboy come to serve us. He never gave us his name, and had a confused face on when I asked to have separate checks, then hesitantly did it for us. I asked what the catch of the day was, and that busboy told us salmon swordfish. When it came, there was a bunch of pasta, and I'm gluten free. I was never told there was pasta in the dish! So I asked to order the steak instead, and every piece was tough to chew. I will not come back again. Terrible food and snooty attitude.

wM67zXFIXBzCrRB7EYJ1dQ.review_text: Fantastic, elegant, old school ambiance. The wait staff was attentive, but not overbearing. The food was perfection. Definitely our new go-to spot for fine dining on the wharf.

RQXWuiQTKxxdOLn_7Wc0Uw.review_text: This gets 3 stars since I can't give it 2.5.  "Meh I have had better" is probably a good description, but I feel like 2 stars is too low.  The first time we ate here it struck me as a place that was probably popular at one time, but was now a little down on its luck or coasting on past success.  The food was all right & the service was all right as well.  My wife accidentally made a reservation there again & we showed up with 6 people.  Once we go there, she realized that she hadn't meant to go there again, but since we were already there, we went on in.  This time around we had almost the same experience.  The food was all right.  I actually liked the crab I had, but my daughter & I who also had the crab were the only ones pleased with their meal.  The seafood is very fresh & that is great.  They just seem to use much imagination when they prepare it.  I'm probably just not the the target market here.  I feel like the pace is overpriced for the closeness of the tables & the caliber of the food.  It seems to be an institution though, so they won't miss me.

ZAGGAP4PujmrCvWYhtJrfg.review_text: Went with my family and everyone enjoyed their meals. From seafood to steak - everything was delicious! Our waiter was very nice and knowledgable of the food etc. dessert was yummy too. Make reservations!

XmEywucVDyUP9VJ4SXGjzw.review_text: I've been in San Francisco going on eight years yet until today had yet to visit or eat at Fisherman's Wharf.  So I walked the area and then ate at Scoma's.  Why people would visit Fisherman's Wharf is a mystery.  All that I saw was crowds of people looking to throw their money at who knows what.  And then there is Scoma's, another easy way to part with money fast, as the place is expensive.  Not necessarily horrible.  But expensive.  The venue had the feel of an airport lounge.  The hostess was continuously calling waiting patrons for their tables over a microphone.   Once seated I felt a bit like a sardine or to keep my metaphor straight someone in an airplane.  Everyone was lined up and regimented for fast service.  Get them in.  Get them out.  I started with a crab cocktail.  This was quite good.  The crab was obviously fresh.  And for nineteen dollars there was a substantial serving of crab, as well there should be.  Next, grilled sand dabs.  The four fish had been breaded and then cooked with some considerable oil that was taken up by the breading which became leaden.  The fish however were fresh.  The pasta that came with the sand dabs was undistinguished, but the vegetables still had some snap and taste.  At twenty nine dollars this plate of food was an expensive mediocrity.  Their sourdough bread is not the best I have had in San Francisco by a long shot.    Given that this was Fisherman's Wharf, an immense tourist trap, I could have done worse than Scoma's.  Given that Fisherman's Wharf is in San Francisco, I could have done better.

qUGMYSGV24KD8QFCdGGIlQ.review_text: I came here this past weekend because my favorite restaurant (House of Prime) was all booked up.. This place doesn't take reservations but luckily we have a connection with one of the waiters and were able to score a table within 30 minutes.. Scoma's was packed from the time that we got there, 7, until the time that we left, 10, with a bunch of people still waiting for tables! From what I've been told it's normally like that but I'm guessing that the NFL Playoff game being in town didn't help the crowd control either :P.. So there were a bunch of rowdy New Yorkers present as well as the usual San Francisco/Bay Area crowd.. The waiting area of this restaurant is pretty narrow so expect to stand in a cramped area while you wait for your party to be called by a hostess who looks unhappy and gives you a fake smile when you enter or speak.. The bar is right by the entrance so that's a good way to dish out $10-12 per drink while you wait.. Probably the most annoying part of our wait was listening to a group of drunk New Yorkers (I do not dislike NYers just this particular group!) yell to each other across the bar.. This isn't Applebee's it's a fine dining restaurant so let's get it together guys!  Being that our family friend is a waiter at Scoma's he would naturally know what the best things to order are so we left this in his hands and offered a few suggestions for what our party of 7 likes.. For our first course we had 2 plates of clams and oysters on a bed of ice, calamari (mmm baby tentacles!!), garlic bread, shrimp cocktail, steamed clams, and a cup of clam chowder (packed with goodies!).. I didn't try the hard shellfish because I'm not really a fan of it raw or cooked except for in a few dishes.. The only time I tried the clam was when it was steamed and even then I just couldn't take to the taste or texture of it.. The shrimp cocktail came with jumbo prawns and was absolutely amazing, as well as the calamari and clam chowder.. The garlic bread was probably some of the best I've ever had and was flavorful, well textured, and warm.. My guests thoroughly enjoyed the shellfish platter and the steamed clams so I'm guessing that was good too! For our second course we had a platter with an assortment of seafood including sole, seared ahi tuna, scallops, and crab cakes.. Everything on this platter was delicious except I'm not very partial to scallops, especially raw, and these were only partially cooked (75% maybe).. The seared ahi tuna was the most impressive item that they brought out and I could've eaten it all night if my stomach allowed for it.. We also had spinach, garlic mashed potatoes, and steamed veges as sides with some seafood pasta.. I didn't get a chance to try the mashed potatoes but the veges and spinach were okay.. I don't generally like my veges steamed since the flavor can be quite bland.. By the time the pasta got to our table I was already quite full so I only tried some of the lobster tail that was in it.. Surprisingly this was my first time trying lobster, ever! And with my under developed palate for seafood, naturally, I wasn't that big of a fan, haha! I still enjoy crab now and then though [: For all of the above mentioned our bill came to ~$340 +18% gratuity and we didn't order and drinks once we were seated..

1o8I1s6kSfLkJlHeKPc5ZA.review_text: Wow, beautiful view, great ambience, can't wait to go. Back. $80 for steak & lobster.  The steak was good, not great, but good. The lobster on the other hand was HUGE & tasty. Plan on going back & bringing the wife with me this time.

N8y88JlpXyOrDIDEKkQDGA.review_text: Meh. Pretty forgettable. Ordered catch of the day scallops and filet mignon, both dishes were bland. They tasted fine but we were hoping for a little more effort or creativity with the cooking. Too expensive to not be wowed.

c8bbMULLyAVEYlYjuw4XJA.review_text: Some of the best sea food in the city. I have been coming here for 30 years and this place never lets me down.

LR9lb4Qk3Q2s85e5Fsw8sQ.review_text: I got reservations for Scoma's for Valentine's Day through Open Table.  I was sure to reserve a month in advance and we were taken directly to our table when we arrived.  This worked well for us, as the restaurant was busy.  Scoma's was recommended for the view, but we didn't have a view from our seats.  The service and meal made up for it and the ambience was still nice.  I cannot say enough good things about our server.  He was attentive to our drinks, made suggestions and answered questions, and helped my daughter with crab etiquette.  While the service was excellent, it was not stuffy or snobbish.   We started with a bottle of the house white.  It was mildly sweet and not dry-- the way my husband prefers.  He liked it, but I would have preferred a red.  That is my taste issue, though.  I started with a Cesar salad.  The dressing was light and lemony, with the portion on the smaller side for the price.  I think it could have used something extra (bacon crumbles, maybe), but I thought chicken or shrimp would be unnecessary.  There was a prix fixe and I really wanted the lamb, but I couldn't resist the cioppino.  I was not disappointed.  The portion was large, the tomato broth light and flavorful, and the seafood was perfectly cooked.  I have a new affinity for scallops because of this meal.  My cioppino was served with garlic bread which was a wonderful compliment.  My husband got the cowboy steak and said it was "very good".  My daughter got half a garlic roasted Dungeness crab and she had no leftovers.    There was even a children's menu.  My son's chicken tenders were even fresh.  I was happy with Scoma's for our vacation and Valentine's day choice.

77STTiXFySEFv0wtqc0Exg.review_text: This review is based one 1 visit.  I had the Cowboy Steak with Au Gratin Potatoes, Asparagus and Spinach.  I thought the food was very good.  The service was good and the location was good.  The décor was old and outdated but it still works for them.  I wanted to try a Lobster Tail but didn't since my meal was already over $50.

X7DFMjhqMOQ3KQaKFLk4sg.review_text: Excellent, excellent food and service on the Wharf. Their dishes are huge and worth the wait. Probably could split and entree if you eat appetizers. Waitstaff was attentive and helpful. Would recommend to anyone wanting a great selection of seafood and steaks on the Wharf.

cgAhU-Vi4yV2ncQOf5ECZA.review_text: Ate lunch here a week ago. No reservations but seated very quickly, everyone we met was very friendly. For an appetizer we had the shrimp cocktail, very disappointing as a few of the shrimp were not deveined and one was not fully peeled. My wife had the dry-packed scallops which were OK, nothing to rave about. I ordered the lobster newburg but they instead served me the lobster thermidor, it was just OK as well. It was hard to find the lobster chunks hidden in the mushrooms, onions and cheese. Food preparation and taste were Red Lobster quality at twice the price.

41HLwXnR0Lm3NUp01cIOQg.review_text: I was decently surprised by the food at this restaurant. I had low expectation when it comes to dining at a tourist area. I followed the advice from the iPhone Yelp app and it brought me to this restaurant with 400+ review and a solid 4 star.   I decided to go full tourist style and went with the prix-fixe lunch menu. What could one possibly get from a $23.95 lunch at a tourist district?  Starter  Cup of Clam Chowder - (5/5 stars) - Their chowder completely blew my mind. I only found out later that Newsweek had named Scoma as one of the five best chowders in the US. While I can't totally agree with that claim, the chowder is still definitely one of the better ones. Solid 5 star quality.  Entree Scallops with Garlic Mashed Potatoes and Mixed Vegetables - (3/5 stars) - A bit disappointed by this. The scallops were flavorful but was a bit too salty and over cooked. I have had better scallops elsewhere.   Dessert  Chocolate Mousse Cake - (4/5 stars) - I usually dislike chocolate cakes but I was managed to finished my dessert. The cake was rich in taste yet light in texture. The strawberry puree paired well with the dark chocolate flavor.  I also managed to 'sample' the other entree. Petite Dungeness Crab Salad - (4/5 stars) - Nothing petite about this salad. There were tons of crab meats. The meat was very fresh. Yummy salad dressing.  Great quality food for only $23.95? I have possibly paid close to that for lunch at some mediocre restaurants in south bay.  I am very tempted to try their cioppino that everyone was raving about. From now on, Scoma will be my default dining spot if I am taking any out of town friends to fisherman's wharf.

wlPklTJrjf_8t_W1TmeBPg.review_text: Cool place because of its history, and place to see and be seen. Friendly serving staff even though we came in for lunch dressed extreme casual. The San Francisco Calemari Club was in for lunch that day, so it was extremely busy around the bar area as we entered. We heard that Vida Blue was among them, and a cute old couple (definitely regulars) were brought an autographed baseball from Vida. They were striking up conversation with the servers like they were old friends. Our server told us she was one of the new ones, only been there thirteen years. Definite charm to this San Francisco institution. The french bread was amazing, of course. Our server recommended the crab louie that had crab fresh off their boat. I got the shrimp/crab Louie lunch that came with a cup of clam chowder. Great chowder. A large amount of food in the Louie, but more that a couple bites had me fishing crab shell out of my mouth. That nuisance knocked down a star on this review. My wife got the clams, and she loved them. The price knocked off another star. Fun to go here, but we will likely try other restaurant options the next time in the area.

gDQQaWyHAMbsfYvrw8mUZg.review_text: Hubby and I go to Scoma's a couple of times a month, sometimes more during crab season. We were there last Sunday and started off with the best  Bloody Mary I think I've ever had. Found out the secret was the Chipotle Tabasco the bartender used. Most places use regular Tabasco.  We had Tim as our waiter, and we sometimes request CC because she is one of our favorites.  I had the Mixed Seafood Saute which is the best! My husband always has the Crab Louis. I don't think we have ever had a bad meal here. Scoma's is the place we recommend to friends and family whenever they are in the Bay Area.

SOUqBPLoX2rj_pZ6hfvYsQ.review_text: Every time I go to SF I come to this place just for the clam chowder. I haven't had anything else, but they get a 4 star because the clam chowder is amazing!  BUT I'm not sure if it's because I don't normally dress up all fancy and nice, and maybe I look younger than my actual age, but either way, the service is not very good, especially the hostess. I went in last week and they gave me some bread and grissini with butter but the grissini were soggy and the bread too chewy and my silverware were a little dirty too. I also asked for a beer and they never checked my ID. I would think that for being such a nice restaurant they would be more professional and clean, but the clam chowder is amazing, so I'm guessing the rest of the menu is too...? Also, first time I went, the bloody mary was really good too.

cFSn7gzXbs5NoIBYXPqswA.review_text: Ehh... I really wanted to like this place.  Pro's: Great location on pier Quality fresh fish  Cons: $$$$ Slow service? (Place was packed though so maybe 50/50 here) Food was a bit bland, I expected more for my money Calamari was oily and heavy.  My opinion as always- if you do decide to go I hope you have a better meal!

dxx_AkChOxEl8yI5NqEuPw.review_text: Love Scoma's!!  The best Crab Louie on the planet.  A little pricey, but certainly well worth the money.  Very generous portion of crab. Impeccable   old school service by veteran staff. Would recommend this to anyone.

Wlk6JwG7rGmL-kP0dHgUHQ.review_text: To start off, this is a white table cloth type of place. And I know being on the wharf (super tourist area), you might have reservations. I think the rating with the amount of reviews is evidence that this place is a gem.  Service: excellent and swift Atmosphere: nice (a place you take a date or an out of town guest) Food: CIOPPINO! Delicious and huge. The seafood is succulent and tender. It's definitely a dish to share with another person or family style.

Kg_uuwTYqmyhIWMdjkYALQ.review_text: Service was a bit substandard for caliber of restaurant (cold hostess who erased our name on wait list, overly cutesy but not attentive waitress) except for support staff (busboys and water refill guys were superb!) wait was much longer than quoted and option of sitting In secondary bar was not shared by hostess. But, alas, food was absolutely stupendous!  The cioppino was out of this world!  Sand Dabs good, too, but green bean side needed to be steamed a few more minutes (too raw for this hot dish)

oel5UAI1J6MACnoLO9VRGQ.review_text: Went here for my wifes birthday while traveling.  We started with the calimari appetizer which was very tasty and a great portion.  I had the scallops special and my wife had the mixed grill.  Everything was perfect!  Our server was Gus and he also was outstanding.  Great experience!!

9OszQMQICXKZEljm2twuzw.review_text: Delicious.  A little old school, but tons of character.  We stumbled onto Scoma's trying to find a place to eat around Fisherman's Wharf that wasn't a chain.  Found this little gem.  Best freaking crabcake I have ever had.  Seriously.  Get the crabcake.  Also, their special lobster bread/potpie dish (forgot what it was called) was really really good as well.  The service was excellent.  Our waiter looked like Harry from the old show "Empty Nest" and he was awesome.  Very responsive and very helpful.  Even took time to give us a rundown of things to do in the area.  Docking one star for a bad bloody mary and it was a bit pricey for what it was.  But overall, a great experience and i would highly recommend it.

sAkKh8gOo2fW1qRy2eAp-A.review_text: Fantastic dinner here (August 2012)! Recommended by local riding cable car home after work and it was a hit w/my friends and me. Overall atmosphere is definitely niche and incredibly authentic, dated SF. We all ordered from prix fixe menu and were incredibly pleased w/meal.  Old school dining experience (think wood paneling, wait staff uniforms) as far as cocktails, wait staff, etc. Great mix of people and didn't feel too 'touristy'.

p6RurvWCPEqR8PP4siwiVA.review_text: Travelers have always welcomed and been welcomed at inns and restaurants generations over; at a certain threshold of exhaustion any place will do.  So imagine a hungry and footsore family who has stumbled into paradise.  That paradise was Scoma's. I still dream about their clam chowder.  Other memorable dishes included the pasta alla Scoma's and the Dungeness crab. The table side views were of the bay right outside; a seal swam by while we were sitting there. General decor was on the classy side but not overly so.  Service was great.   Wonderful wonderful memories of dining here, would highly recommend it.

b5-4HlYC_cou6AfZEY72cw.review_text: Scomas is a staple within the beautiful waterfront that graces our remarkable city. I had the pleasure of working with Nick and Laura in planning a large group dinner event. The wait staff, management, food, ambiance, were all 5 stars, absolutely incredible.
