We will definitely go back once a year as a large group to enjoy everything Scoma's has to offer.   Thank you again to Nick, Laura and everyone at Scomas! A+ experience.

QqJrMBOjWJeaDjUC7K2X_Q.review_text: Seafood platter for two is a perfect starter. Good selection of wines. And view of the water. Great date place. Cioppino is a MUST!

mcsAPnM42EjISfbEtR5frQ.review_text: Another fantastic dining experience in SFO.  Went for lunch this past week.  We arrived early, because we're losers, at around 11:30 AM.  We and our elderly friends (everyone else in the place) were seated promptly and the fun began.  First off, the view was superb (we were seated at a window looking at a bunch of boats docked).  Second, the bread is amazing.  From there, we ordered a seafood platter for two, which was excellent.  They didn't have crab on the platter that day "because it hasn't come in yet" - somehow I loved that!  the shrimp (prawn?), clams, and oysters were excellent.  I ordered some kind of cod and it was superb as well.  Dessert was some ungodly chocolate thing.  All in all, a great experience - they could have been two notches down on food and the location would have made it up (see my review of the Landmark on Cape Cod somewhere on here). great food, great professional service, good value.  Not quite  5 stars, but close.

P27aSCwfgpQKcaqNuwUn9w.review_text: Good, but dated and utterly boring.  This place is in the tourist part of town. The good news is the food tastes good. Excellent crab cakes and the lobster ravioli was fine. My colleague had a badly overcooked steak that came with steamed veggies and mashers. As far as I'm concerned, if you order fillet medium well, though, who cares?  The decor was straight out of the 70s -- not in a retro cool kind of way, but in a never changed kind of way. The walls are festooned with faded color photos of older people having good lives who are probably long dead.   I suspect the menu hasn't changed much in decades. Same old staff. Same old uniforms (service was fine though). A bit rain down, but not dirty.  For me this doesn't cut it when there is a city full of places making awesome, imaginative and mind blowing food for the same price.   However, some people like boring, and at least it wasn't expensive, boring and terrible.

nVG9eKOOQoWHCOus8aCjlA.review_text: Such an wonderful experience at the classiest place.  I love the view of the Bay, and yes, the old wooden piers.  I love hearing about the many family traditions here.  My son became an instant foodie after being introduced to excellence here many years ago.  He's now 17, and he KNOWS how good crab and the best french bread should taste.  He can also recommend the Shirley Temple drinks!

_LZ_xEirLHQa2NZfEK1f7Q.review_text: And we came back! This time we brought some friends who live in the area. The food was outstanding! Lobster Bisque, Ciapinno, Grilled Salmon,...it was all super fresh! This is one of those places that you will need to make reservations for a couple weeks in advance.

8I1NKQlmjai_R-Ne2UkVaw.review_text: A very interesting location on the water, but the recipes at our table of six were average.  We were crammed in next to another table even though there was room in the restaurant.  For the money, there is better seafood in San Francisco.

jIllv_or24bQ97niC0OWDw.review_text: On a rainy day, my friend and I impulsively decided to go to Fisherman's Wharf. I yelped where to eat and this place had really good reviews, so I persuaded my friend who wanted to get street food, and we sat down. And.. after the meal, I felt so bad for dragging her along. We got calamari frutti dinner, pasta alla scoma, and "lazy man's" cioppino. Two girls ordering three main dishes must have confused the waiter. She was like, "You girls are ordering too much..?" Ha Ha.   The calamari was really good, it came with rice, penn pasta (why..?), and steamed veggies. We both liked it. Pasta alla scoma was not so great. Pasta was overcooked and I thought my teeth would break from all the lil rocks/sand from my clams .. However, The biggest disappoint of this experience was the cioppino. After seeing a lot of reviewers raving about how excellent this was, I decided to get it and ugh what a waste it turned out to be. It's way salty. Basically, it's a "lazy" dish with bunch of seafoods thrown in a marinara sauce. SALTY. I literally drank 4 cups of water just to eat the swimming seafoods.   Although the food we got sucked.. Atmosphere is great here. All the waiters seem really veteran and know what they are doing. I think we just chose bad food perhaps.. Maybe I will try Scoma's again..

duTsJOMfYx_r9HpogrIw6w.review_text: Went to Napa/San Francisco this past weekend and was unable to get a reservation at Scoma's...boo!  But, I did end up having lunch there before my flight! Win!  I had the clam chowder, which was fantastic, like yumso!  Then, something amazing happened, an entire broken down crab in a butter garlic sauce to be ripped apart by my hands! IT WAS AMAZING!!  Don't get anyhting else, it's delicious! The crab was cut into peices which made it easy to handle.  They also have a grilled crab, didn't try it, but the garlic, butter, crab, was a fantastic combo!  My husband had the sole, my mom had the sand dabs and my step father had the cod and all were impressed!   The waitress let us try the lobster bisque and it was fantastic as well. This place isn't well rated for nothin.

k2jH-UirzoElLdLIujb9FA.review_text: Steak was nicely cooked but overpriced. Nothing exciting about this joint apart from our waiter who was a gent. Real character this guy. great interaction with the customers as were all of the waiters.   One customer thought he was rude but at the end of the night was his best friend!!! Very funny.  My tip is to drop the spicy prices boys! Ur living off an outdated 80's celeb hangout tag.

nl3ywW2cJwLhuNlAPmbBSA.review_text: Always great food great service in the old traditional way that I was used to in the 70s growing up. Never had a bad meal or bad service here in the past 20 years. Will always come here as long as  I live!

eis4M28wDXmyguVJ9A2lDA.review_text: The venue is a bit old and it needs some remodeling. Servers are okay but nothing special. However seafood is fresh and is bought directly from local fishermen. Scoma's lobster bisque and clam chowder are delicious.

XUYZrC0YGTOPD5sadtDA0w.review_text: Had an early supper here on a Sept. Mon night. Some locals gave us their recommendation to come here. I should have known by the white jackets, it may be a "stuffy" kind of establishment to eat in. We first were seated in an "awkward" part of the restaurant, but asked to be relocated. The hostess, somewhat unwillingly, brought us to a "better table". She definitely had an attitude. Sorry, but we don't like sitting next to the "hangout" spot for the servers, especially if Im paying the prices they charge to eat here. Food was ok. I got a sampler from the appetizer menu. I believe my boyfriend got whatever the fish special was. It was just ok, that I can't recall exactly which one he got. Our waiter was nice, a little eccentric, but friendly enough. I forget his name. Im sure this place has many return, local customers and then of course, the tourist types, such as ourselves. I was not impressed, at all, with this restaurant. The whole experience, from the moment I walked in, to the end of the meal, I felt very uncomfortable and this place is just not "my cup of tea". Honestly, we do better w/ "hole in the wall" type of restaurants, where staff is more down to earth, food is really good, along with reasonable prices. Not saying the food is "bad" here, just the whole dining experience was a big turn off for me. I was very disappointed on being our last meal on our trip.

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: If you're ever sitting around pondering a never-ending seafood salad, Scoma's has got the perfect salad for you. The $34 seafood salad with smoked salmon, prawns, dungeness crabmeat, and bay shrimp atop leaves and leaves of green and quartered artichoke hearts, it's served with tartar sauce, cocktail sauce, and a balsamic vinaigrette. (yelp.com/biz_photos/scom…). Is it tasty? Ehhh. Is it fresh? ...I guess? How about the service? Good! It was good! (At least something was.) I think I managed to put a tiny dent in the salad before I noticed that the table next to us loudly complained of the mediocre food and refused to pay for their meal (on which they'd put a sizable dent). Clever, but I'll pay for my mediocre salad, thankyouverymuch.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: "See you again next year."  Last year we were sitting at the exact same table celebrating my Grandparent's 60th wedding anniversary. This year we were back for #61. Our waitress had remembered us.  Another thing that stayed the same: excellent food. The Cioppino is not cheap, but that's because it is two meals. Almost three. So much seafood. It was amazing.  As is celebrating 61 years of marriage. Love you Grandma & Grandpa! Let's plan for next year, same time, same place!

tFeGSYSSSo3UdWIRSi40SA.review_text: Solid four stars. Hate the seating and the auditorium feel, but that's the charm of this place. Last night they had some roughness at the bar (49ers game) and that would not have been cool for a family. It was handled with grace at the front desk.  I started with chowder (great) and friends had lobster bisque and a crab cocktail which looked fantastic. I has swordfish with capers (ok, not perfectly cooked) and friends had salmon... that looked better.   Service was gruff and as you would expect at this place. Fun though.  I'd go back and have a few times just for the history lesson.

EO47ao8qAykoK1PGstY4JQ.review_text: I literally fell in love with crab cakes and I hated crab cakes before my first one here! Apparently my mother kept it a secret from the rest of us but now the secret's out! Other items to try calm chowder, chippino and whatever their daily special is for the day. Minus one star because the bldg. could use a face lift.

NJqmAzerpbAIC0-VBclwgA.review_text: Gonna make this a quick one... Being in San Fran, I thought this place would have been better!  I was kinda dissapointed.  Shoulda gone to a more hipster place...  First impression- thought it was dark and lacked character. It is on the water front so it naturally attracts diners.    I had the lobster bisque, which was good & creamy.  The bread was good, as was the variety.  I actually love when restaurants provide carb variety!   I also had the crab risotto, which was my main meal.  It was really just ok.  Not much more I can say about. Shared the polenta with my friend, which would have been a better entree than the polenta. \ Just ok.

ZZ0fsmQf-VLTrSv0T9_cZA.review_text: Rated highly, out of the way in a very cool way, surrounded by working boats, short but interesting walk off the main street, great big windows looking out onto San Fran marina and view, tuxedo coat waiters and very tempting menu... but the dungeoness crab risotto at $39 was nearly bland and otherwise unremarkable. The $29 pesto pasta was mostly pesto _colored_. The service was good, the food edible, but badly missed our expectations and overpriced itself.

sj0mepLs5DIKbkcWMqzsDg.review_text: My husband and I were on vacation. Every local we talked to suggested that we visited this place to eat. It was AMAZING. We went for our anniversary an I have to say I was not disappointed. I recommend this place to anyone visiting San Francisco.

REkqzfacqtEHoCOzWDEKGw.review_text: Was here twice on 09/23/14 & 09/25/14; the last time was around 2005.  I always order the lazy man's cioppino, and it is still great!  This seafood in this stew tastes so fresh.  The lobster bisque is pretty good too.  The other night I had teh salmon which was good, but the roasted vegetables it came with was really good.  If they just had this as a vegetable dish, I would order it.  But if you like tomato based sauces, get the lazy man's cioppino; it is worth the price, and soak up the bread in the sauce as well!   :)

Yv9UmSFKj9f48fQg_yyPAw.review_text: We love our trips to San Francisco and part of our love for this town is Scoma's. This is not just another restaurant on the wharf catering to the unsuspecting tourist.....this is an honest to goodness SF institution.   Locals and tourists alike flock to Scoma's for some of the best seafood in San Francisco........surely the best Dungeness Crab.    The waitstaff and bar tenders are always attentive and make me feel like I'm home.  Ask for a table in the "old section" on the window and order up some beautifully thick chowder and a whole cracked crab......now that's SF.

4TtY37CFL1JWM4cQuVk2cw.review_text: Scoma's served the finest Seafood I've ever eaten. I had the "Mix" Salmon, Swordfish and Rock Cod.  Put Scoma's on the top of your list for Surf and Turf in San Francisco.

ohsL6aKdwcRjc7Wc6Wloog.review_text: I don't know if it was cause I wasn't in the mood for seafood when we went, but this place just didn't do it for me. The wait was an hour+, but at least it's near the wharf and you could walk around to kill some time. The service was excellent, but the food was just a-ok. The cioppino was the best by far. Nothing else was really notable. I'll probably try a different restaurant the next time I'm in the area.

Kw4lH6C5wSrYVxaDP68pfA.review_text: Ordered the Lobster Bisque soup, which was absolutely awesome.  The flavor was incredible and i practically licked the bowl clean.  I also ordered the Poor Man's Cioppino based upon the recommendation from our waiter and this dish had to be the best Cioppino I've ever had.  There was a good amount of prawns, shrimp, scallops, clams & fish.  Not to mention it's served with a large piece of their garlic bread and I guarantee you won't leave hungry.    The service was impeccable and they offer valet parking.  Quite simply a great meal at Fisherman's Wharf in SF.

85MihShAd5WGI7vq24Q8mA.review_text: Hands down to one of the best clam chowder! Before trying Scoma's, I tried the clam chowder from another vendor at Fisherman's Wharf. It is not comparable to Scoma's whatsoever.   I placed a to go order which was about $10 but big portion. Brought this out to the Cristal Park nearby on a chilly day. Perfect food with a nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge.

0pnDh5D0yV37fKsvMTKf2w.review_text: Scoma's was on the pricey side, but good food.  Excellent service.

iVPmgnlF0_XCAwGz3JHAUg.review_text: I think I would rate this place FANTASTIC/EXCELLENT if it was not for the snotty service we received.  Scoma's came HIGHLY recommended by family, friends, and fellow travelers on our recent trip to Fisherman's Wharf. We were prepared to enjoy a fabulous meal. We didn't make a reservation but put our name on the waiting list and took a walk around Ghiradelli Square. We arrive back in about 45mins and were promptly seated. So far so good right?  No... Our waitress quickly profiled the three 20-something professional women sitting at the table as not her priority. We asked for specials and got a short hand version of "scallops with rice" without any further explanation or offering (this was also not the special). When we asked for her recommendation on wine, she picked the cheapest bottle on the menu after stating she can't recommend a bottle because she "does not know us" and her choice was unrelated to our meal choices (we chose a different bottle). She only came back to our table to bring us food and collect the check. Not the type of service I EXPECT when I'm paying $30 a plate and buying a bottle of wine for the table.  But, on to better things! I hope others can report a better time with service and this review does not deter you from trying to AMAZING food Scoma's has to offer. First off, the Salmon was fabulous in a butter dill sauce paired with garlic mashed potatoes. The calamari was fried to perfection and melted in my mouth. And the crab cakes are a must! Hands down the best crab cake I have EVER tasted. The crab stuffed portabella mushroom is a worthy appetizer but a small portion if you want more than 2 bites.  Overall a great tasting meal, and I would return for the food alone. I'll over look the service this time, but don't burn me twice, and if the Scoma's Manager/Owner is reading this... I recommend a chat with your staff on profiling. We may have looked young but we still walked out of your restaurant with a $150 bill :)

dXPsB-rAoG-VFLCjAzYaPg.review_text: Overpriced, overhyped, tourist trap, the service however was excellent, but the food was mediocre and bland. I have had much better food elsewhere at this price point.

xW_PU6RkiUtezxL0hVWG0A.review_text: This place was really yummy.  The seafood was fresh and the staff was nice.  Plus, we were on our honeymoon and they treated us extra special! :-)

b-jfG4G6LruavTKn1TvWEQ.review_text: Got the halibut. Ok. Sides were veggies and mashed potatoes. Also ok. Could have been at any restaurant anywhere. Did not like the atmosphere. Old carpet and panelling.  Would not go back.

U4sJcmUUoIRfFaiVlzyPKQ.review_text: They seriously have the best Calamari and mussels. I crave it all the time but try to treat my self once in a while. Excellent service. Excellent food, very high quality! They get very busy at times, so try making a your reservation ..

z1dGHTNf7wOoyGuWSoq8SA.review_text: This is the first time that I have actually checked in on Yelp during a visit to Scoma's. My boss was in-town and asked to have lunch at a great restaurant. The first place I thought was Scoma's in Fisherman's Wharf.  Although it is in the tourist mecca that is the Wharf, Scoma's is set apart and "hidden" down an alley where you have to know where you are going. My boss ordered the halibut and I got my usual combo louis salad. She was pleased with the taste and preparation. She commented on how well it was cooked. I started with the tasty lobster bisque. It was My combo salad was overflowing with shrimp and fresh crab. The louis dressing was delicious as always. I only had enough room to finish the seafood before I gave up. I would also like to thank and commend Chris for his great service and conversation. I always enjoy a restaurant when the server is genuine and a courteous. 5 stars for Scoma's all the way.

AIXFzsxjQTTxZ0AUxvXpxQ.review_text: My in-laws have been coming to Scoma's for years. They were so excited to share their love for Scoma's with us when we all traveled to San Fransico for the holiday.  When we arrived at Scoma's we did not have a reservation because we were travelling in from Concord, and did not know how long the drive would take. We waited at the bar for about fifteen minutes and then were seated in the renovated section of the restaurant overlooking the marina. It was a gorgeous view!  Our server was so knowledgeable about the menu and shared that he had worked here for many years. My in-laws and husband all ordered the same thing. It was a seafood medley, so they could try a little bit of everything. I decided on the Dungeness crab and a side of French fries.   When they brought out our food, my crab was steamed in a garlic seasoning (which I did not order) but it smelled so good that I ate it anyways. While the garlic seasoning was incredibly messy, I loved the flavor it gave the crab. The French fries came in a massive order. My hubby and I split them, and even then we couldn't finish!     Everything is fresh. You see them cleaning the seafood and fish in the building over when you walk by. Seeing that made me love Scoma's even more.   I would come back here in a heartbeat. Be prepared to wait if you don't have a reservation. But, the food and atmosphere is worth it.

UVO0vrdc8Jfm00p7ixuf7A.review_text: Did I already review this place? My favorite in the city? I dont know! Anyway, the staff is extremely helpful and kind. Personal. I believe I had a 3months anniversary celebration here.. well not celebration but date. you know.   it's a lovely place. you can enter casual or you can dress up. whatever you want and you can feel comfortable with it! that's one thing i love about them.   clam chowder is so much better than boudin's, so please do come.   scallops and pasta O my GOSH. heaven. enjoy bread and butter before the meal too. full bar. O THE DESSERT. must try!

2xs2qVVWv-b_hVMPZQXMDQ.review_text: A truly classic seafood restaurant on the San Francisco waterfront. I've enjoyed dinner here on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. The cioppino has so much shellfish and seafood that it is difficult to finish unless you have a huge appetite. The lobster is the best I have ever tasted, and it is available served at least three different ways each night. Crab perfect, chowders loaded with clams, etc. Warm fresh bread and a variety of salads compliment probably the best dinners available in the Fisherman's Wharf area.   Located a bit off the main drag of wharf shops on Al Scoma Way, this restaurant brings back the memories of what the waterfront use to be like. Great service, nice bar, quality food, in a very clean environment. Wait staff has been nothing short of perfect on every visit. Plenty of small tables in the bar to relax if you do have to wait for dinner seating.  I have also had lunch/dinner at most wharf restaurants and while many of the menus have been adjusted to the tourist crowd and are somewhat disappointing, Scoma's maintains the quality and atmosphere that you should expect of a higher end restaurant along the waterfront. They don't cut corners. Valet parking is available at the front of the restaurant, and by donation.   I usually call in about 30 minutes before arrival to check on wait times and never have had to wait more than 10 minutes on weekends, no wait ever on weekdays. The atmosphere is nice enough for any occasion and the bar serves up a long list of quality wines, as well as your favorite cocktails.

IVV2kzualGCvT21HayokDA.review_text: Restuarant was highly recommend to me, and it turned out to be quite disappointing. Food was very average especially considering the price.

eZc6ZCAjGlCQDDHYG65iNA.review_text: I love Scoma's!  I always have.  For a traditional seafood dining experience right on the water, Scoma's exudes historic San Francisco, it's been a fixture in the City and if your visiting, it's a must visit!  Their crab salad is off the charts.

_0L4WNYQ6f6y6pMYzJ3b9Q.review_text: Ate here about 14 years ago and back again in the area necessitated a return visit. Over the years, either my palate has matured, I sampled excellent seafood at other places; but it was not the 5 star place I remembered.  I had the lobster bisque: watery Swordfish: Good, but lentils that accompanied the dish where undercooked Service was decent.  Had to wait 20 min for a table and then be squeezed in between other tables.  Overall decent, but I made the drive here from San Carlos based on my desire to revisit; not going to do  that again...

0dnGrJr54WDqByxkj86lkQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I came here on a Sunday for an early dinner.  We made reservations for 4:00 and got seated probably around 4:30 so we enjoyed a cocktail while we waited.    The menu looked delicious and we had a hard time figuring out what to get, but this is what we settled on:  a cup each of the lobster bisque and clam chowder.  The bisque was deliciously creamy and the chowder was very good!  I ordered the grilled salmon on lobster ravioli with saffron sauce and he got the cajun swordfish with mashed potatoes and grilled veggies.  The lobster ravioli is AMAZING!  The saffron rice was creamy and decadent but not over powering.  I almost wish I just ordered the lobster ravioli without the salmon so I could have had more!  The swordfish was good, but the ravioli was definitely the better of the two.  Overall, the meal was very enjoyable and the service was delightful.  We would definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting a nice seafood dinner!

KFaUuuvfw-6rAbTzuYwU0g.review_text: 4.25 (3.75 for food and +0.5 for top notch service) DAT (dine about town)  shellfish combo $38 The waitress recommended this and it was a good one. Came with 2 lobster tails, 3 shrimp, 5 scallops, 5 pieces of de-shelled crab meat, pasta, veggies on top of a bed of risotto. The seafood was slightly above average with the juices flavoring and enhancing the risotto and pasta. 4.25/5  1)DAT $35 lobster bisque bits of lobster on the side with a small cup soup. Nice presentation with slightly above average taste 3.5/5  ahi Not over cooked and served with veggies. The portions were kinda small but its DAT.  The fish its self is similar to roy's in quality and taste. 3.25/5  brownie with butterscotch and coffee ice cream The brownie was very rich, the caramel and butter mix was also very rich. The ice cream was also very rich. My only complaint is that it kept me up until 4am until I could sleep. The whip cream that came with it tasted like air. 4/5  2) DAT crabcakes 2 pieces of super yummy crab cakes with some greens. 5/5  halibut not overally impressed by this dish. The spinach? with ham that came with it was pretty good though. 3/5  tiramisu baked in a small tea cup. It also came with a very rich rum cake on the side along with extra light whipped cream. One of the better ones I have had. 4.25/5  bread stale. Went well with the bisque. 2/5  Overall. A very nice place to bring a date as its pretty fancy and the food was above average. The service was 5/5. I would not hesitate to recommend this place for the right occasion.

zXi8WzXV2lfefnnzPEnOOw.review_text: Love this spot, always have...but I am still waiting for them to serve drawn butter instead of that clarified shit.  It's like pouring vegetable oil on your damn food!    But the last time I had the seafood extravaganza...and no that is not the real name of it but it is a plate of scallops, crab, baby lobsters, prawns all over a bed of rice and veggies.  Freaking amazing.   The lobster bisque is pretty amazing as well.    Our server was pretty damn funny and was all over us with good service and great recommendations.   Homeboy takes his dish description seriously.  It was like he had a monologue prepared for a casting call, I gave him a standing O when he finished his spiel.     I have yet to have any dessert here though as I am usually stuffed to a point of discomfort.

K8eob8S6ZaMLgyVmPgg-Iw.review_text: This is a nice restaurant if you want something a little more upscale. Most of the surrounding restaurants are touristy, but Scomas has charm and excellent food. Great fresh seafood!

NeTXy5d4as9xpZOCBgELCQ.review_text: I have been fortunate to have been going to Scoma's for the last 30 years and recently had the opportunity to introduce the experience to my son and fiancé.  Scoma's still has the same retro feel, '50's charm without being pretentious ........ Professional waiters in jackets, white tablecloths and napkins.  You, also, cannot beat the location - amongst the fishing boats at end of a pier in Fisherman's Wharf.  The food ........ was, as always, SPECTACULAR!  The best in Seafood! With so many restaurants to choose from in San Francisco, whether visiting or looking for a special night out - check out this gem!

-x2Ulw6ijKqlmlZTcuXWbg.review_text: Ate here 9/27/14. Was assured they would be busy but sat immediately at about 6:00. Service was friendly and attentive.  My lobster bisque was delicious and rich. My wive's salad was fine. A little too much arugula and other greens tasted like dandelion.  Wive's blackened halibut was a little overcooked but good, not great. My dungeness crab risotto was disappointing.  Way too fishy for dungeness, like they added extra fish juice. I also have to ask who the heck puts mushrooms in a shellfish risotto - much less CANNED mushrooms? It was edible but not good. Until I found a hair in it. They comped our desserts so that helped.  But still the only GREAT thing we had was the lobster bisque and nothing else was much over "OKAY".

X8EaFdIcMn3hYdlH0hJQ7w.review_text: It was actually surprising that this place had good food at reasonable prices considering it's location.   Restaurants by or near the ocean are usually overpriced joints serving mediocre food...and what you are really paying for is the view/location.  This place seems like it's always busy so luckily I had made reservations.  Our waiter was very friendly and quite entertaining - A+  I ordered the mixed seafood grill which came with  I believe 4 small filets of different fishes.   It was quite good,  not amazing but definitely enjoyable.    My wife got the dungeness crab risotto which was really more of a rice/stew concoction then a traditional risotto.   It was quite wet for a risotto and came with a lot of green peas.   I thought it was an OK dish although whenever i order risotto i expect traditional style risotto that's pretty much dry and infused with sticks of butter.  Several of my friends got the cioppino and they loved it.   It was quite a large bowl filled with plenty of seafood.   Personally I felt the cioppino was a little too thick....they put a whole boatload of tomato paste in it.  Overall,  I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for good seafood in SF.   The excellent location also means you can traverse through Fisherman's Wharf either before or after your meal.

bcXUat3O2NyYUQNThcliNg.review_text: I've visited this restaurant twice and had different experiences each time.  My first visit was at least 5 years ago - Food was fresh and the chef personally came to our table to serve us our dinner. The chefs random visit, made our dining experience unique and special. I had a salmon dish which was great. My friend loved her meal also.   The second visit was in January earlier this year.  I wasn't impressed with the food nor was anyone else in our party. It wasn't bad, but the quality seems to have down graded and the flavour & freshness were average. I dont expect average from an upscale restaurant.  The menu items are typical of a seafood restaurant. Expect good/decent seafood, but don't expect gourmet and creative.    The restaurant has an older, outdated feel - it needs updating. On the other hand, the waitress went the extra mile to check all the ingredients in my mother in laws meal and make sure there wasn't chili in her meal. When she found that there may be chili in the cocktail sauce, she quickly created an alternative solution. Good service and nice location on the water.

zEAmT3BX-o-l6WA5OC0kZg.review_text: Best chowder I've ever had. On a boat tour the guide mentioned something about them possibly using seawater for extra flavor. Mmmmmmmmmm.

JqHQMojDCOsLWSAtVkIJiQ.review_text: This restaurant came highly recommended and it did not disappoint. The wait staff seated us quickly and were patient as we reviewed the extensive menu. The food was deliciously excellent. The fish dishes were cooked to perfection. The tables were a bit too close for comfort as the place was packed. Reservations are highly recommended.

GodFH0SvRPNHrq5c3VCESw.review_text: One of my top 10 best meals ever.  You know what I am talking about - when the food, drink, company, and conversation is perfect.  I had the Cioppino seafood stew.  I am not a soup fan because I want a lot of food.  I took a chance on this dish after seeing someone else's go by.  Unbelievable!  The red marinara sauce was a dipping sauce for the perfect bread.  And the chunks of seafood were divine.  Even for a heavy guy like me, there was way enough food.  I even had enough to share with my wife.  We both agreed that this is a San Francisco must.

WW_oh8NfnHH32L_H5Kn1Ig.review_text: Scomas, as the man and I agreed, is just "aight"....Came here on a Sat. night and waited at the bar for our table for no more than half an hour, as promised. The place is very cute an the bartenders are friendly. I love how it's kind hidden off teh wharf and right next to the water oh a pier. We started out with a half dozen oysters. I had the cioppino and my bf had half a roast garlic dungeness crab and some clam chowder.  The oysters: Delicious. For $3 a piece, they better be!!!!! Clam chowder: YUM!!!  Now on to the bigger better things.. the Cioppino: Good, but Fish Market in San Mateo makes MUCH better cioppino. As much as I LOVE anything tomato, the consistency was more like that of a pasta sauce rather than a soup or stew. Though yummy, a little too hearty and takes away from the flavor of the seafood. For $40, I wasn't floored...  Roast garlic crab: Good, but better at Thanh Long....  I really liked the atmosphere of the place, and loved our Italian waiter who called me "Bella", didn't catch his name, but he was great.  Overall, Scomas is good, but not as good as I expected. We'll probably stick to our usual favorite spots for Cioppino (Fish Market) and crab (Thanh Long).

QcVyc44YtXXYa0GOY8BkAA.review_text: Food very good.  Downgraded due to waiter's unwillingness (or to ask kitchen staff) to crack the crab shells for our disabled guest.  This during slow time late afternoon.  So we rotated cracking duties around table letting $200 worth of food get cold.  Could have ordered something else but we went there in part so he could have the crab.  We were disappointed.

LrhjmL1JfX-tH6crOvjuvg.review_text: Really was expecting much more. Food was ok, nothing great and overpriced for what you get.  I wouldn't go back.

OiBmu84gTMZhWqDi2PXhCQ.review_text: Looking for some great seafood on the wharf and went to try Scoma's.  I really liked the vibe in the restaurant.  Good food and drink, staff was very nice and friendly.  No need to dress up for this place even though I as coming from a business meeting.  I had the "Lazy Man's" Cioppino and it was outstanding.  Plenty of seafood and fresh as you would expect.  The shrimp and scallops we're nice and tender, definitely not overcooked.  Nice toasted garlic bread for dipping.  I had a Malbec to help wash the meal down.  I'll be coming back again to try something else on the menu.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is I want to try some more and give it the 5th star.

AFSpLArexc1h0QLOjvUdeA.review_text: If your looking for a sit down meal around the wharf, this is probably the only place I will go for seafood.  Of course you will see a lot of visitors and tourists, but what else do you expect?  Do get: The crab cakes kumamoto oysters crab louis salad  The interior and servers are a little bit dated, but hey, service is always up to par.  Plenty of seating in the bar area, and the main dining.  Beware: Parking can be difficult though, and prices are a bit steep.

XW4TSu9LodFF4Lc5NkKh_g.review_text: A wonderful experience. The fish was very fresh, flaky and delicious. I started with the portobello mushroom stuffed with crab. The combination of savory and sweet was heavenly.  I then had the grill platter which included 2oz each of salmon, swordfish and haddock, plus 3 prawns. Creamed spinach and a mix of sweet & regular fries were included. A superfluous dipping sauce was also on the side for those who might want it. I recommend Scoma's to anyone who loves fresh seafood!

PS4Qx8SzSt-bmRuTiz32oA.review_text: Personally, I enjoyed this place. What I really liked about it was that it was in a touristy location, but everyone there seemed to be locals. The vibe in there is nice as well, it was a busy Sunday evening when I went and they have very limited reservations, so I had to wait about an hour to get seated.   As for the dinner, I started off with a very tasty bloody mary and the BLACK-N-BLUE AHI, which was perfectly seared. My main course was the SHRIMP AND SCALLOPS ALLA GANNON which came with a side of veggies, mashed potatoes, and rice. The shrimp and scallops were really great; you can tell the seafood was fresh.   Overall, I would recommend this place to dine in at least once. The menu has many options, if I end up there again I'll be going for the Lobster ravioli.

AoAUWW6gyXF22zrWBVQOjw.review_text: This review is really more of 3.5 stars but the service and appetizer were just amazing. So 4 stars it is.  We came on a Sunday at around 4:30pm and the wait was already about 45 minutes. It was highly recommended by a friend so we decided to just stick it out. The place itself is kind of dim and has a sort of old-school-class feel to it. We took a look at the menu beforehand and I was blown away by the prices. We were seated in a section that I think had just opened up for dinner because we were the first ones there but it filled up quickly. Our server was beyond friendly and knowledgeable, answered all our questions and patiently waited as we debated what to ordered.  We got an appetizer, Oyster Rockefeller Alla Scoma (cheese, lemon, and spinach on oysters), which were SO GOOD, so flavorful and really just blew me away even more than the menu prices. My main dish was the Pasta Alla Scoma (garlic butter sauce linguini with clams) and it was filled with lots of clams (which it better be for the price). It was pretty good.  Again the appetizer and server are what have me really liking this place. I want to really love Scoma's but I'm just not sure the price lives up to it. If you do stop by though, definitely try the Oyster Rockefeller Alla Scoma (if you're into that)!

jAiGoRmj3eAkeH_3KfudXg.review_text: So, my manfriend had been waxing poetic about a place he dined while at a conference in San Francisco ages ago. The way he described it, it sounded like an unknown diamond in the rough. Separately, I had bookmarked Scoma's as a place we might want to go for a nice dinner. Lo and behold, they were one in the same.  We hadn't planned to hit Scoma's in advance, so the best we could do with Open Table was an 8:45 reservation. After a day of walking around and an impromptu bar crawl, we decided to try our luck for an earlier table. We grabbed a drink at the bar after  putting our name in; definitely a happening place with a friendly crowd. For him, The Dinghy and for me, The Calm Before the Storm, a tasty, spicy take on a margarita.  Scoma's is tucked away from the madness of Jefferson and the Embarcadero, but the secret is out, so make reservations. The ambiance reminded me of a steak house; waiters in white coats, attentive service, large portions and the absence of any gimmicky seafood decor (nets, plastic crabs and lobsters, etc.).  To start we had Black and Blue Ahi, a crusted and seared ahi served with greens, which was just as tasty as it looked. We struggled choosing entrees, everything sounded delicious. I will say though, if you abstain from pork, let your server know. There were a couple of dishes that didn't list panchetta in the menu description that I scrapped from my list. He ended up going with the swordfish piccata, which was perfectly cooked and flaorful. I went wit the scallop risotto, so wonderfully decadent. The scallops were cooked beautifully.  With limited time in the city, I keep a short list of places I make a point of returning to. Scoma's has easily made that list. The steakhouse ambiance makes it an easy choice for a nice date, business meeting or fancier meal.

xQHHmSV9cwfi6gu4iwDrLg.review_text: Excellent food.  I ordered the fresh catch of the day and it was cooked to perfection.  My husband ordered the linguine al diplomatico. His dish had so much fish in it. This was a dish recommended by our waiter and it was a terrific choice.   Our friends we went with aren't big fish fans and they enjoyed their steaks as well. They were juicy and cooked to perfection according to them. So there is something for fish lovers and non-fish lovers.

_bBU-MAP3OEel00aU37MdA.review_text: Kumamoto oysters, lobster bisque and clam chowder.  Bartender Steve was making fresh mint mojitos. Love this place!!

qUIjw3wpXZaFp2klmSx9QA.review_text: I celebrated my 24th wedding anniversary at Scoma's last night.  It was perfect!!!  My husband had called ahead and had flowers delivered there and the staff had arranged them at the table ahead of time.  We were seated immediately.    The food was excellent.  We had roasted crab and received 2 complimentary desserts in celebration of our anniversary.  At Scoma's they treat customers right!    My husband took me to Scoma's on our first date and we always come back, because we've always had wonderful experiences at Scoma's!  Last night was exceptional!

5XDgaMQeXLIHpR1e3d-HUQ.review_text: We met some out-of-town friends here because Scoma's had been highly recommended to them. I had a lovely glass of merlot, split a tasty spinach salad with one of my dining companions, then had the best blackened swordfish I think I've ever eaten. I've been avoiding swordfish because of its previous avoid status on the Seafood Watch list, but our very competent waiter assured me this swordfish was handline caught, and I succumbed. One of my non-fish-loving dining companions was sorry that she'd ordered the mediocre steak instead of the swordfish. The other orders at my table included a decent pasta dish and a crab risotto, and both diners were quite happy with their orders. The bread slices were huge and really good. Next time I'll avoid the bread basket, lol, because half of my swordfish came home with me for lunch. :-) If you don't like seafood this is probably not the best place to eat. For seafood lovers, you could eat here every night for weeks before you'd make your way through all of the seafood entrees. I'm looking forward to going back.

9MNumsdViMbqwH3LjGRCSw.review_text: Lovely atmosphere. Valet parking. We were being romantic and this place definitely kept what we were doing alive. Sat by the window with the view of Aliotos. Love that wine list. My waiter was Hella cool and Hella chatty. But it's good. We had the lobster bisque and clam chowder for starters. I ordered the Dungeness crab risotto. He ordered the whole crab garlic roasted. The crab portions were good for my risotto. However, I don't care too much for the actual risotto. The crab came and the presentation was boring. The roasted garlic on the crab was very light. But edible..of course. I will say that the crab was the cleanest crab I've ever seen from any of the restaurants in the area. Overall, the experience was nice and that's what I really wanted

27JQ4nnrkJeBZOfZ2_MJjg.review_text: Scoma's is one of the best restaurants of any kind you can eat at! Their seafood is tops-- bar none! The service is always terrific too. My wife and I have been eating here when in San Francisco for more than twenty years, and it is consistently very good.

q-zcBRObGdiAMScvBIy2tQ.review_text: Scoma is so cute. For out of towners visiting I strongly recommend riding a bike on Fishermann's wharf across the Golden Gate Bridge and stopping for lunch here at Scoma. Ask to sit in the back, there is the a beautiful view of the water. I ordered clam chowder in a sourdough bowl which was the best I ever had. My friends got shrimp tacos and crab which were wonderful as well.

7VE9IHnRMokkuPic6OMThA.review_text: As good as it gets!!  Great fresh fish and shellfish dishes...Easily best on the Wharf and in San Francisco as well.  The fish comes right off the boats at their back door and into the kitchen.  Make a reservation, and your table will be waiting for you.  Sit in Sergio's section for menu knowledge and great service!!

NNMbPWrFM9O5KPbs-oeD6g.review_text: If a party of 1 expect to be put in the corner in a tiny table, even though several other tables with a view are available...  Staff was not overly friendly...but have to admit the clam chowder and crab cakes were phenomenal (which is why such a high score)...

T_TvlfXcSUbXm2-ZFoe73A.review_text: Of the countless fine places in San Francisco, California and about everywhere else, Scoma's is the among the very best...if not the best.  I hate to be repetitive, but yes, the Lazy Man's Cioppino is as good as it gets.  With a side of delicious sourdough and rich butter, the Cioppino is sheer culinary bliss.  The fresh fish selections...all simply prepared are exquisite as well.

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Fabulous! Things to get.... lobster bisque is amazing!!! Wish there were a few extra chunks inside but that's ok :)  We ordered the cioppino. This thing is HUGE. It could feed four people. We also order a whole garlic roasted crab. It was all delicious and steamy.  It was funny because when the crab came out the older waiter take out this huge bib an starts to tie it around my boyfriend and doing it for him. I put mine on myself but it was priceless to watch.  Great place for seafood.   The location is in Fisherman Wharf which is tourist town but I'll come down here since I'm a local for this place!

cgrT4GWEiyQDEW49VRP98w.review_text: Ordered Crab cake Mixed seafood gill Lobster Laeiloi  Cram chowder  Good taste! Friendly waiters! A little bit experience but it's worth.  You do not need to book for window seat because .... It's all the same.

GyFw7b5_fclAS3HhNM23hQ.review_text: Went with the reviews I had read here about the clam chowder. It definitely didn't disappoint. Also had a taste of the Lazy Man's Cioppino; didn't disappoint either. Ordered the dungeness crabcakes, romaine salad, and mixed green salad. Really enjoyed the romaine salad. For dessert went with the lemon and pecan tart. The lemon tart was YUMMY! Service was good considering that they were busy.

npMj3QhyOP0GbCvvv0xOkQ.review_text: Ciopinno over here was not good as it was pretty large and I almost could not finish with all the other appetizers I ate.  Great place to visit while visiting the warf.

xsj5n0v2p-_tND7q9K25ag.review_text: A very food savvy friend from Vegas recommended Scoma. It was very good! The decor is from the 70's but somehow it works. The staff are veterans and very knowledgable. We sat and had views of SF Bay while eating the freshest seafood I can remember. Good food and reasonably priced wine list. The only detraction would be that they are a busy popular spot and they want to get you in and out which had us feel a little rushed towards the end of dinner.

UL0ypgePQ3WQDjTpFJmSTQ.review_text: I wish I could give this place a higher rating, but the food and service just didn't merit it for the price. I ordered off the prix-fixe menu, while my friend ordered the cioppino. Her dish was chock-full of seafood and had a flavorful, spicy broth.  I started with the lobster bisque and lobster salad. The bisque was completely smooth with no actual chunks of lobster meat. The fresh lobster meat on the side was only about the size of a quarter, but at least it tasted great. I was a little annoyed that my cup of soup was about 2/3 full.  My entree was linguine with diver scallops. They definitely didn't skimp on the fresh scallops, but the sauce wasn't memorable.  For dessert, I opted for the tiramisu. It came in an espresso cup, and while it was delicious, it was only about two bites. Tasty, but nothing special.  I'm glad we weren't rushed, but the service was incredibly slow and the atmosphere was too stuffy for me. Maybe it would have been better if we'd sat by a window to better enjoy the views.  I would give Scoma's another shot, but for $60 per person without drinks, I think we could have done better elsewhere.

rT_eYTdxqlAX_nRzglQFUw.review_text: Awesome Dungeness crab my wife and I have ever had. So glad we asked the locals and found out about this place. Gonna come back here on our next trip to frisco.

A26hAdAoVCYeq-Jl8UThKg.review_text: Blackened Halibut is the best tasting fish that've have ever had.  Fantastic service and great food.  Waiter was very knowledgable and recommended the perfect dish for me.

le3q1LEoDlI5wSsWUvAE7w.review_text: My favorite San Francisco restaurant. Lump crabmeat cocktail and pasta diplomatica are my favorites!!  The whole Scoma's experience is fantastic. Starting with crowded, sectioned-off eating areas, wood-paneled walls that have seen better days, out-dated lounge chairs - the whole place needs an over-haul, but they still serve on white table cloths and the servers are white-jacketed formal. I wouldn't want them to change one thing about this place. And it appears everyone else feels the same. The place is packed every night. And they don't take reservations, but Marianne can always get you a table quickly. For the best Fisherman's Wharf experience, you must try Scoma's

INMM1Q_4qGMIbxwb4IUbLQ.review_text: I always order the Lazy man's cioppino when I come here. Has lots of seafood and good enough for two people.

q_59ARjoIUkyfzdtnE2ciw.review_text: This is an interesting restaurant.  It is not on the main drag, and you have to walk down a short alley like street.  The restaurant itself is rather small.  There is valet parking.  The patrons are a dedicated bunch of seemingly regulars.  I say that as everyone from the parking attendents to the wait staff met would call these people by name, and come over and hug them.  Kathleen was our waitress and she was great.  The wait staff were all quite professionally dressed with white coats and tuxedoes.  If any of them were younger than age 50, I'd be surprised.  I got the feeling that Friday lunch was when San Francisco "old money" all came to Scomas to eat lunch. For a sit down, classy, main stay restaurant of San Francisco, I did not think the prices were out of line at all.

G4CoJrk_IpLe2Q7xJBjqKw.review_text: Probably one of the best lobster bisque I've ever had! The entree  was fairly decent , but the soup was by far the star! A must-try

kY2qz3daZYe3rnq8PAEF5A.review_text: We ate at Scoma's yesterday October 9 2014.  It was the WORST food ever!  My mother and I ordered the lunch special, fish and chips.  The fish was over cooked and very dry.  The fries were a mix of sweet potato and regular.  HORRIBLE!!!  The only thing that was good was the bread and the clam chowder.  The service wasn't up to par either.  There was 4 of us and 3 of us got our food while the 4th had to wait a few minutes.  You'd think that the fact that we ordered an 82.00 bottle of champagne that alone would have prompted us good service.  NOT HAPPY AT ALL!!  We had guests from out of town with us and bragged how wonderful Scoma's is only to be disappointed like that.  I have never had such a terrible experience there.  I don't know if we will ever go back there again when in the city.  Might try Grotto next time.  VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED SCOMAS!!!  I don't know what happened.

tFyMN6_SJzXPQYVxzoKI-A.review_text: Last time I visited Scoma's was about 15 years ago and I've wanted to go back ever since. I thought ahead and made reservations a couple of weeks in advance. We were seated 5 minutes ahead of schedule.  We ordered the cold seafood appetizer for two with clams, oysters, crab claws , and shrimp. It was okay but not outstanding for $29.  We ordered the Shellfish Sauté ($40) and Scoma's Pasta. I have never seen so many clams in one dish--I counted 32!  The pasta was average other than the vast amount if clams, it needed more garlic to my taste .  The Shellfish Sauté included shrimp, two small lobster tails, juicy sweet scallops and other seafood goodies. It was worth the price but a huge amount of food.   Scoma's is a great place for tasty seafood but a bit on the pricy side. Our total was $137 for dinner for two with one glass of wine.

otRk7mNeYSLghvxRretahQ.review_text: I highly recommend the clam chowder, fried calamari, and the pasta diplomatica. Other than that, I don't think the place is worth coming to if you don't order those dishes.   Tonight, I ordered a bowl of clam chowder, pasta diplomatica, pasta bolognese, dungeness crab spoon bread, and the salmon on lobster ravioli with saffron sauce. Of course I loved the clam chowder and pasta diplomatica, but the rest were only okay. The pasta bolognese was good, but not to die for. I was really excited to try the dungeness crab spoon bread, but it wasn't good. The bread was very, very soft and the crab tasted like microwaved food. I wasn't a huge fan of the salmon on lobster ravioli with saffron sauce, but maybe that's because I had such a strong taste in my mouth after the crab spoon bread so I wasn't tasting properly.   Great, friendly, fast service.

qkRAvTnkVqSUOkKhvY9COw.review_text: My wife, kids and I looked on Yelp for good place to have dinner on a Friday night, while we were in San Francisco. We decided on Scoma's. We walked in, and were told that the wait would be 30 minutes.  After 35 minutes, I walked to the hostess stand to find out how much longer.  I was told "just a few minutes longer".  After 45 minutes, the hostess said "just another few minutes".  After an hour of waiting, we were seated in the back portion of the restaurant, near a bus station. The bad part about this area is that there is a door that the waiters use to step outside and smoke. Unfortunately, they don't shut this door when they smoke and the smoke travels back into the restaurant. I mentioned this to our waiter, who basically ignored me.  The food was average. The experience was not good, and we will not go back.

JszEAaiAE_dff7TR9d4hFA.review_text: A San Francisco Institution. Great service, views and food.

u9KhzES5reUljwccEyFdJw.review_text: It t'was a roomie dinner kind of night. I kept getting rave reviews about this place so naturally I had super high expectations. But my high expectations fell short and was not super impressed. Everything was just ok here. The server was hilarious though!! Wayman was his name and he was too funny, but not the kind where he was trying to be funny at all. Hard to explain but needless to say he made our night.

UDVZDR7uabI1blSiXQE4aQ.review_text: This restaurant was definitely not worth the money. Its small, out dated, my fiancee and I were sat at a table in the corner of the dining room where part of the wall jutted out and I had use of about 1/3rd of the table. How this place gets 4/5 stars is beyond me since there are many other restaurants in the area serving better food (looks like all the meals come with mashed potatoes and vegetables). I wish we had gone to one of the other restaurants. If you are wanting  average service with 1970s paneling environment, this place is for you.

bMXigKk6S-e-ApRuMCF7rw.review_text: We decided to go for a great pre-anniversary meal. We were very disappointed. I ordered New York Steak which came with mashed potatoes and MIXED vegetables. The steak was just okay - no flavoring. The supposed mixed vegetables was a large scoop of cauliflower with 3 little round carrots. The cauliflower was deep yellow in color as was the mashed potatoes; neither of which were flavorful. My husband ordered grilled salmon. He started eating it and it smelled like a dirty dish rag. He said it tasted like old fish! Yuk! He ended up with the same scoop of cauliflower!  We were there at 5:30 p.m. for dinner on a Saturday evening so no excuse or reason for the awful tasting food - which by the way was overpriced.   Caesar salad and French bread was good and fresh.   Service was good.

YLmAV9o5D4JmeCUBKtgnMA.review_text: My boyfriend's parents went to Scoma's 15 years ago and said that it was one of the best meals they have ever had so when we came to SF, we had to try to out - and it did live up to its expectations.   First off - it is right on the water and you can see where the fisherman dock and bring their catch in for Scoma's each day!   The food was so fresh and delicious!   My boyfriend had the garlic roasted dungeness crab - AMAZING!!!   The lobster ravioli was extremely tasty and succulent.   The crab cocktail was the freshest thing I've tasted in a long time.   When traveling to San Francisco, Scoma's is a must see!

5K9yqInZGhwRWn6dxwiw8w.review_text: Wow, I hate to disagree (two stars worth!) with my beloved yelp community, but Scoma's was a huge disappointment and I honestly feel like I dined in a different restaurant than some of these reviews.    Let's see, where to begin ... we went for lunch and got there 10 mins before official opening time, but they kindly allowed us early birds to park at the bar while the restaurant was readied for the hungry hordes.  I had a glass of wine, companion had water ... I asked the 'keep if he needed us to settle or if we could carry the check to our table.  He looked at me like I had three heads and told me no, I needed to pay for my drink here.  ok ... so I ask for a check.  I got this gruff attitude, and he sticks the check in a plastic cup in front of the two of us and turns his back.  We know we are about to be called, so I put a bill in the cup.  From the size of the bill, I clearly had change coming, but the guy ignored it.  the cup sat.  our name was called and I was forced to flag him down.  It all felt kind of icky.  What can I say ... gut feeling.  Lunch itself was also a letdown.  I had crab cakes (they don't have this as an entree, only an app, so no sides for me.)  The crab was tiny slivers in too much filler and there were several shells.  Nothing turns off crab-cake love faster than shells.  His fish was .... meh.  Literally nothing to mention one way or the other, totally forgettable.  And if I can't even remember dessert (I can't, even looking at the menu) I can promise you it's bad.  b-a-n-a-n-a-s bad.    Prices are just too high for the quality and service.  Scoma's is really not what it pretends to be.  There is so much potential ... a magnificent view if you are lucky to snag a window table, and a better than prime location.  but other than that, Scoma's feels run down and in need of some reworking.

d8zp3ILsDnjx986RsC3R1g.review_text: Bread is good!  Way over priced, I mean WAY!  You get crappy sides with your meal and you are crammed into a TINY place.  If you are sitting behind a tall or large person you can forget about being able to go use the restroom - you're locked in!  For this amount of money per plate you should at least be able to stretch out or relax at your table - not here!  Oh ya and the dock is way dangerous! Kids can totally fall right through the side rails!  But good bread.

9R3lxxazCr17WXCIgk2xMA.review_text: Solely based on the service and cleanliness alone, I can't even bring myself to give it 3 stars. While the food was write-home-and-tell-the-folks-about-it phenomenal, the RUDE bartender during our HOUR PAST RESERVATION TIME plus the wait staff (one of whom kept putting her arm ON MY FRIENDS HEAD to reach over and fill our glasses, the 2nd, 3rd and sometimes 4th reminders to be brought a drink or food item ordered, was just ridiculous. The bathrooms were DISGUSTING! I had mentioned it to them during our waiting, and than half way through the meal, went again and they were WORSE! Toilet paper EVERYWHERE! For a place that has such amazing food (I had the porta bella mushroom appetizer and the smoked salmon and shrimp fettuccini), i was severely disappointed in the numerous staff we came into contact with! Maybe just get your food to go and avoid the staff as much as possible!

jFZ7xAhnT5tteHgqL-zw2g.review_text: Made a reservation here for NYE and was extremely disappointed considering all the great reviews on here. This is definitely more of a touristy place than a restaurant that actually serves great food. My biggest pet peeve is when "nice" restaurants serve cold almost stale looking bread with cold butter. As a first impression it's well not impressive. The food isn't well presented for a place that's $$$. The mushroom/dungeness crab appetizer looked like it was overcooked and the vegetables in my lobster risotto seemed like they could have come out of a frozen bag from the grocery store. Not a place I would recommend.

du4opprO3OVLJjFfDw_IeQ.review_text: I came off of a recommendation.  I wasn't impressed.  It didn't knock my socks off and I wasn't impressed with the location, old decor, facility, etc   I guess it's better than really touristy food, but I regretted coming here.

lt9vlWEaHsILoBBOEwX4MA.review_text: During the city sight seeing tour, it was mentioned that Scoma's was thee place to go;  Since it was my last night in San Francisco with my brother and my friends we decided to check out Scoma's.  My brother called to make reservations (Sunday) at 7 PM, but the hostess mentioned they weren't taking reservations at that time.  The hostess mentioned it was a 30 minute wait.  We finally got to the restaurant, put our name on the list for a party of 4 and the wait was 30-45 minutes.  The longer we waited the more and more people were coming in.  45 minutes later, we got sat down.  We had:  -Scoma's Famous Clam Chowder (Bowl $9): OH EM GEE, the BESSSST clam chowder I've ever had.  My brother and I shared the Bowl, and I think I would have finished the bowl alone! haha!  -Broiled King Salmon ($34): I decided to go for it and get the broiled salmon that came with garlic mashed potatoes and veggies.  The salmon was perfectly cooked, it wasn't dry at all but could use a little flavor. The salmon was a pretty good size and I could not finish if.   -ALASKAN HALIBUT SICILIANA  ($30): Topped with Sicilian Olives, Tomato, Capers, Anchovies - My best friend ordered the Halibut and he and his sister really liked it.  I had a little taste of it and it was just okay for me.  -Prawns over Linguine Pomodoro (I think!): My brother went on Yelp before dinner and saw this picture that he wanted to try.  He realized that it wasn't on the menu, so he showed out waiter the picture and did his thing and suggested it's prawns over Linguine Pomodoro (which I'm not sure if that's exactly what he said).  I tried a little bit of his pasta, and it was just okay for me. I think their other pastas would have been better?  Overall, the service was awesome!  I gave this place an extra star because of how GREAT their clam chowder was.  I'd go back here again for their clam chowder, and try something different; maybe their Prix Fixe dinner before 5PM.

M01neU-mU5UFTyVRwJpVXw.review_text: Delicious cioppino! Served spicy or nonspicy your choice. Huge serving size it could feed two or three.   Lobster bisque is really rich and creamy. Absolutely delicious!   Oyster trio was great! Tasted really fresh! Served half dozed and had three pairs of different types.   Service was excellent! Out waiter was enthusiastic, had suggestions, and demonstrated exemplary knowledge of the menu and how everything was prepared and cooked!

HO9VpfYRzD0QFom85uYNDQ.review_text: Great food and service. We arrived at 1:00 Saturday afternoon and waited about 20 minutes for the table. You can sit at the bar and wait. It is comfortable. Thanks to Yelp we learned they have free valet parking. It is convenient. We were seated at a window table. Great atmosphere. The waiters are excellent and take time to point out highlights and explain the menu. The food is fabulous.  I had the LAZY MAN'S CIOPPINO.   The broth was seasoned perfect with an abundance of shellfish and fresh fish.  My wife had SWORDFISH CON FAGIOLI. That, I strongly recommend.  The fish is broiled, with white beans, swiss chard and pancetta. It is incredible! My son had their version of Surf & Turf. A perfectly cooked NY Strip with colossal prawns. They were so good and taste like lobster. I cannot say enough good things about Scoma's. It will be a part of every visit I make to the Bay Area from now on.

0eGVtn7yM-eHYB8hHSR5Jw.review_text: We loved this restaurant.    The food was excellent.  The service was even better.   I felt like I was on a cruise ship.

C4dqGS0ld9yWsTNKatyqGw.review_text: The lobster bisque was amazing!  The bread was soft and yummy. Scallops and prawns with lemon and butter was good... The scallops were grilled to perfection, the prawns were kind of tasteless ... All I could taste was the charred skewer flavor. Service was excellent! Very friendly and knowledgable.

Lvu0088gU2xYKjyfzLA26g.review_text: We were recommended to check out this place from my sister. Wow- great food and service! The garlic Dungeness crab rocked!! Totally would come back and recommend this place! Cocktails were yummy! Great and attentive service from the staff. :)

M5wRswBgy3Bo-IifRXq5Zg.review_text: I hadn't been to Scomas in years. My friend and I ordered King Salmon that came with mash potatoes and beans. Salmon was cooked too long so it was dry and potatoes were full of salt.  Service was terrible.  We should have sent the order back.  I would not go back and neither would my friend  JB

RhUQ1Vz3-bDMLbIGlcyzfA.review_text: An old school San Francisco seafood restaurant, Al Scoma's place on the wharf continues to shine even after 50 years.  While the worn red carpet and wood paneled walls hung with faded photographs of famous visitors seemingly haven't been updated from since the 1970s, the décor is just what one would expect from a longstanding San Francisco landmark.  The location right not he water cannot be beat.  The expansive menu has something for everyone, even those that shy away from seafood.  That being said, the dishes that feature the bounty of the ocean really shine at Scoma's.    With a light vinaigrette, the organic baby spinach salad ($16) with bacon, hard boiled egg, and tomatoes was a great way to start the meal.  Sweet and creamy, the butternut squash soup ($13) topped with chunks of local Dungeness crab was delicious.  Hearty and chock full of scallops, shrimp, crab, and fish, Scoma's "lazy man's" cippino ($39) is large enough for two and still leaves some to take home.  Fresh from the boat, the whole steamed Dungeness crab ($MP) is sweet and succulent.  The meal is accompanied by a seemingly endless supply of warm, freshly baked sourdough bread, butter, and olive oil.  Friendly and attentive, service is excellent.  Dressed in cropped white jackets, white shirts, and black ties, the waiters (nearly all are men) are classic.  Be sure to consult your server before ordering, as they are supremely knowledgeable of the menu and can direct you to selections that are sure to please.  Scoma's has a full bar as well as a nice, reasonably priced selections of wine by the glass and by the bottle.  With tasty seafood fresh from the boat, there is a reason why Scoma's has been a San Francisco seafood go-to for 50 years.

xqVr9_O0hXqxzDbJrQlhoQ.review_text: Review is only for the Clam Chowder.   On the hunt for the best Clam chowder in town, we stumbled upon Scoma's. If you are not looking for Scoma's, you wouldn't find it easily as you have to go in to the alley to get to it but once you are in front of the restaurant, you can see a bunch of people mulling around to be called for their names.   Scoma's located on (very close by) the Fisherman Wharf area and yet, there were plenty of locals eating at Scoma's which was a good sign.    We got there just in time right before the happy hour at the bar ends, and so we ordered a bowl of clam chowder and stood around since all the chairs were taken. :)  Scoma's does have the best of Clam Chowder, even though it is pricey ($10/happy hour, $11 regular price), it is legit!

0lLVwzlhWHEvQYYdrgQFyg.review_text: Maybe the only place where I trust everything my waiter says about their food. Great service, (besides the rude hostesses who didn't even say "hi" when I walked in) and great food. The portions are large so be careful when ordering! The calamari appetizer was a full meal!

4tJndq_LK-kfYaxLNYfEKg.review_text: I have been a San Francisco resident since 1986 and was first taken to Scoma's back in 1989. My first impression of the local restuarant tucked back in Al Scoma's Way was one of wonder. How cool it was to find a piece of "old San Francisco" hidden among the touristy confines of the Wharf. After my first meal at Scoma's I was hooked. I came back often and nine times out of ten I would order the blackened salmon. It became one of my favorite restuarants in SF and even had many of my  birthday dinners at my "favorite" spot.   But things have changed.....  A couple of years ago I knew the end was near when Scoma's replaced its bound menus to a one page laminate. The menu had been replaced and was scaled back. But the food was still excellent and I saw no reason to complain.  Until now......  Took a date my to old "favorite" restuarant last night. I talked it up all the way to our seated table. But once the food arrived I was sorerly disappointed. Gone was one of my favorite places to dine. Chalk it up to another place in disappearing San Francisco. My date and I shared the trio appetizer for two......it was disappointing but still looked forward to the main dishes. I couldn't wait to get my blackened salmon! My date ordered the once famous shellfish sauté. When it arrived It looked nothing like it did back when Scoma's cared about presenting quality dishes. My blackened salmon was an even bigger bummer. The size of my fish was a third the size it used to be. And it wasn't even blackened......the waiter offered to have it blackened but after I saw what was to come I thought to myself why even bother.   It just sucks forking over $150.00 (including a couple of cocktails) on mediocre food at best. What was once one of my favorite places to take my out of town friends and myself is no more. I have spoken to many other of my local friends and they all agree. Scoma's is no longer the restuarant that it used to be. And I will miss it. Giving it two stars solely on the great memories I had there.

451QHuyThn2ggLzq81cvcw.review_text: I was in SFO 2 years ago and some local guy took me to this restaurant. The dungeness crab is superb and nowhere else to be found! Though I forgot the restaurant's name, I google mapped the path and found it.  Last week I waited 1 hour in line and it's absolutely worth it because the dungeness crab season is just back! Order the Garlic-Roasted dungeness crab and it never fails you, never!

x7cN2viCydTW7U9srbP7kw.review_text: Tucked away in Fishermans Wharf but that didn't stop many from finding this wonderful old school restaurant.  We didn't have reservations but I don't think that would have minimized the wait. The hostess was spot in with the wait time - about 30 minutes. We enjoyed a cocktail and then seated on the upper floor of the restaurant. Thats where we were greeted by Tim, our sever. We were seated at a table flanked closely by other diners. We didn't complain but Tim noticed and immediately reseated us at a spacious booth.  He guided us through the menu and selection of appetizers as well as entrees.  We were so happy with our meals. The swordfish piccata was delicious as was the halibut. Of course you can't be at the wharf and skip clam chowder. It was excellent.  Definitely worth the wait and ask for Tim.

vtServ1aY-isQ0qJ6TZfJg.review_text: The best seafood restaurant in San Francisco!! -Most consistent menu and everything is yummy. -Great service and good atmosphere .  -No reservations taken so the only bad part is waiting...but you can drink at bar while you are waiting :)  I've been here a bunch of times and I can tell you that these are amazing: -Clam Chower -Lobster Bisque -Crab Louie -Shrimp Cocktail -Crab Cocktail -Fried Calamari -Petrale Dore -Lobster Thermidor -Cioppino -Lobster Newburg -Dungeness Crab  So many choices and so much good food...a staple in SF for SURE!

IqPxpjgVEcjpdxoR8UCXLQ.review_text: I'm going with 4.5 stars on this.  I was in town for a few days and the Yelp reviews were pretty god. SO, we tried it. Everyone enjoyed their food.  I had the halibut and it was amazing!  Good wine as well.  The only reason they dont get a full 5 stars is because one person asked our server if the chefs could do something different with what he wanted to order.  The server straight up said "no".  Didnt bother to ask the chefs.  Even if the chef had told the staff that they wont do things like that, just pretend to ask and make the customer happy.  The staff was friendly and skilled, though, dont get me wrong.  I would say this place is worth visiting!

HVk2ZvKxBVeXdKTC0yPOeA.review_text: Some of the BEST crab we have ever had in the states! A great place with old school ambiance and good service.

98DslWquC6ypAJZyZcKcZg.review_text: We came to Scoma's after a very touristy sightseeing day.  It is close but is a little bit tucked away from the chaos.  We were able to make a late lunch reservation and were seated quickly. It has a sort of old-school vibe to the decor.   Service was just okay.  Our waiter said they had a full bar and asked if we wanted a drink.  After walking through the crowds, that is exactly what we wanted!  I wasn't into the drink list and tried to order a Dark'n'Stormy which their bartender had never heard of it.  I found rather odd if they have a full bar but was good sticking to the menu. Our waiter really pushed the pre-fixed lunch menu saying it was a good value.  I was a bit hesitant but he said it had Scoma's best items.  We went for it, but in the end I am not sure if it was the right call. Also, at the end of our meal, we felt rushed as it appeared to be shift ending time.  The food was good and fresh.  Their clam chowder was very good and probably my favorite item.  I ordered the Combo Crab & Shrimp Louis salad and my husband ordered the fish of the day (halibut).  The Crab & Shrimp Louis was very fresh and I can see why it is a popular item. My biggest complaint is that I had shell pieces and quite frankly expect better from a restaurant of this quality. My husband's halibut was fresh, perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned.  However, the cheddar polenta that was served with the fish was a bit heavy and didn't seem to fit with the dish. The raspberry desert cake was excellent and not too sweet.   With the service and pre-fixed menu choice, I am not sure we had the chance to really get the best taste of Scoma's.

_DjHX8PiDjiCZMltk1xmIA.review_text: Delicious food and great ambiance. We ate in the lounge and had our food in no time. Great service.

tomfu0FxcBYnzPep6fBRpQ.review_text: First time at Scoma's.  Very highly recommended by trusted locals. Everybody knows the prices fall in line with the you get what you pay for addage.  Enjoyed the sampler fried calamari -- Very light, fresh and delicious.    Crab cake -- Fresh, light, and light on crab meat, but it is an appetizer, fair.  Dressings / Dips taste made in house.  Nice garlic in the garlic dip for the sampler along with the house thousand and not too great cocktail sauce.  Whole dungeoness crab roasted in Garlic butter.  What a treat that was.  Full of crab meat and lovely garlic butter sauce.  Uncle ordered the " lazy man's chippino " .  More less tomato soup with fish and shellfish.  --Average.  Nice meal.  High price.  Great service.  Summarily, Scomas met my expectation.

ABgBS-exY_H1whm7PG_umQ.review_text: I visit San Francisco about twice a year and I have to eat a Scoma's every time I do. The service and food is wonderful. Now if I can only figure out their Scallop recipe then life would be complete. I'll see you again in 2015!

F8Zm1Dg6mRQHWTTZADb-Jg.review_text: Crowds of people at this restaurant, which can only mean one thing:  the food must be good!  I looked forward to satisfying my fresh seafood cravings here.    The food is pretty pricey.  But their plates do come with A LOT of seafood.  I ordered the clam chowder and a pasta dish which came with scallops, shrimp, TWO lobster tails, and clams. My husband ordered the lobster bisque and Lazy Man's Cioppino.  The clam chowder was delicious.  The lobster bisque was also good, but I thought it lacked lobster meat.  My pasta was very bland!  I completely regret even eating as much pasta as I did since it filled me up and I had a hard time eating the most important things on my plate...the seafood!  I thought the Cioppino was great.  Lots of fresh seafood and the broth/soup was tasty with a little kick.    The service is quick and attentive.  There's also free parking in the back of the restaurant, so you don't have to pay for pricey parking in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

ycY6H7FoIkvTs4DWfTnR2w.review_text: The food was outstanding. We tried it all and it did not disappoint. Staff was very friendly and service was great. Would definitely go back.

NMaHUBl_u5iVCC5MYUdqXw.review_text: Stumbled upon this place while walking around Fisherman's Wharf. Our waiter, John B., was AMAZING. I wanted to take him home with me! We started off with an excellent oyster trio & app platter. The oysters were good but I've had better. I had the swordfish piccata for dinner & would definitely get it again. The swordfish was a huge piece of fish & the flavor was delicious.  Overall, we had a great experience & I would definitely go back. Not sure if they take reservations but I would recommend going early if you don't as the place was packed by 6pm.

sm2y3sRhy7oDfZw5RjbFQA.review_text: Didn't measure up to a 5 star place . Good was okay but it lacked presentation.

gIKP4KsBfTbfiQ7yHplxEA.review_text: Second visit here.. love the food... the ambiance is nice and romantic. prefer coming here for dinners

WDyILww9HxfTwq5zKOGymw.review_text: Mediocre, overpriced seafood at astronomical prices!!    This place is old-school, in the sense that it's a flashback to the restaurants of yester-year:  white table cloth, aging male servers who are politely brusque, middle-aged tourists and older diners who have had too many cocktails and have gotten a bit too loud for the comfort of their neighboring tables, uninventive "classic" recipes that all too often remind us of just how far this country has come recently in terms of culinary creativity...and therefore how much of a dinosaur this restaurant really is.  My biggest objection:  The prices.  $15 for shrimp cocktail???  $7 for garlic bread????  $16 for a spinach and goat cheese salad?????   And most offensively, $26 for penne bolognese???????  It would be one thing if the food really were exquisite, an explosion of new, creative flavors in your mouth, the sensation of "oh my GAWD this is SO GOOD, I can't eat enough of it!!!"  But that's not what I felt here.  Instead, as I dined on a fairly by-the-book Lobster Newburg ($36), I couldn't help but wonder why I was feeling so "meh" about lobster, ie, my FAVORITE FOOD IN THE WORLD!!!  It was just sort of...bland.  And why the steep prices?  The portions weren't large.  The boring ol' steamed veggies on the plate didn't lend me any clues.  And my friend's flacid pasta didn't give me any answers, either.  The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't exciting.  And since we weren't sitting near a window, and it was also nighttime, it's not like we were enjoying any exquisite view.    And then I remembered:  I'm on Fisherman's Wharf.  I never go here, because it's famous for one thing, and one thing only:  tourism.  Aha.  So when someone comes to San Francisco and opens a guide book, they see Scoma's listed as being located in a tony location on the wharf in what all their not-from-San-Francisco friends tell them is the area of the city they simply MUST go see (because certainly there is NOTHING to do in SF unless you see Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf!!!  Ooo, don't forget to buy an Alcatraz t-shirt!!!!  Otherwise, how will people know you've been to SF?!).  And they suddenly rationalize paying $26 for an average bowl of pasta and meat sauce.  Because after all, there WAS a white table cloth, so certainly this MUST be a classy joint, a San Francisco landmark!
