Listen, people:  if you want to experience really good Italian food and/or seafood, there are a ZILLION better restaurants in San Francisco to go to.  A little research will reward you with a dinner at a far more delicious (and reasonably priced!) restaurant in town!  Sure, you may not be able to buy an "Alcatraz Triathalon" t-shirt on your walk back to the hotel, but you'll have a far more genuine and exciting culinary journey if you venture outside of the Fisherman's Wharf bubble.  Scoma's might've been what spelled class to your grandparents back in the day, but nowadays we've come so far from over-priced entrees made up of protein, pasta, and a heap of limp, favorless steamed veggies....

6foXESDaUTxXLmp0V1T-JQ.review_text: 2.5 STARS. I gotta say, the view is beautiful, but the food was just alright. This place is very outdated, a little bit too old school for my liking. If this place got a revamp, it would be so much better!  Ordered the lobster bisque, forgettable. Okay, honestly I don't even remember the name of the entree I got which is really sad considering I remember almost everything I eat. This is how forgettable the food was. I just remember it being overcooked fish with different sauces and broth that were all mixed together with some vegetables plopped around it. The dessert was not good - got the brownie.  Would never come back here, but the reason for 3 stars instead of 2 was for the service. The waiter we had was incredibly sweet. Although he didn't really pay attention to us, he was really nice when he did. It was a very casual and comfortable dining experience that I can see regulars coming in and ordering their favorites. The view is pretty nice, and the location is great if your'e a tourist and want to go walk around the pier aftewards. Okay, just to give you an idea about the unsatisfaction of this 3 course meal, I bought a whole steamed crab from the pier after and ate it all.

qolJVR7HE5vbvzQppINCCQ.review_text: It is what it is... Touristy?  Yes.  Old school?  Yes.  Crowded with long waits?  Yes.  Big prices?  Yes.  It's all on Yelp, and it's all true.  But you're on Fisherman's wharf, and this is a good representation of fresh seafood in an exceptional location.  Is it 5 stars?  No.  But it's good, especially if you know what to get.  Get the Cioppino.  It's great by any standard.  Lots of seafood in a tasty tomato-based broth.  Add two pieces of garlicky toast dipped in the broth, and you have heaven on earth - $38.  Yeah, it could have more clams or more mussels or whatever someone else has critiqued here.  Forget all that.  It is what it is.  A very memorable Cioppino with enough left over for another two or three meals.  Mmmmmm.  Don't be a hater.  Quit qvetching and enjoy a world-class Cioppino and the view!

ypT08Su2vSeFZfsVm1sqbA.review_text: I had high hopes for this place. I took my friend from out of town to the Fisherman's Wharf area and checked Yelp for good seafood restaurants. Scoma's was the highest rated place. We stopped in around 1pm on a Saturday and were seated within 20 minutes.   Started with the hot sampler trio for our appetizer. Not impressed. Calamari was a bit soggy and not flavorful. Scampi was worse. Crab cakes were decent but not as good as I expected from such a highly rated place. I had the fried scallops for my main course and was not impressed with that dish either. I left my plate half full.

PezOw_38vSaZEFJhFvSCKg.review_text: I had a waitress recommended meal and it was the best meal at the table.  I had one of the specials for the night with sauteed crab.  It was seriously amazing.  I did not enjoy how long it took for our orders to be taken.  But everything else was really good.

8JC0TnD1YQMTMyAOuDM56Q.review_text: I've been here twice so far and I really like the generous portions. It's nice to get away from the hussle and bussle of the touristy fishermans warf area and drive your car into valet parking, hop out, and get seated. We only waited about five minutes after having a opentable reservation. We were seated next to the waterfront and served with bread and water.  For appetizers, we started off with the crispy calmari. Lightly fried to perfection and so flavorful! The two options of dipping sauce: tartar sauce or cocktail sauce. YUM! Oh boy did it not disappoint!  I ordered The Diplomatica ($38) with linguine and red sauce. They don't mess around with seafood here and I found my plate with 2 lobster tails, a handful of clams, 5-6 scallops, and 2 shrimps. The sauce, the pasta, and the seafood was cooked to heavenly perfection. I could only finish half my plate! Bf ordered Steamed "skookum" Clams ($25) and comes with the biggest bowl topped with clams. The butter, garlic sauce is delicious and i found myself putting down the clams and just drinking the sauce!  If you're looking for a place for a business meal, birthday lunch, celebration, or a simple lunch and dinner, you will not be disappointed! The only thing that I get frustrated with are the stuck up waiters. The first time I came, I felt like the waiter was snobby. This past time, our waiter was even worse. When we inquired about the specials, he sarcastically said, "everything on the menu is a special!" Then proceeded to point out some things and laugh at the prices and said it was a "good deal..sort of" The only reason why we asked was because there were some dishes on yelp but we didn't see on the menu.. Anyway, after the meal when about to eat dessert, they usually take a knife and scrape off the crumbs. Nope, he didn't bother. Didn't felt taken care of at all by him. The other staff was very helpful on clearing our tables and refilling our drinks. I guess they make the most tip on large parties, business people, or "fancier" people drinking wine but he really didn't make us feel like we belonged there.   I give this place two thumbs up but prepared to spend $50+/person for dinner!

GFUA6QtkOAleazw0TBoGUw.review_text: The best lobster bisque in the world and the crab is great.  The potatoes were different. They taste more like a dessert. However, the service was great and I'll be back soon.

a0e_V4wvBCa2yTnrfavcCA.review_text: I loved this place and will definitely go back!  I saw it on TV and it looked really good.   A couple of my cousins ordered the lamb that was in the Prix Fixe menu and it was delicious!!  My brother got the smoked salmon and shrimp Alfredo and that was pretty good too.  I had the dungeness crab risotto and that too was also pretty good.  It's hard to describe in words how good I thought the food was here.  I think you should just go try it out for yourself!  Oh, and there is free Valet parking!!

xy_BYX2jniJyQpVLGMTpIQ.review_text: great dinner! Seafood heaven!!! Looking for a good dinner, come here! Been around since 1965. Pricey but worth it.

mI0_hOKm7g-iN7A3wSwXxQ.review_text: Are you kidding me?  A great spot in San Francisco in the harbor. Great fish, great service and overall just an amazing place. Love it.

XDobuOFvYDwcOIbr66Y1RQ.review_text: so my boss recommended this place based solely on their famous cioppino. Being italian i was intrigued, i'm from Boston and love seafood. I'm also italian and love italian food. Combining both was bound to be good. I was not disappointed!  First, this place is expensive. The bill for the soup alone came to around $50. But high cost does not diminish the experience. Scoma's is a CLASSIC place, the kind of place you want to take your wife on special occasions. Places like that are worth it.  Second, the ambiance is old town San Francisco from the North Beach of the 1960's. This is a place that the wise guys used to come for the best food around. I was most definitely in my element.   Third, the food... WOW. As soon as I ordered the cioppino Salvatore advised me that I didn't need to order anything else. Now I can eat but I got a little nervous about the breadstick i had eaten. When the food arrived I realized Salvatore was right, this was a huge bowl of seafood with a big slice of garlic bread. But having walked to the restaurant through the cold and wind i was ready. In fact that made it better, warm soup on a cold day. The broth was heavenly, i sipped most of the broth before I started on the fish. Now most fish in soups gets a little tough as it cooks. Somehow this fish was incredibly tender, the cod, the scallops, the clams and shrimp, it was all delicious.  Lastly, the people. Everyone was awesome! Salvatore was a true professional. Salvatore was hard working, knowledgeable, friendly. I was very lucky to have him as a server. Then the chef, Donnie Grey, came out and talked to me about the cioppino. Donnie was a great guy, very down to earth and friendly. He treated me like I was a celebrity!  Scoma's is a four star restaurant and a San Francisco landmark! I would highly recommend it if you're visiting with someone special and you want a romantic night out or you want to celebrate a special occasion....or if you just want GREAT food and service. i know I will be back whenever I am in San Francisco again.

DOjR-B_JMCxh10MxVGnozw.review_text: Get here early.  We were there on Saturday night, about 5:30pm.  Walked right in.  But about 6pm it started filling up.  By the time we left, people were waiting outside.  I had not been here in about 15 years, still had the same high quality food that I remembered.   My Finance and I ordered the Filet and Lobster and it was devine.  Served with mixed veggies and awesome mashed potatoes.  The Filet was thick, juicy, moist and tender.  Cooked to perfection, and not a single piece of fat on it.    The Lobster was absolutely amazing.  Big 12oz tail, very tender and with the melted butter to dip it in, it was mouth-waterting.  We shrared this meal, along with a cup of the best clam chowder ever.    The service was great, fast but still enough time to enjoy the meal and the scenery (old crusty boats at the dock).  That was funny.  The meal was priced at $80, which I cringed at.  But when we got into the meal, I felt it was worth it.  We don't get to San Fran very often.  I highly recommend Scoma's to anyone that loves seafood.  For some people it's a little hard to find, just look for the big orange sign down the alley way.  You won't be disappointed.

Wj0tIFlWz_1Uam1VDWYG5g.review_text: Wow, LOVE this place!  Pricey, but I gotta say their seafood dishes were simply spectacular!  Service was great too!      Smack dab along a main Fisherman's Wharf artery; If you're walking or driving, just trust what google maps says and head down Al Scoma Way!  You'll find this place at the end, with free valet parking waiting for ya.  We arrived at approximately 4:20pm on a Saturday, and it didn't seem to busy.  The hostess greeted us, and we were waited on by Chris.  He had some good descriptions and recommendations from the menu.  Honestly, I was NOT planning on paying more than $15 for a pasta dish. UNTIL one of the servers passed by, and presented another table with a huge plate of seafood pasta!  The little devil on my shoulder said, "Screw it you cheap bastard, you're gettin' that dish!"     I ordered the Diplomatica ($38), and this made for all the reason to write my review.  It had two small lobster tails, fresh shrimp, perfectly cooked soft scallops, and clams.  With linguine noodles drowning in a savory white cream sauce.  Maybe a bit too saucey, but just add some parmesan cheese and you're good!  So glad I tried this, and I had mega-leftovers!    The gf ordered the Mixed Seafood Grill ($39) with penne pasta, rice, veggies, shrimp, scallops, and two small sized lobster tails.  You can tell all of the seafood were fresh because there were just juicy; Not overcooked, and again made perfectly well!  If you cannot decide on what to order, this huge dish will absolutely satisfy.  It's a mix of everything, so you can't really go wrong with this one.  Oh yeah, the appetizers:  The Calamari!  Soft and well breaded!  Another winner!  The sour dough was good, but I was expecting it to be warm.  No biggie!  Our server started out with Chris who was very polite and funny.  His shift ended and we were waited on by CC.  Both were well attentive, and always filled our water glasses.  One minor mistake was serving my Diplomatica to the gf and vice versa.  Also no biggie, but as a compliment we were given some Lady Fingers for free.  Those Lady Fingers were a nice crunchy sweet treat!  I'll absolutely come back, because there's much try like the "Lazy Man's" Cioppino and the King Salmon.  But if I were to recommend anything, it would be to try something that has shrimp or scallops, or both!

2joga52mJyQH6BT0hfvlpA.review_text: Service was on point! Trio appetizer with calamari, shrimp scampi, and crab cakes was delicious. For dinner my mom and I split the King salmon with lobster ravioli And it was amazing! Next time we come to San Francisco from the east coast we will definitely come back!

EIWpCT54fxYgwri-8Ct5cA.review_text: On a recent work trip to San Francisco, we decided to follow the recommendation of several locals to dine at Scoma's.  We parked in front of Doubin bread and walked to the restaurant.  From the outside, the restaurant looks small, but once you walk in you are immediately transported into a wonderful, roomy restaurant with a warm vintage feel to it.  We thought we were going to have to wait for quite a while, however our table for two was ready within minutes.    Our waiter was a pleasant gentleman named Ray.  He took our drink order and then gave us plenty of time to look over the menu.  I decided to order the cup of clam chowder and the cracked dungeness crab.  As we waited for our meal, Ray brought fresh sourdough bread to our table.    I am very picky about clam chowder, so I was apprehensive about ordering it.  That clam chowder was the BEST clam chowder I have ever had.  Ever.  I could eat it for lunch or dinner every day.  If you like clam chowder - REAL clam chowder - do yourself a favor and order a cup of it.  For $9.00, you are getting a true taste of heaven.  The Dungeness crab was very good. Having grown up on the Chesapeake Bay, I've never had "roasted" crab, so this was a fun treat.    I would definitely eat there again, if I ever make my way back out to San Francisco!

1VL37A_wk_t67j-WdDecpA.review_text: We decided to celebrate our wedding anniversary with dinner here and were thrilled with our evening. We started at the bar where I had a great Jamison and Ginger courtesy of Phil, the bartender. For dinner, hubby started with some clam chowder and we both agreed it was amazing! I started with a house salad which was simple yet so fresh that it was a perfect way to start the meal. Hubby chose the Cioppino which is something they are known for. It was a huge portion and could easily have been shared, but he thought it was wonderful. I had the grilled salmon with lobster ravioli and thought it was excellent. It was a perfect combination of decadence with light and healthy. Because our waiter knew that we were celebrating our anniversary, he brought us a wonderful chocolate dessert to finish off our evening.

G4sv-tyShHFbleUFODS__w.review_text: A family ritual. No trip to the city is complete without a trip to Scomas. They have valet for customers-only. Delicious food, pasta, two bars, elegant service. Worth the prices!!!

-F_nkJiaARGv5tsLZPw4uA.review_text: One of my favorite places to go when I am in San Fran, My Dad loved this place and we carry on the tradition when we come to town, the food is fantastic and the service is impeccable. Just be prepared to spend some money.

kMdUDZ0bOEECJfPBn6izBw.review_text: Very touristy but the food was fairly good.   Neat collection of photos from people who have visited over the past 100 years.  I'm sad to say I could not try the crab cakes or the lobster bisque as both had bell peppers.

X8niKKANe_S4qjNUQiSvug.review_text: Sighs... Yet another sign things are changing.  Stormy and I visited Fisherman's Wharf this week and all the places of our childhood had gone to pot. Where have the good seafood restaurants gone? They've turned into Scoma. Its tucked away so you have to hunt it down. That's a good thing.  Stormy managed to wolf down a garlic baked Dungeness Crab faster than I've ever seen her eat anything in my life. She almost passed out from the sheer bliss.  I had ok lamb chops (word guys... you must scrap the soot off the grill occasionally. Tasting ash on a chop or a steak is not a good thing!).  Great wine list. Surprisingly good beet, bleu and romaine salad to end the evening.

_O8i06dJM4NTIVHy26bjuQ.review_text: Pros:  Free valet parking, decent wine prices, rock shrimp scampi, calamari, New England clam chowder, and lobster tail  Cons:  No reservations, had a couple of the lunch specials that I wouldn't recommend - swordfish and ahi sandwich were just "okay"

1G7tKAJfR8J4s9BAOV0_Qw.review_text: Our favorite place to eat.  I always love the sand dabs and probably a good thing they seem to run out from time to time because then I get to try more items on the menu.  Baked Crab=amazing Oysters= nice variety and for oyster lover its awesome Cioppino=amazing (and very large good for 2 people) Scallops= cooked to perfection Calamari-amazing  maybe the dirty martinis helped but this place is worth the wait everytime

FRxcVEYqm7-jpWPTapPhbQ.review_text: Outstanding.  In what can be an otherwise touristy area, this slightly off the beaten path restaurant deserves every single one of these 5 stars.  Fresh, fresh, fresh!  The server informed us of the fish that had been caught THAT DAY (some from their own boat), that would be available on the menu.  We started with delicious west coast oysters, that were some of the best I've had.  Then, I got the rock cod (caught that day) and the person I was dining with got the scallops.  I will also say, that the scallops were some of the best scallops I have had.  My rock cod was great too!  I almost forgot the dungeness crab cocktail - not to be missed.  Wine was reasonable, white coat service - overall, a highlight of the trip.

dw2vrp4tYOACJW-WriVoJQ.review_text: Last night I decided with some of my friends to go here instead of another restaurant in North Beach for my birthday. Just becuase I couldn't find parking. So me and my girlfriends got there and parked outside without the valet just becuase we didn't know they even had it. big mistake. I admit we should had researched the place before going becuase it would had saved us time and pain from our heels walking to that place that seemed secluded.  It took a 20 minute wait without reservation, which is good but all in all it was good. I'm a fan :)

YnHf1BPFjfj3kK_i1AC4rQ.review_text: What can I say been here many times! Not a bad thing to say and Thomas if you are reading this hire more people like Tony he was awsome! To all you newbies I suggest The "Lazy Man's" Cioppino its the best I have ever tried.

jXuYKE2Bdy4OfCMNrrbdNQ.review_text: The food was good quality and very tasty... With that taste came the pricing... It was pretty pricey for a decent meal. Although the cost of our two person dinner exceeded the $140 mark, it was still an enjoyable experience.

5iDzVdP47uWAf8cu56otOQ.review_text: Service was a bit slow granted we may not have been the favorite customers of the night. We came in 15 min before close. The garlic crab was SUPERB. Sadly though it came with no sides. With my half order of crab at $21, you were to pick from sides that were $7-$10. If you're wanting something that's going to fill you to max capacity at a reasonable price don't go here! If you don't mind spending $35 a plate, for good food, just not a lot of it go!! The homemade sourdough was delicious.

eOh8I5t_FqsRWSD_3SwNAA.review_text: If it weren't for Dine About Town (3 courses for $35pp), I don't think I would come here.  $30+ for a plate of mediocre seafood pasta? I'd pass!!! Well, I can't completely blame them since it's in the touristy part of town.    I like that this restaurant has valet parking and it is beyond spacious, but the whole atmosphere (wall decor, customers, employees) made me feel 20 years older than what I really am.  Other than that, the food was good.   We ordered: Dungeness Crab Cakes, Lobster Bisque, Char Broiled Fresh Ahi , Seared Dry Pack Sea Scallops on Linguine Pomodoro, Pumpkin Cheesecake, and Tirimisu  My favorites of the night were the crab cakes, lobster bisque (best I've had so far), and scallops.  I actually had scallops for lunch on the same day and the scallops here were wayyyyy better.  Why? Because the scallops were "dry packed", meaning there were no chemical additives which in effect tasted sweeter, bouncier, more flavorful, and more tender.   Thanks to Scoma's, I am now on a "dry packed" lookout.

dsBY5eS8qMdzLcc2EGWRig.review_text: I went here on a Sunday afternoon with my family who introduced me to this place. I highly suggest getting a reservation when coming here because it gets packed pretty early. We ordered some oysters, seafood pasta, lobster ravioli, clams, calamari, and a mixed seafood grill. Everyone also had their own little bowl of clam chowder. I can honestly say that everything was delicious!!! Seafood was very fresh and portions are pretty big. I was stuffed after sharing all of that with 5 other people. On top of that, the service is also amazing. Just thinking about this place makes me want to go back! This is a must visit especially if your a tourist!
